review: Nice hidden object game with a good story about rescue from a Bioshock like underwater complex. Of course a lot of walking is involved as well as lots of items and mini games, all quite easy. The story kept me motivated till the end. Fun for a rainy day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029793720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1704605725}
review:
Not as long or complex as some of their other games, and the graphics are a little more rough (especially when talking to people), but the spooky atmosphere and plot make up for it.  The bonus chapter is about one of the characters you meet, and is quite well done. ^-^

Note, there are some miss-labeled search items:
Sea rod = seaweed
Spatula = scraper (once)
Murrain = Moray
Pendant = keychain (once)

author: {'steamid': '76561199249239770', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1703412623}
review:
applause to this old-but-gold artifex game from 2012. it tackles the mystery of the ocean depths and the abyss entangled within it, as well as the mystery of the MC's missing fiancÃ©e. the voice acting are not too bad, but the overall story is very well-thought of. the puzzles are your casual AM, nothing too fancy about it.

i think im starting to get that when i played this a few years ago, i found it way scarier back then. however, as i am playing right now, they're not as scary anymore. i found that maybe it's with the dramatic use of zooms in through the course of the story[spoiler]and the dark entity haunting Eden[/spoiler]. this, combined with the dramatic zooms make it a surprise and a jumpscare. if you do have a faint of heart, i recommend you to be a little cautious while playing.

few notes to point out:
- there are no collectibles implemented
- inventory cannot be locked (to view or not view the inventory bar all the time)
- no fast teleport through map

i have yet to 100% the achievements (expert and domino run), and despite the notes i have taken down, the course of this story is well-written and my first play-through lasted for three hours and a little. hence, i rate this game [u]8.5/10[/u], giving a thumbs up for a recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025482230', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 758, 'last_played': 1699154185}
review:
I previously played 9 Clues, The Ward, a game by the same people, and enjoyed this one as well. Again, a good game if you're a fan of the Mystery Case Files games.

Pros
-Puzzles remain varied enough to be engaging.
-Option of playing dominoes if you get stuck on the hunt scenes.
-Story was decent.

Cons
-There is a lot of back-tracking in this title.
-The frame rate in the hunt/domino scenes from the extra content  dropped so bad for me that they were nearly unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561199093031212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1698896158}
review:
Enjoyed this. It's got the usual HO logic and I sometimes didn't really understand what was going on. It's pretty easy and I completed it fairly quickly. I liked the setting but I wanted a bit more detail on WHY they were living underwater and for how long.

The Hidden Object scenes were mostly wordlist type and they weren't that complicated. I felt like they should have made the scenes more crowded because some of the objects were huge and hard to miss. There were quite a few translation mistakes, e.g. I spent some time looking for "Baseball bat" before realising it was the animal bat. So they could have been more careful in giving the translators actual pictures rather than just translating the words.

Anyway, it was a quick enjoyable playthrough. Not the worst but not the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020889645', 'num_games_owned': 6972, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1697442188}
review:
Ciudades bajo el agua, pelea entre facciones, entes sobrenaturales, posesiones, locura y gente intentando escapar de las profundidades, es como el Bioshock de los juegos de Objetos Ocultos.

Es un juego con una historia interesante pero que no se aprovecha como deberÃ­a, al principio cuando te van adentrando te da esa sensaciÃ³n de que va a tener una historia muy buena pero se va para abajo muy rÃ¡pido, el principal problema es que no la desarrollan bien, no profundizan mÃ¡s en los eventos y recae en solo contar y mostrar lo que esta ocurriendo en el momento hasta llegar a un punto en el que sientes que lo que cuenta es irrelevante, lo que medio salva las cosas es la historia del contenido extra porque te cuenta el inicio del conflicto pero hubiera estado bien que la aventura principal revelara mÃ¡s detalles.

En cuestiÃ³n de puzzles y objetos ocultos esta bastante bien, tiene puzzles muy ingeniosos y originales y los eventos de objetos ocultos estÃ¡n buenos, algo que me gustÃ³ de estos es que algunos objetos requieren acciones adicionales para ser encontrados y tambiÃ©n que puedes cambiar el evento por un mini-juego de dominÃ³, me parecieron buenas ideas para darle mÃ¡s dinamismo al juego, por otro lado, un problema que hay en algunos eventos es que los nombres de los objetos estÃ¡n mal traducidos, no son muchos, pero si da problemas al momento de buscar.

GrÃ¡ficamente es muy agradable a la vista, maneja bien los colores, los tonos verdes, azules y la saturaciÃ³n, artÃ­sticamente muy prolijo, rico en detalles, las animaciones esas si no fueron totalmente de mi agrado, como que no tienen tanta calidad y muchas de ellas son innecesarias por lo mismo que les contaba sobre la historia, pero de ahÃ­ en mÃ¡s es un juego hermoso.

Sobre la mÃºsica no tengo mucho que decir, como es costumbre en este gÃ©nero pasa muy desapercibida, en este caso en particular me parece que esta bien, tiene ese sentimiento misterioso y oscuro, es el tipo de mÃºsica que esperas para un juego de esta temÃ¡tica.

En general me ha parecido buen juego, los puzzles y mini-juegos son muy entretenidos, visualmente luce muy bien, la mÃºsica esta bien y la historia pues no es mala aunque si deja mucho que desear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300297476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1693767036}
review:
Trying to 100% this game felt like an exercise in madness. I have played through this game 7 times. It should have taken me 3.
While playing through to attempt to get all the domino achievements (the last set of achievements I needed), I made a mistake and auto-pilot solved one of the mini-hogs. So, rather than play through to the end knowing I wouldn't get all the achievements and would have to do it all again, I deleted the profile (as I have done before in these sorts of games) and started again.

Fast-forward to the end of the domino run, the credits roll and I have one achievement still missing. The one you get for gaining all the other achievements. So, in order to unlock it, I have to redo all the other achievements on the new profile. At this point, I'm annoyed, but not ready to tear my hair out over it.

So I go back in on expert mode. By now, I know this game pretty well so it's quick at least. I get to the end, skipping through all the cutscenes...but the trophy doesn't unlock. I still haven't got my collector achievement.

I had to play through it all again. And it was at that point that my good will towards this game broke. It certainly wasn't my favourite artifex mundi game before all the BS, it was pretty forgettable overall.

My biggest gripe is the elevator where you have to cycle through slow-ass animations to get to the right floor rather than being able to select a floor...like every other elevator in every other hidden object game. Seriously, why was it designed this way? Even on the final run where I knew the game like the back of my hand so there were no wasted clicks, I still felt like I spent 10% of my total playtime time stuck in that accursed elevator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097473222', 'num_games_owned': 2748, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1693335016}
review:
Title: The Wraiths of Eden Review

Rating: 4/5 â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†

Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden invites players to embark on an enthralling underwater adventure that blends mystery, suspense, and hidden object gameplay seamlessly. Developed by Artifex Mundi, the game immerses players in a world of exploration and discovery, weaving a captivating tale of intrigue beneath the waves.

Set against a hauntingly beautiful backdrop of the ocean's depths, Abyss excels in creating an atmosphere that's both eerie and enchanting. The underwater environments are meticulously crafted, capturing the sense of isolation and wonder that comes with delving into the unknown. From the mysterious wrecks to the forgotten ruins, each location is rich with detail, making the exploration a visual delight.

The storyline in Abyss is a highlight of the game, combining elements of psychological horror and supernatural phenomena. As players navigate through the various environments, they uncover a captivating narrative that gradually unfolds, revealing the chilling secrets of the underwater city of Eden. The plot is well-paced and keeps players engaged, and the voice acting lends an additional layer of depth to the characters and their struggles.

One of the core gameplay mechanics involves finding hidden objects in cluttered scenes, which fits seamlessly within the context of the game's exploration theme. The puzzles scattered throughout the adventure strike a balance between challenging and satisfying, with a variety of difficulty levels to cater to different players. The inclusion of a map and hint system ensures that players won't get stuck, promoting a steady flow of progress without compromising the challenge.

While Abyss boasts impressive visuals and an intriguing storyline, there are some minor drawbacks. The point-and-click interface, while functional, can feel a bit clunky at times, particularly when trying to interact with specific objects. Additionally, the voice acting, though generally well done, can occasionally come across as slightly over-the-top, potentially taking players out of the immersive experience.

In conclusion, Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a compelling and atmospheric adventure that successfully marries exploration, puzzle-solving, and an engaging narrative. Its beautifully designed underwater world, coupled with a well-crafted storyline, makes for an enjoyable experience that keeps players hooked from start to finish. Despite a few minor flaws, Abyss offers an immersive journey into the depths of mystery and suspense that's well worth undertaking for fans of the genre.

review:
Well... It's OK. This is a HO/P&C game with the usual stuff. The graphics are okay. The music is decent. The story is simple and not very bright, a low point.

No bugs or crashes.

Overall, entertaining but not too much. The story, as said, it's kinda dumb. The puzzles are good, not too easy or too hard. The level design is competent. It's a decent pastime, long enough for your money. It includes cards and achievements. I gonna give it a thumbs up but it is not cause it was very good but because there's nothing really bad. Meh+.

Now that I have adult money, I'm spending it on adult things like Artifex Mundi games that I used to play on my dad's tablet when I was 12 (but never completed because my family didn't want to pay for the full version). 

Wonder whether the Dark Arcana: Carnival game is related to this? Maybe it's in the same universe? Excited to find out

author: {'steamid': '76561199090044434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1687155972}
review:
Is it the best HOG from this developer? No.

There is NO fast travel, so be prepared for the back tracking. There aren't any collectibles or morphing objects either. 

Plot is decent enough, the voice actors did there best. The facial animations though.... really off putting. 

If you haven't played the Grim Legends series or Enigmatis Trilogy, I would absolutely recommend those first. But if you just need something mindless to lose time with. This will get the job done.

I would give this 3 out of 5 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206161011', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1236, 'last_played': 1683671269}
review:
Los grÃ¡ficos dejan un poco que desear en algunos momentos, sobretodo cuando se interacciona con otros personas, aunque esto tampoco es un gran problema ya que no es de los que trata el juego. Los puzzles son algunos mÃ¡s difÃ­ciles que otros, pero en general cualquier persona promedio deberÃ­a ser capaz de realizarlos sin mayor problema.

Si quieres un juego tranquilo, de misterio donde no te estreses mucho (aunque aviso hay algunos jumpscares) y simplemente disfrutes de una historia con puzzles, esta es una buena elecciÃ³n.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207083779', 'num_games_owned': 1292, 'num_reviews': 853, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1684805993}
review:
GOOD.  It's just a fine, interesting H.O.G.!  Oh and those underwater sound effects?  I for some reason really like them.  All that sushi swimming around too...  *Drools*.

HOWEVER...  IT doesn't let you teleport to a spot...  So heh heh...  You know what that means!!!

I gotta say this...  If the bad guys REALLY wanted to stop her, it could've sabotaged the elevator!

I also noticed that kids weren't possessed...  Guess they aren't fun to possess.

Then I realized why they no break elevator...

HEY BAD GUY...  NEXT TIME?  Don't freaking throw THE WEAPON that can KILL YOU...  AT THE HERO/INE...  Seriously that octopus thing...  Tsk tsk...

First time to get all H.O. locations with no hints and no skips on Mini games!  *PROUD*

THANK YOU!  Keep on having you know what.  Fun.  It was FUN, darn it!  :3 =) :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198058703321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1683241460}
review: Terrible writing, major plot holes, cliches, etc. "Joke" achievement in bad taste. Setting is a bioshock ripoff by a writer too stupid to understand the political side of the story so they just copy pasted a standard demonic possession into it. Unimaginative and out of place. Puzzles are very easy, game is finished at time of writing, 2 hours playtime total counting the toilet break and me facepalming for about 15 min.

author: {'steamid': '76561198227400828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1692585582}
review: No he jugado Bioshock aÃºn, asÃ­ que no puedo decir si se parece o no. Lo que si puedo decir es que este juego, Abyss los espectros del EdÃ©n,esta  bueno: tiene puzzles entretenidos y lÃ³gicos, aunque con alguno que otro tuve que recurrir a pistas, especificamente en el de la ardilla que mucho no lo entendÃ­, pero bueno. La parte de objetos ocultos tambien es entretenida, pero algunos se me hicieron muy fÃ¡ciles y obvios. La historia esta buena, tiene un final previsible que le encaja, y cae en lugares comunes, sin mencionar que a veces se vuelve confusa, pero el escenario marino y los hechos aterradores que ocurren le dan una buena ambientaciÃ³n y te mantiene entretenido mientras te lleva por los minijuegos. La parte grafica es bonita y colorida como acostumbra ser en este tipo de juegos, aunque el CGI usado se ve raro y un poco uncanny valley. Las voces son bastante monocordes, pero no llegan a molestar.  No les va a volar la cabeza, pero si van a tener una experiencia agradable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986657824', 'num_games_owned': 984, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1680721028}
review:
No me has gustado demasiado. No es que sea malo, pero comparado con otros del mismo estilo, creo que falla bastante. El argumento es muy malo, los grÃ¡ficos, lo acostumbrado de este estilo, aunque los personajes dan miedo (hasta los buenos, esas niÃ±as...) y los puzzles, sin pena ni gloria, lo habitual. La traducciÃ³n de los juegos de pistas es algo mala y fallarÃ¡s algunas o te costarÃ¡ sacarlas a no ser que le des al coco para pensar a quÃ© se estÃ¡n refiriendo.

Por otro lado, si eres completista, odiarÃ¡s tener que pasarte el juego entero de nuevo, sobre todo porque no tiene desplazamiento rÃ¡pido entre ubicaciones, lo que lo hace muyyy tedioso.

En definitiva, no es una mala entrega si lo encuentras muy rebajado, pero sino, creo que los hay mejores. Punto a favor, es bastante mÃ¡s largo de lo que parece en un principio que va a ser.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367598638', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1656772011}
review: This is weirdly one of my favourite HoGs. I remember playing a demo of this years ago when I was a kid, and it left a huge impression on me (especially that one scene with the little girl), and I never forgot about it. And then one day I had a flashback about the name being Abyss and looked for it everywhere... And finally got it now that I'm an adult! I remembered all the puzzles from the beginning of the game and it was just as fun as I remembered it, with the added nostalgia. Objectively, is ti the best HoG? No, but I grew up on it, and it was very nice to complete it after all these years. So I had to replay it a bunch of time to get all the achievements so I can actually feel like I did what I wanted to do all those years ago as a kid :)

author: {'steamid': '76561199144876484', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1671955820}
review: I used to play this game on mobile in like 2013 and i loved it and couldn't find it anywhere until now. I still remember all the puzzles but forgot most of the story. I'm so glad i found it again because it is a really good game and i would definitely recommend it to others :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049823783', 'num_games_owned': 1712, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1670947266}
review:
Estamos ante una aventura point & click traidicional, nada innovadora, tiene muchos puzzles, algunos realmente interesantes (como el del tablero con luces y conexion de cables).
3 niveles de dificultad acorde al jugador para no hacerte sufrir mucho si andas con poca imaginacion (tambien tiene ayudas), es bastante lineal, sobre todo en lo que respecta al uso del inventario y los items que siempre se acumulan siendo pocos, algunos puzzles son poco intuitivos, otros lo son, depende tambien de como uno investigue las areas, lo positivo es que tenes ayudas o posibilidad de saltear puzzles  lo cual ayuda a gente que se quedo sin ideas, es ideal no usarlo pero se agradece que exista dicha opcion.
Hermosos graficos y Escenarios muy bien dibujados, son realmente un lujo, ambientacion muy buena, sonidos bien hechos, hud decente, Muy buena musica, pero la trama de la historia es bastante pobre, es realmente el punto flojo de la entrega igual que su linealidad, es una pena porque cuidaron tanto los demas aspectos y esto que era algo relativamente sencillo de armar lo descuidaron.
Uno siente que solo va a probar su ingenio mientras observa los escenarios y nada mas, lo cual es francamente una lastima.

7.75/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198168834463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1664141227}

Impossible non plus de cliquer sur un lieu sur la carte pour s'y rendre directement et donc obligation de refaire les parcours d'un lieu Ã  l'autre en permanence.
A part Ã§a un point positif pour les dÃ©cors comme l'hÃ´tel englouti dans le style arts dÃ©co.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132503739', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1663950464}
review:
*Note that 1 achievement is possibly broken, causing 2 achievements to be unobtainable at the moment.

[b]My Playtime:[/b] 7.7h (18/20 achievements, played the game 4 times)
[b]My First Playthrough:[/b] 3.1h (advanced difficulty)
[b]Grindy Achievement(s):[/b] No.
[b]Optional Achievement(s):[/b] Yes (14 achievements).
[b]Difficult Achievement(s):[/b] No.

[h1]Intro[/h1]
[b]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/b] is a hidden object game by [i]Artifex Mundi[/i], which follows the same suit as their other games in general. It is a point-and-click game that has hidden object scenes and puzzles mixed into it.

[b]Pros:[/b]
- A lot of puzzles with varying difficulty
- 3 different difficulties to play the game with
- Domino game is available as a substitute for hidden object games
- Hint and skip buttons for casual players

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Some cutscenes can't be skipped
- It's hard to know where the hidden object scenes are in the hardest difficulty unless you know about it beforehand

[b]Specs[/b]
Intel Core i5-9300H 2.40GHz, 8GB RAM, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650

[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
[b]Yes.[/b]
[i]If you like to play hidden object games, buy this game. However, since is short, feel free to buy it at a sale.[/i]

[hr][/hr]
[h1]In-Depth Review[/h1]

[h3]Visuals[/h3]
The game might be old, but that doesn't mean that the visuals are bad. If you can spare the odd-looking character models and blurry cutscenes, the visuals still look good at this age. Although the backgrounds don't look as sharp as recent [i]Artifex Mundi[/i] games, I still found them to be acceptable; the backgrounds look beautiful with various lighting effects, which match their realistic style.

[h3]Story[/h3]
Just like other similar games in general, the story in [b]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/b] merely serves as a way to give a theme to the story. There isn't much to be told except for things related to your objective. I was surprised that they give a lengthy backstory in the bonus content, though. Despite not being used extensively in the main game, it gives a good piece of information on how the area that the characters experienced in the main game came to be.

As for the cutscenes, I liked the suspense. There are a lot of jumpscares that will surprise you with their sudden appearances, and since they are not scary, those who can't stand playing horror games like me still can appreciate them. Moreover, it works well with the mysterious theme that the game has.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=762234156 

[h3]The Game[/h3]
[b]Gameplay[/b]
The gameplay is similar to other [i]Artifex Mundi[/i] games, in which you'll have a point-and-click segment combined with hidden object scenes. You'll explore several screens to find some objects which can be used to advance to other screens. Some hidden objects and puzzles will also be included from time to time, breaking the repetition. The puzzles themself are varied, and the fact that some of them were included to progress the story makes it feel important.

On the other hand, the hidden object scenes are mostly similar. You need to find an object that was listed at the bottom of the page, with some objects locked beneath other mechanics. There is also another variance where you have to find objects based on images instead of words. The good thing is that although some objects can give some challenges to find, they are not hard to find to begin with. If you are having issues with it, you can switch to a domino game, where you can hook a 2-sided piece with another that has the same image on one of the sides to reach some markers.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=350502421 

[b]Length and Difficulty[/b]
Sadly, the game is very short. I managed to finish both the main and bonus content in 3.1h in the advanced difficulty. The game has 3 difficulties that you can choose from at the beginning, with advanced being in the middle. It isn't hard to beat the game either; although it is easy to miss some hidden object scenes, there is a hint and skip button that you can use if you are stuck. I did try to replay the game again to get the other achievements, but it seems that the achievement that requires you to finish the game in the hardest difficulty is broken as I couldn't manage to get it despite finishing the game in that difficulty 3 more times.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Despite its old age, [b]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/b] is still a solid hidden object game for fans of the genre. I particularly like the jumpscare in this game the most. Although some are quite predictable, they still give some suspense in the exploration. 

Gameplay-wise, it has varied puzzles, hidden object scenes, and a domino game that isn't hard to pick up if you don't know how it works. The point-and-click sections are pretty much straightforward, and if you have trouble in any of its segments, the game still offers hint and skip buttons to help you finish it.

review:
I have mixed feelings about this. It's a really nice HOG game with an interesting story and a stunning, creepy environment. The puzzles are pretty nice, but I absolutely hated needing to go back and forth so much, just to get one item and returning through multiple screens + a slow elevator ride just to use it.

Also the dominoes as an option for finding hidden objects had zero excitement and intrigue to it.

I would still recommend it for the rest of the stuff it has, though, but obviously only if you're into these types of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198835430528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1655629707}
review:
An above average hidden object game that is animated and voice acted.

It becomes clear early in the game that in terms of appearance, the design mimics Bioshock. Graphics are decent but animations look clunky and dated. The locations are well-designed and detailed.
There are often inconsistencies in the cutscenes: they display certain visual elements differently than how they appear in the game itself (for example, the BEWARE sign in the elevator). Also, scene elements that can be visible in the background of other scenes might look completely different (for example, the professor's body). There are also items that have been reused from other games (for example, the portrait of the professor looks almost identical to the Priest from Enigmatis).

Sounds are decent. However, the quality of the voice acting is below average which includes some bad acting and low-quality records. The music fits the intended creepy ambience and includes pieces reminiscent of Alien and The X-Files.

The storyline is average.

There is a map available, but it does not allow fast travel. This means that a significant portion of the gameplay consists of backtracking and moving back and forth between opposite corners of the map. The elevator is fine until there are three levels available, and you have to go all the way down or up each time you use it.

There are no collectibles.

The hidden object challenges can be replaced with a rather easy domino game. Note that if you are going for achievements, you should always choose either the hidden object search or the domino game all the way through the whole gameplay.  To get all domino-related achievements, make sure to pick the domino option in the assembly-type hidden object scenes as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054004608', 'num_games_owned': 3276, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1648669263}
review: Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden, a solid hidden object game that really has a great twist in its story and has a great number of animations and gameplay mechanics. I love hidden object games as it really doesn't require a great amount of thinking and just a great flow of clicking on stuff in order to progress through the story. Great game and a quick 4 hours to finish this off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198872224217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 2804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2804, 'last_played': 1651887710}
review: What do i say about this? Let's just say I played this FAR too long to ever want to look at it ever again. Between  having to complete the game on expert, no quick-travel with the map, at least 2 full playthroughs and yet another to mop up another annoying trophy, I should probably not be recommending it. Problem is, it's just kind of average. I skipped through the cut scenes, which were less than pleasant to watch and there are a few gruesome jump scares that might frighten small children. The games were good enough, but after playing the whole game almost 3 times, I'm just tired. I could have saved me some time if I would have looked up a "cheat" for the "Beat a Domino Game in 1 Minute" a LOT earlier. Anyway, there were a few times when I let it run, so probably closer to 30 hours or so. Achievements are fairly easy with the cheat and two runs (one in expert and the other in whatever you want).

author: {'steamid': '76561198062678111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1668577090}
review:
Good game! This is an adventure HOG. The female protagonist goes underwater diving to find her lost fiance.  
I especially liked the intro and ending movie clips.
Map - easy to follow, can't hyper-jump, it shows where you are & where you have an activity to do.
Journal - Nice journal that keeps helpful clues and goals
HOS - clear & sharp images. Each scene includes activities in addition to hidden objects. ;)
Voice acting - Was very nice.  I actually cared what happened to the characters.  
Music & sound effects - all good :)
puzzles & mini games - Most were unique to this game.  They related to the story, & I enjoyed them.  
Skip & Hint button - I always appreciate it.

I think the devs took their time to do a thorough job.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971284198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1645759017}
review:
If you know what to expect, it's a pretty good standard hidden object game similar to other Artifex Mundi games... but I'll have to criticize this one a bit further.

First, it's an obvious story inspired a bit too much on Bioshock. Art Deco utopic city build at the bottom of the ocean, gone wrong. With similar architecture, similar machinery, etc. A bit on the nose.

The story itself has nothing to do with Bioshock and is quite weaker and veers more towards the tropes Artifex Mundi stories tends to go for... no morality lessons and conundrums, just mix up with some pure evil unknown force taking over (also losely inpired in Lovecraft I guess?).

It's easier to understand, which makes it... somewhat more all ages, but sacrifices the depth of a story Bioshock's.

The other thing I noticed more in this one... or perhaps on par with the worst Artifex Mundi games is object inconsistency and making the linearity of it too evident.
For instance, in a few hidden object parts it was clear to me that there was more than an object that corresponded to one of the words... and yet, you need to pick a specific one.
And then the linearity problem is that some locks or mini quests it seems you should be able to solve with a few different objects, but you are forced to get and use a specific one.  I noticed this in a few Artifex Mundi games already.
One too many times you seem to use a useful object once and throw it away instead of keeping it around to be used later on. So you end up going back and forth a few times to get the same or very similar tool to do something.

Finally, a problem that a few other Artifex Mundi games also have is the obvious way a game is going, you can do nothing about it even though you know it's wrong, you have to just to follow the story.

*spoiler below*

For instance, right in the beginning of the game it seems that should be several ways of helping other trapped city people in the hotel lobby... you go through that part several times with tools and other stuff that should be enough to at least help a bit. Or just climb to the balcony and try getting a bit more acid from the drum there, I dunno.
But the story kinda forces you to wait until it's too late. It kinda leaves a bad taste in your mouth.

Also, rescuing the squirrel would've been a nice touch... just sayin'. You just leave the poor thing there eating to his doom, though there's nothing really stopping you from getting him. :P

Don't get me wrong though, it's still a neat hidden object/puzzle/point 'n click adventure to pass time, same quality level of other Artifex Mundi games. It's just not great when it puts itself in a position to be compared to a classic like Bioshock. To be fair, I think most games fall into tropes that could be compared to other games, but I don't remember anything down to this level. There's that series that is mostly PIrates of the Caribbean, just more the general legend rather than the franchise I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111511634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1644631155}
review:
El primer juego que probÃ© sobre el gÃ©nero Hidden Object y la verdad que me encantÃ³. Recomendable para conocer Ã©ste tipo de juego y sobre todo si te interesa el ambiente submarino y de ciudad sumergida. Si te interesan otras temÃ¡ticas mÃ¡s de fantasÃ­a, terror, etc, hay otros tÃ­tulos que quizÃ¡s te llamen mÃ¡s la atenciÃ³n y deberÃ­as contemplarlos.
GrÃ¡ficamente me pareciÃ³ muy bueno. Los fondos son excelentes y detallados. La mayorÃ­a de los efectos, como luces, fuego, agua, rayos, explosiones, etc, tambiÃ©n estÃ¡n muy bien.

Los puzzles no son demasiado complicados y y los problemas a resolver no son rebuscados ni muy ilÃ³gicos. De todas formas cuenta con la opciÃ³n de ayudas y de saltado en el caso que lo desees pasar igual. Destaco la posibilidad de que aquellas partes de buscar objetos concretos sobre un montÃ³n de otros alrededor, es decir las partes de objetos ocultos, se puedan pasar encontrando dichos Ã­tems en lista y dando click sobre ellos o tambiÃ©n realizar una fase de dominÃ³. De esta forma tenemos dos variables y nos puede permitir tener mÃ¡s chances de pasar determinada secciÃ³n. AdemÃ¡s esto aÃ±ade algo de rejugabilidad si queremos sacar todas las insignias.

La historia me pareciÃ³ buena y con elementos fantÃ¡sticos y de terror, sin llegar a ser gore ni nada por el estilo. Pero acompaÃ±a muy bien y engancha como para querer saber quÃ© pasÃ³ y continuar investigando. Destaco el capÃ­tulo extra que destrabas al terminar el juego principal que permite completar parte de la historia y muestra hechos importantes para la misma. Eso me pareciÃ³ un muy lindo detalle.

La mÃºsica acompaÃ±a muy bien y los efectos de sonido tambiÃ©n son buenos.
Con respecto a las voces, dirÃ­a que son buenas. Se nota que no son excelentes, pero para un juego de este estilo y presupuesto cumplen bastante bien.

No es un juego muy largo, por lo que no esperes estar cien horas jugando sin terminarlo. El tiempo depende de cada uno, pero dirÃ­a que con varias horas, unas cinco o seis, quizÃ¡s menos si eres muy bueno, ya podrÃ¡s superarlo. Eso si, si quieres sacar todas las insignias deberÃ¡s jugarlo aunque sea una vez mÃ¡s. Esa segunda vez quizÃ¡s quieras jugarlo en modo difÃ­cil para tener un reto extra y de paso sacar otra insignia.
Al pasar el juego, ademÃ¡s del capÃ­tulo extra, destrabamos arte conceptual y wallpapers muy buenos para poder ver. Los fondos de pantalla destrabados se pueden descargar y usar en el escritorio de nuestro pc.

En fin el juego me pareciÃ³ muy bueno y una excelente entrada al gÃ©nero de Hidden Objects Games y lo recomiendo mucho.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985130407', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1645270472}
review:
Do you want to enhance your nice, casual, and relaxing hidden object adventure [b][i]WITH SOME JUMPSCARES!?[/i][/b]

This game has those.  A lot of them, really.  Prepare for the horrifying sight of... massive zooming-in on pixelated low-resolution imagery.  Truly terrifying.

I enjoyed Abyss a lot.  It has many interactions with characters and the setting has some good backstory.  The art is absolutely fantastic.  It's some of the most lovely backgrounds I've seen in a HOAG.

Keep in mind that the game's backgrounds have a bizarre native resolution of 1280x768.  I don't know what a 16/9.6 aspect ratio is, maybe it was designed for tablets back when they were popular in the early 2010s.  I recommend setting your desktop resolution to 1280x768 or playing windowed, because if the game runs fullscreen at a resolution with 16:9 AR, the art will be stretched to fill.  Don't distort this gorgeous artwork, please.

The main character doesn't say much, but she's a standard ultra-confident tuff guy.  She doesn't afraid of anything and that fearless attitude really detracts from the tension and sense of danger that they were trying to create with the jumpscares.  She's not actually that tough and powerful; she's a woman, after-all, and there's an upper limit to how much she can stomp around, bending social and physical realities to her desires.  She's not big or strong enough to carry her unconscious fiance to safety, but fortunately there's another friendly male character on Eden to help with that.

That friendly man is the same character you will play as in the bonus adventure, which is inexplicably hidden in the "Extra Content" menu.  I have no doubt that some players didn't know it was there and missed playing it!  The bonus adventure is pretty good, and has entirely new areas of Eden, so it shouldn't be missed.

A few annoying things marred my experience.  The game has a map, but not teleport.  Abyss is focused on exploring a limited area of the undersea city, rather than an epic romp across the lands, so there's a lot of backtracking to be done.  Teleportation would have been nice.  For some reason my frame rate was cut down to 20 FPS during hidden object scenes in the bonus adventure.  Not a massive problem, but annoying.

That's right, I have reached the end of this review without mentioning the famous video game that Abyss' setting is similar too.  I have no doubt 90% of reviews have already mentioned it, so I will not repeat it.  Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a nice, standard, high-quality hidden object game.  HOAG fans should play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1613435034}
review:
[code]Puedes ver mÃ¡s reseÃ±as como esta en la mentorÃ­a [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]

[h1]Bioshock versiÃ³n Hacendado[/h1]

Â¿Te molas los juegos de Objetos Ocultos? Â¿CreÃ­as que eran una porquerÃ­a, pero luego probaste los juegos de Artifex Mundi y viste que entretenÃ­an lo suficiente para tenerlos en cuenta? Si has respondido afirmativamente a ambas preguntas, es muy probable que te interese lo que tengo que contarte. Si no es asÃ­, vete directamente a mi reseÃ±a sobre [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198040037265/recommended/284750?snr=1_5_9__402][u]Enigmatis[/u][/url] si quieres introducirte en este gÃ©nero, ya que es infinitamente mejor que este juego. 

No es que este tÃ­tulo sea malo, ni mucho menos, pero suelo ser bastante condescendiente con los juegos de Objetos Ocultos ya que estÃ¡n destinados a un pÃºblico general bastante casual y no demasiado exigente. AsÃ­ que tampoco le vamos a pedir peras al olmo porque si no, no se salvarÃ­a ninguno.

Sin embargo, con el paso de los aÃ±os este gÃ©nero se ha vuelto mÃ¡s y mÃ¡s â€œambiciosoâ€ en sus propuestas y planteamientos, llegando tal vez a su punto Ã¡lgido con la saga Enigmatis antes mencionada. Sea como sea, tampoco nos engaÃ±emos, un juego de Objetos Ocultos es lo que es, y pare usted de contar. Sin duda, vienen muy bien para distraerte de propuestas mÃ¡s serias, trabajadas y bien ejecutadas, pero poco mÃ¡s.

Es por ello que nunca estÃ¡ de mÃ¡s echarse una partidilla o dos al aÃ±o con algÃºn juego de este tipo, y Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden es una buena propuesta dentro de este gÃ©nero. No estÃ¡ dentro de los mejores, pero sÃ­ es bastante notable dentro de este tipo de tÃ­tulos.

En el juego tomaremos el papel de una mujer, obviamente, que va a buscar a su novio, el cual desapareciÃ³ mientras buceaba realizando una serie de investigaciones. Cuando llegamos, descubrimos una ciudad subacuÃ¡tica con referencias mÃ¡s que calcadas a Biochockâ€¦ pero versiÃ³n Hacendado.

Es decir, es como el chocolate de Hacendado. Parece chocolate, sabe a algo como el chocolate y hasta te puede gustar, pero luego pruebas un poco de Nutella o Nocilla y ves que en realidad esâ€¦ chocolate de Hacendado. Barato y te quita el gusanillo, pero nada mÃ¡s.

Este juego es bÃ¡sicamente lo mismo si lo comparamos con lo que intenta â€œcopiarâ€ en su ambientaciÃ³n y argumentaciÃ³n principal. Luego el argumento varÃ­a, claro, pero vamos que nadie juega a juegos de Objetos Ocultos por su argumento, eso seguro. Uno viene aquÃ­ a buscar objetos y a pasar un rato entretenido. Y eso lo consigue.

El meollo del asunto lo hace bastante bien. Encontramos objetos, los utilizamos con el entorno, vamos avanzando y entonces nos topamos con todos esos minijuegos de encontrar objetos que tanto gusta hacer de vez en cuando. En cierto modo, incluso tiene ciertos puzles y elementos de aventura grÃ¡fica, pero todo tremendamente casualizado, claro. 

Sea como sea, el juego cumple. Nos mantiene varias horas entretenidos y satisface nuestras necesidades de DiÃ³genes de encontrar basura que estÃ¡ escondida en otro montÃ³n de basura aÃºn mÃ¡s grande, y llevarnos algo en el proceso, claro. 

TambiÃ©n, y como suele ser habitual, el juego ofrece la posibilidad de elegir otro modo de juego diferente al de buscar objetos, pero a quiÃ©n le importa eso. Solo a los que queremos sacarnos todos los logros, claro. Porque somos unos enfermos. Los demÃ¡s pasarÃ¡n olÃ­mpicamente, porque son personas sanas.

El Ãºnico problema que tiene el juego, es que alguna que otra palabra no estÃ¡ bien traducida y eso genera bastantes errores a la hora de resolver algunos minijuegos de objetos ocultos. LÃ³gico por otra parte, ya que si te dicen que busques una â€œtuberÃ­aâ€ cuando realmente lo que tienes que buscar es una â€œpipaâ€ pues ya la hemos liado. 

No es que sea un problema grave porque hay un botÃ³n de ayuda siempre disponible, es un juego casual no lo olvides, pero claro, si quieres sacarte todos los logros ese botÃ³n no puede existir jamÃ¡s, y entonces los problemas con las malas traducciones si se convierten en algo muy molesto.

De todos modos, esto es un problema muy habitual en este tipo de juegos. Se traducen y luego no se testean, y asÃ­ luego pasa lo que pasa. Pero como es algo comÃºn a casi todos ellos, pues es algo ya conocido por todos. Aun asÃ­, no estÃ¡ de mÃ¡s que sepas que este tÃ­tulo tambiÃ©n adolece de esto.

En definitiva, Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden es una buena opciÃ³n como juego de objetos ocultos. No es ni de lejos la mejor opciÃ³n, pero mantiene el tipo bastante bien durante toda la aventura, la cual no serÃ¡ muy larga, pero eso es algo habitual en la mayorÃ­a de este tipo de juegos. A menos, claro, que quieras sacarte todos los logros.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967695389', 'num_games_owned': 920, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1637648263}
review:
The HOPs in this game are terrible with what they call items and there was one in particular that had a made up name and couldn't be found. First time ever in playing over a hundred of these games.
A+++ for the GREAT map, but a HUGE thumbs down on it not being a FAST TRAVEL map which then makes the map garbage because it calls certain areas different names than what they call it why traveling through.
AND you have to, MANY MANY TIMES, travel from one end to the other to maybe get one item and then travel all the way back to use it to get 1 more item to only have to go all the way back to use it. In between there's an elevator that you have to wait for the animations each and every time as well.

It's like someone was pissed off at their job their and decided to punish anyone that dare play this pile of steaming garbage. Definitely in the TOP 5-10 worst of these I've played.

Also, the HOPs in the Bonus chapter only had 4-5 FPS making it even more annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132995625', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1636361749}
review:
[h1] Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden [/h1]
Casual game from 2012

A very good and above all exciting search game. Contains various types of puzzle challenges. The main focus is on searching. If necessary, you can use a help for this or skip mini-games.
Challenging and interesting, without being too heavy.
It took me a little over six hours to play it through. Then you can play the bonus content, which then brings you closer to the history. I think it's a very good idea. The entertainment value of this game is very high and you can certainly play it more than once.
Errors or the like are absent and technically it is very well done. You will also be told a good story.
There are setting options to adjust the difficulty.
Clear recommendation for everyone, including newcomers.

[h1]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/h1] 
Gelegenheitsspiel von 2012

Ein sehr gut und vorallem spannend gemachtes Suchspiel. Beinhaltet diverse Arten von RÃ¤tselherausforderungen. Wobei der Hauptaugenmerk auf dem Suchen liegt. Bei Bedarf kannst du eine Hilfe dafÃ¼r nutzen oder bei Minispielen auch Ã¼berspringen.
Anspruchsvoll und interessant gestalltet, ohne zu schwer zu werden. 
Ich habe etwas Ã¼ber sechs Stunden gebraucht um es durch zu Spielen AnschlieÃŸend kannst du den Bonusinhalt Spielen der dir dann die Vorgeschichte nÃ¤herbring. Eine Sehr gute Idee wie ich finde. Der Unterhaltungswert dieses Game ist sehr hoch und man kann es sicherlich mehr als einmal Spielen. 
Fehler oder dergleichen sind nicht vorhanden und technisch gesehen ist es sehr gut gemacht. Eine gute Geschichte wird dir auch noch erzÃ¤hlt. 
Es gibt EinstellungsmÃ¶glichkeiten die Schwierigkeit an zu passen.
Klare Empfehlung fÃ¼r alle, auch fÃ¼r Neueinsteiger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034611928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1630109029}
review: Game itself is ok, good graphics, decent storyline, if a little bit of a rip-off of Rapture from BIoshock. But the music! So repetitive! Just the same track looping over and over and not even a very long track. I had to turn the music off after a while. The Hidden object scenes can be a bit fiddly with where you need to click on items, and the names of items can be a little odd too. Mini games are ok except for the ones where you have to move things out of the way to find the items underneath, as the items you need to move seem to snap to certain areas and it can be really hard to move them enough to get the actual item underneath. Voices aren't terrible but some are a bit average. The map isn't interactive either, which is a shame as there is quite a lot of back and forth. Still, worth a playthrough. Nothing game breaking just a few annoying things.

author: {'steamid': '76561199121601166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1667731534}
review:
Hi there! This review doesnâ€™t contain spoilers.

I really donâ€™t know how to feel about this game. 
In â€œAbyss â€“ The Wraiths of Edenâ€ we follow a diver, who is searching for her missing husband in an abandoned underwater-city. An interesting Idea, that couldâ€™ve been so much more than the once again overused â€œmissing Husband/Brother/Family Memberâ€-Trope. Besides that the game is, wellâ€¦ pretty plain. 

Donâ€™t get me wrong - itâ€™s a great game with beautiful visuals and artwork, complex puzzles, and a really pretty world to explore, but as mentioned, the kidnapped family member trope is once again used! Honestly I wouldnâ€™t even mind if the story wasnâ€™t so boring, but besides freeing our husband thereâ€™s literally nothing else to do. The other Characters are really boring and forgettable, and add nothing to the main story, while the villains are acting illogical and do absolutely nothing to stop the main character from freeing her husband. And donâ€™t get me started on the elevator, which wasted SO MUCH TIME!!! (Iâ€™m totally serious! Steam says I played this game for 3.8 Hours, 1 one which I probably wasted on using the elevator). 
The Animation is terrible, and the main voice actor sounds like sheâ€™s about to fall asleep, while the lip-sync on the other characters is terrible, and the animation is scary, to say the least. 

In conclusion, this game couldâ€™ve been so much more, but ended up really disappointing me In the end I really had to force myself to finish it. 
If youâ€™re looking for an interesting Hidden-Object-Game to play, Iâ€™d probably choose another one. Or maybe get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095263665', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1628060761}
review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a point-and-click hidden object adventure game by HOG giant Artifex Mundi. In this game, you play as a woman looking for her explorer fiancÃ© who went missing at sea. Later she discovers that he has been abducted in the hidden underwater city of Eden, and she later follows him into the city. The level artworks for the city of Eden are really beautiful, a decaying, retrofuturistic underwater city that uses a lot of Art Deco aesthetics.

Sounds familiar? If yes, then you're probably like me, an immersive sim fan who likes BioShock. It is one of the first games that got me into PC gaming, and a franchise I really adore. A:TWoE takes a lot of inspiration from that franchise, especially BioShock 2 which was released only 2 years prior and the city, Rapture, was more colorful and overgrown compared to the first game. Like BioShock, this game has some little scary moments, for example the appearance of corpses.

Some themes are also quite similar to BioShock, like how in both games you enlist the help of a rebel leader to take down an oppressive regime, while helping some strange little girls. However, the theme of this game is more supernatural unlike BioShock's sci-fi, taking inspiration from Lovecraft. Cutscene animations and voice acting are quite good, too, the characters, especially the protagonist can sound expressive. After finishing the main game, you unlock an extra chapter, a prequel where you play as said rebel leader trying to save his pregnant wife.

I think Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a really good HOG with an interesting setting. The only bad thing I can say about this game is the fact that to get all achievements, you must run the game at least twice, and in one run you have to not do the hidden object scenes, but play the replacement domino minigame instead. Get it if you're a HOG fan, and if you're not one but a BioShock fan, try it, as this game might fill the Rapture-shaped hole in your heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203837375', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1624381907}
review: After completing [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/264710/Subnautica/]Subnautica[/url] Abyss seemed to be the logical choice for my next underwater adventure and it was a wonder to play. A point-and-click adventure with hidden object mechanics and fairly straight forward puzzles. The whole atmosphere and concept of the game is very interesting and while the story starts off a little too eager to get you in the thick of the action, it quickly becomes very mysterious and engrossing. The music really adds to the foreboding tone of the game even if the voice acting is a little campy at times. The game does a really good job of creating tension most of the time, though I feel they tried a little too hard on the jump scares. All in all a short enjoyable game even though it is a little linear with some replay value through a second playthrough on expert mode and the extra content prequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970310850', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1622399258}
review:
[b]6/10[/b]

[h1]Bioshock auf Wish bestellt ;-)[/h1]

Abyss ist eins der frÃ¼hen Werke aus dem Hause Artifex Mundi. Technische AnsprÃ¼che sollte man bei Wimmelbildspielen eh nicht zu hoch ansiedeln. Das hier bekommt 'ne knappe Empfehlung, selbst fÃ¼r Genrefans wie ich einer bin.
Die AtmosphÃ¤re ist jedenfalls da. Wie eigentlich immer in diesen Games. Und ein Unterwasserabenteuer ist doch eigentlich auch immer was wert :-)
Die Story ist in Ordnung, auÃŸer dass das mit den Legaten schon merkwÃ¼rdig ist. Sie sind Ã¼bernatÃ¼rlich, schweben umher, sogar durchs Wasser, aber trotzdem haben sie eine physische PrÃ¤senz und sind sogar[spoiler]verletzbar (einmal wird einer von Steinen erschlagen).[/spoiler]Naja.
Die Grafik muss nicht viel leisten. Der Artstyle ist schÃ¶n. Die 3D Modelle hingegen, speziell die der MÃ¤dchen, sehen einfach furchtbar aus.
Die RÃ¤tsel sind grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils einfach, in 2-3 FÃ¤llen waren sie nicht mein Fall. Aber man kann ja auf Wunsch auch alles irgendwann Ã¼berspringen. Die Minispiele sind abwechslungsreich, aber nicht alle neu (aus anderen HOPAs bekannt).
Die Wimmelbilder sehen schÃ¶n aus und sind nicht Ã¼berladen oder zu filigran. Alles fair bis auf die Ãœbersetzungsfehler.
Waage = Scales = Schuppen (Fisch) !!
BaseballschlÃ¤ger = Bat = Fledermaus !!
Ein aufgeheizter SchlÃ¼ssel wird zur HeiÃŸtaste! Hot Key und so XD
Sollte man wissen. Sowohl als Spieler, der sich das zusammenreimen muss, als auch als Entwickler! Eine Schande, dass sowas offensichtlich durch den Google-Ãœbersetzer gejagt wird, anstatt mal einen Muttersprachler wenigstens kurz drÃ¼berschauen zu lassen...
Die Ãœbersichtskarte ist zwar hilfreich, aber wie z.B. noch in Enigmatis 1 ist keine "Schnellreise" mÃ¶glich.
Das Anwenden des Inventars ist logisch und macht SpaÃŸ. Ich mÃ¶chte eine andere Review zitieren: es entsteht ein angenehmer Flow, der zum Weiterspielen einlÃ¤dt.

Das Bonusabenteuer ist dann grafisch leider nochmal schwÃ¤cher, streckenweise laggt(!) es und bietet inhaltlich nichts Besonderes. Wieder einmal die Vorgeschichte, aber wenig Ã¼berraschend.

Also:

[h1]Einfach nicht (zu)viel erwarten, im Sale kaufen & genieÃŸen[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063598162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1620895795}
review:
This game is perfect for using with Steam Link app on your iOS device! I use my mouse but you can set it up to not need it. Point and click are perfect for porting to an ios device typically. No directional buttons needed. You can even remotely shut down your PC when you are done playing. :D  Oh how we can spoil ourselves. 

Great point and click game. I didn't always like the voices. I get most games on sale but I think this is worth $10.00 if you play the way I did.  Relaxing before bedtime.   (12.9 hours of leisurely playing between both devices and a nap or two)

My favorite part? I didn't need to buy gems to get hints. I can play on PC or iPad. (or others if I had them). I can use mouse or not use mouse. I love options and comfort so this game allowed me both. It was the typical point and click game you can find in the app sections on your ipads or iphones but can be on your PC and no further purchase required. 
I'd recommend it.  Each likes their own styles so I recommend reading other reviews too.. In particular, most recent. :)

review: Fun HO point & click. Decent story. Played 2x to get all achievements (once on easy and once on expert). 12hrs total for both (and I do tend to walk away when I need a stretch. Only downside I saw were the puzzle games where you had to move objects around in a box to find what you're looking for. The area for placement didn't seem large enough and bigger items would "snap" to their original locations. An annoyance more than anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364905218', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1618008509}
review:
Not a bad game. This is a light recommend for me if you're looking for something that isn't too in depth. The playtime is decent, thought slightly shorter than the average HOG I've played. I'd say that average is around 4 hours for me, and I finished this in 3. 

Pros:
Decent length
Some pretty good jumpscares (I actually flinched once)
Nice environments
Large map
Solid atmosphere for most of the game
Lots of puzzles and items to get for solutions.
Characters to interact with

Cons: 
Easy hidden object scenes, many of the objects are very large and occasionally you can open a box in the scene and find two or three just sitting inside.
Loses steam as the game progresses. I felt that the story showed its hand too early, and then there wasn't anything left to hold onto storywise once I knew what was happening. 
Elevator is a pain. At first I liked it because a lot of creepy stuff was happening on it, but then eventually it stops and instead of dreading taking the elevator because of the atmosphere, I was more annoyed by it. 
Mouth animations on characters aren't the best (Greg).

Overall, if you're looking for a distraction, I'd recommend it for the environments alone, but do temper your expectations because the atmosphere doesn't hold up to the end.

The scenes are challenging enough, not boring and not too difficult either.

I loved it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087491748', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1614366927}
review:
Floating inventory is highly annoying.
No travel through map so lots of backtracking.
Riding elevator is just another waste of time.
Animation is terrible - just look at Greg mouth.
Some dialogs can't be skipped.
Additional content can easily be missed (no popup after finishing main story).
HOG's in additional content have performance issues.
Metal detector HOG is nice touch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452116103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1612727813}
review: This is a fun one from Artifex Mundi. The gameplay is smooth and the puzzles aren't overly easy or difficult. The domino puzzles for the hidden object games are fun. The characters are even pretty easy to relate to, which tends to be something these games are iffy on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800965012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1612145193}
review: I really enjoyed this one! Despite its age, it still looked really good. And I was thrown off guard by the horror elements/ mild jump scares. Bit unusual for an Artifex Mundi game, but it was a nice change. Would recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047198124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1611247455}
review: It's a good game indeed, the graphic is quite out date but it's worth to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198930579653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1610811467}
review: I wouldn't call this game not entertaining as I would call in formulaic from what you would expect from Artifex Mundi HOGs. The same type of puzzles as other games, and even repurposing some of the character art from Enigmatis (or vice versa?). Overall, just okay. Not a compelling story by any means. It "fills the void" while waiting for better HOGs to come along.

author: {'steamid': '76561198969396473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1610472205}
review:
If you're looking for a Hidden Object Game loosely based on Bioshock then this is the game for you, exploring an underwater city while looking for you're missing husband is one thing but discovering it's dark secrets is another. Once again another great story setting with many things to do on this adventure.

  Likes:
[list]
[*]Beautiful Artwork which works perfectly for any hidden objects
[*]Instead of playing the hidden objects try having a go playing dominoes
[*]A great story plot that you can easily follow and keep up with
[*]Unique puzzles and mini-games to play
[*]Bonus Chapter to Play in the extras
[*]Downloadable Wallpapers for your PC
[*]Concept Art
[*]Simple Controls, just point and click!
[/list]

  Dislikes:
[*]A little bit of backtracking which for some people, may not like
[*]Animation is a little rough when interacting with characters
[*]The Elevator, it only goes a one way system. Example, you are on the bottom and want to get to the top floor, you have to keep pressing the lever to go up the next floor, then again to get where you want to be - There are only three floor but This High Annoyed Me, especially when I wasn't sure where I needed to be or what I needed next!!!

Nagyon rÃ¶vid Ã©s ÃºjrajÃ¡tszÃ¡s szempontjÃ¡bÃ³l nincs mit kÃ­nÃ¡lnia, de cserÃ©be olcsÃ³ is szÃ³val ha egy akciÃ³ sorÃ¡n sikerÃ¼l megszerezni akkor megÃ©ri vÃ©gigjÃ¡tszani.

[ENG]
Fun game.
The game mechanics are as simple as a rock, but give a very relaxing and enjoyable experience. Problems start when the controls and the object reaction zones are not always as clear as they should be which lead to many frustrating missclicks.

Visually the game gives a very mixed quality. As a whole the illustrations, the backdrops and the style looks good, but all manners of movement and animation is jank as hell and can be disturbing if someone is sensitive to it.

The story is simple and the source of its inspiration is very much obvious, but it's still interesting. Most of the confusion comes from the lack of untold worldbuilding and backstory since the fantasy world that's build up is regularly clashing with reality showing that there was no clear direction when making it, but with such a cheaper budgeted game it's understandable if that was left out.

It's very short and has nothing to show in terms of replayability, but luckily it's also cheap so if it can be bought on a sale it's worth a playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034267885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1611867778}

author: {'steamid': '76561198268651087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1609280340}
review:
I only recommend this game if it's on sale, otherwise no. The story and plot were pretty good, the art was amazing and I liked the puzzles.

However, I did not enjoy the way the map was laid out. All other puzzle mystery games give you a map that helps you use shortcuts, in this game that's not the case. There are no shortcuts regardless of the difficulty, I had it on advanced for a long time and changed it to casual because I thought that would make it easier to travel from 1 place to another. It didn't. 
That was the most frustrating part, not only because sometimes you had to go all the way to the start of the map to go all the way back, but also because I am horrible with maps.

On top of that, the elevator mechanism was no better. If you needed a clue at floor 3 and you're at floor 1, you had to go through floor 2 as well (elevator animations included), which took way longer than it really should have to go from 1 spot to another without shortcuts. 

These 2 mechanisms nearly made me want to quit the game, the only thing that kept me going was wanting to know the end of the story. 

I really hope the developers learn from these mistakes and improve in their next games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269060330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1608806474}
review:
I picked this up on sale once upon a time and if you like a scare, this will do it with creepy beings appearing when you least expect it - know that they are watching your every move. I love a great underwater adventure and this does not disappoint. The game mechanics are quite interactive and you also get a choice between playing the hidden object scenes or dominoes. My only negative is that I won't be getting all the achievements for this game. It requires you to play it through twice to get achievements for completing all hidden object scenes AND all dominoes games. Somehow I missed one domino game, but I am NOT playing it a third time through.

Recommended for the story, the creepy mystery, and underwater adventure. Pick it up on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198824313765', 'num_games_owned': 1516, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1607818497}
review:
Search for fiancÃ© Robert who disappeared during diving.
For achievement hunters:
First playthrough: select Casual difficulty and complete all hidden object games (HOGs) and tasks without any hints.
Second playthrough: select Expert difficulty, complete all dominos instead of HOGs, you can skip tasks and videos now and can use any amount of hints.

+ Hidden object items which require extra task
+ Achievement progress in game menu
+ Map helps to locate next actions too without using the Hint button
+ Puzzles are not too hard
+ Don't forget to play bonus level which explains more of the story

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198085858209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1602537765}
review:
â€œAbyss: The Wraiths of Edenâ€ started off good, but you figure out the majority of the â€œmysteryâ€ behind Eden too soon, and the game becomes dull about halfway through.

Story: 2.5/5
It had promise for sure, and even gave me some (slight) â€œBioshockâ€ vibes. Figuring out what happened at Eden was entertaining, but you find out most of the story too soon. I felt like the game started to drag about halfway through because of this, and I felt like it was more of a slog to the finish. I also wish the elevator was easier to use. You canâ€™t pick which of the 3 floors you want so you have to visit each one until you get to the one you want. Also, no fast travel, and a lot of backtracking didnâ€™t help with the pacing. If the story behind Eden had taken more time to unfold, then it probably would have been more worthwhile. 

Graphics: 3.5/5
For the most part, everything looks good, but the character facial animations are very stiff and almost doll-like, so itâ€™s a bit off-putting. 

Voice Acting: 3.5/5
Mostly good, although, the Wraiths sounded a little corny for my tastes and the father of the three children (I forget his name now) was a bit flat.

Music/Sound: 4/5
I did like the soundtrack but I donâ€™t think I find it as appealing or memorable as other soundtracks in Artifex Mundi games. 

Hidden Object Puzzles: 4/5
I liked them, and there were plenty of them (plus the dominos alternative was all right -- helped move things along faster at times), but they were all a little too easy. The item names were clear most of the time, but a few were a bit confusing (i.e. â€œhandâ€ referencing a clock hand, and instead of â€œeelâ€ they used what I guess must have been a very specific subspecies name.)

Other Puzzles: 4/5
I enjoyed them but I would have liked for some to have been a little more difficult to keep things interesting.

Final Grade: 72% 

Itâ€™s worth buying if itâ€™s on sale (like half-price or less), and if you a) really love HOGs and/or b) enjoy Artifex Mundiâ€™s HOGs specifically, hence why I am still going to recommend it. Otherwise, I donâ€™t think itâ€™s worth the full $10, and there are better games by Artifex Mundi.

review:
Buen juego 87/100 

1. Lleno de rompecabezas
2. Dificultad moderada
3. Una trama inspirada en H.P Lovecraft (cthulhu)
4. Banda sonora misteriosa e intrigante
5. Fascinantes escenarios llenos de belleza y suspenso

Una intrigante historia debajo del mar , que te recordara a bioshock y H.P Lovecraft con tintes de misterio detectivesco y con fondos asombrosos y fascinantes , giros de trama ingeniosos lleno de rompecabezas ingeniosos con una duraciÃ³n promedio de 10 horas . Recomendado .

author: {'steamid': '76561198060866645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1595110705}
review: This hidden-objects game had a good story and lots of fun puzzles. Be warned, there are a few little jumpscares throughout! The map feature is an absolute must-use because there are so many areas to explore. The only thing I didn't like was that some of the hidden-objects were a little particular about where you click on them in order to pick them up. As far as this type of game is concerned though, this is one of the best I have played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058129745', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1594789350}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992616563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1161, 'last_played': 1625725032}
review: Firstly, let me start off by saying, I do like the game.  That being said, I've put several hours into this game trying to unlock all the achievements.  I've played expert mode twice, no skips, no hints, and I still can't seem to unlock the "The Whole Story" achievement.  So if you want a nice fun casual experience, go ahead and get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032596719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1594497496}
review:
Another straightforward adventure to rescue some people who have been enslaved by an evil entity but whose brave leaders were unable to rescue.  Naturally, you as the female MC with far less credentials are able to.  Single-handedly.  Riiiiiight.  

Supension of disbelief aside, the HOP are fun.  The mini games are pretty easy and if you bother with the additional content (not sure why they open content showing what happened before the main story takes place - you've solved the problem so why launch into pre-tragedy nostalgia? And this is typical for all these types of games) it'll take you 6 or 7 hours to finish it up.  The voice acting and dialogue cut scenes are pretty hokey and wooden.  But that's pretty normal for AM games.  I wish they'd make more like My Brother Rabbit.  I'd SO pay more for that!  Anyway, worth $3 to play some good HOP, but not a penny more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198843846111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1593835964}
review:
BEGINNING
-nooo my fiancÃ© robert halp
-it's been a while since I've played this type of game-so cheesy lol

MIDDLE
-how am I supposed to know to click on this desk way over there AGAIN to do another hidden object puzzle in the same spot to get the eyedropper or whatever
-I've wandered back and forth this entire compound a million times and still can't even...
-screw it even though I'm on expert mode cuz imma hardcore gamerâ„¢, imma spam this hint button because what in tarnation am I supposed to do
-also screw the elevator
-TIL a "sea rod" is coral

END
-eh I had fun, but itâ€™s a bit of a bs system to get all the achievements- seems like a way to inflate playtime for completionist suckers like me
-lol all those electronics/devices that work just fine as soon as you drain the water, not to mention the protagonist lady spends this entire adventure decked in scuba gear and damp to completely soaked considering she can casually go in and out of underwater environments for extended periods of time instantaneously and without notice

OVERALL
-fine game with some wonky graphics, cheesy situations and VA sometimes, but that adds to the charm of this type of game imo
-backgrounds and atmosphere are pretty cool
-I liked to music too, even if it wasnâ€™t anything particularly special
-story was fine- a couple very distinct game-objective phases which can be helpful to predict/gauge where you are in the timeline
-I'm usually pretty stubborn about never ever using hints, guides, or walkthroughs with point-and-clicks, but I didn't really care enough to stay the course like I usually am with this game for some reason
-prolly cuz my tastes are more psychological-horror (Cube Escape, Bad Dream, Deep Sleep), and this adventure was pretty straightforward in comparisonâ€¦ I guess I just wasn't as invested, or maybe I played too long and too much of this game all at once and got tired of it- or a bit of both
-would rec getting it on sale, but totally get it if you know you like this genre
-roberrrrrrrt

review: Overall inoffensive, but it actually has a story and some quality. There are no collectibles. The voiceacting and whatever they did for facial animations is pretty painful, but you can skip them. Also no fast-travel via the map, so some patience is required. Bioshock influences get a plus from me. So I don't regret playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044520551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1501424459}
review:
Wraiths of Eden was such a surprise of a game, I wasn't expecting much of it but it's turned out to be one of my favourites. I can't remember much of the gameplay itself but that's part of the course for this sort of games where they all blend in together unless there's something particularly good or bad.

But the plot is campy fun sci-fi, which I enjoyed.

review:

Das einzige, was wirklich nervte, war der Aufzug... Leider hat er eine Sequenz, die nicht Ã¼bersprungen werden kann, und er hÃ¤lt grundsÃ¤tzlich auf jeder der drei Etagen. Muss nicht jeden nerven, mich hatÂ´s leider geÃ¤rgert.

Trotzdem mag ich das Spiel an sich gerne. Es hat im Gegensatz zu vielen anderen Vertretern seines Genres mal eine andere Geschichte, und deren Ausgang wollte ich dann unbedingt wissen.

Deshalb gibtÂ´s von mir eine Empfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205833036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1440381492}
review:
Fantastic Hidden Object Game with great art, fun and varied puzzles, suspenseful atmosphere, and a definite Bioshock vibe.

Grab it on a sale 'cuz $9.99 is ouch! I love HOGs, but they are getting super expensive for casual games, and they don't usually have enough replay value to be worth $10.00+. I said it!  >:[

author: {'steamid': '76561198307908110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1585014241}
review:
This is a game I had initially played while at a friend's house.  She had this game on her tablet, and I had really enjoyed playing it when I did, though I never finished the game.  I had bought it and wanted to finish it since it had been so interesting.

Playing it, it certainly held up my expectations, and had captured my interest once more, especially with the wraiths.  They had done a very good job of showing up when you least expected it, and had scared me a few times with it too, which is their goal.  Everything had a very creepy vibe to it, and had me on edge.  I do like the addition of the children in the game (and how the wraiths seem to have an effect on them too), though I'm also glad they don't have a large part in the game.  

Definitely a great game and I am very glad I got the chance to play through it completely.  Would absolutely recommend playing this game
