author: {'steamid': '76561197990303929', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1559405578}
review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a fairly typical example of the point & click adventure games with hidden object scenes and puzzles from Artifex Mundi (AM), although the setting is novel: a fallen undersea utopian city.  There is the standard romantic impetus to push the narrative along, and although some effort was spent in developing the back story, AM couldnâ€™t resist adding supernatural antagonistic elements, which I thought unnecessary.  The story didnâ€™t particularly grip me, feeling more like a vehicle to join the puzzles together, which it did adequately.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The bulk of the game is point and click adventure, finding objects and using them on the environment to solve problems, often after travelling between locations.  The puzzle mini-games were varied and not too difficult.  The hidden object scenes are well drawn and fairly straightforward, and each one can be skipped by switching to a very simple domino mini-game.  I do not enjoy the domino mini-game at all but there are achievements for completing all of them as well as those for completing the hidden object scenes, so achievement hunters will need to play through the game twice for all the achievements.  Furthermore, one of those playthroughs will need to be in Expert mode, which removes the very helpful action location clues from the map.

[h1]Aesthetics[/h1]
The background and hidden object scene artwork is of the excellent quality to be expected from AMâ€™s Premium Adventure Collection, and the animated cut scenes remain one of their weaknesses.  Voice acting is disappointing:  it seemed like the words were just read out loud without understanding their meaning or context, a bit like Keanu Reeves in John Wick.  Aside from the stilted voice acting, the audio design is quite good, with appropriate music, ambient noise and sound effects.  There are a couple of jump scares in this one, so be warned if you are the type to scream when startled.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
I donâ€™t think this is the best example of the genre but it does provide several hours of casual adventure and hidden object puzzling, and it looks good while doing it.

This review was submitted for [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/11978515/]Elite Giveaways[/url], check us out for more reviews ranging from Indie games to AAA games to F2P games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198996244003', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1588818534}
review: For a game that was released in 2012 - Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden, is a pleasant surprise.  It shows off colourful graphics and artwork that is expected from an Artifex Mundi franchise along with simple, uncomplicated HOP's and mini games.  Plus, you can swap between playing domino's or the hidden object puzzles as required, but fast travel through the map is not an option here.  So even in 2020, I recommend this game to all those who just want a relaxing distraction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261035503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1142, 'last_played': 1590794213}
review: This game was better than I'd anticipated. The story got real weird real fast but I'm not complaining. The atmosphere and puzzles in this were a really fun way to pass the time. Will definitely be replaying :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198409491837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1697586791}
review:
Good ol' HOG. Not too short. 

Plan to run around a bit. The map doesn't allow you to jump, but it wasn't enough to annoy me. This was better than average, Imo. Mini-games were less annoying than in many games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182227414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1008, 'last_played': 1587924319}
review:
Beautiful art and decent 3D cut scenes, as usual from AM. I was actually surprised to see that it was made in 2012, it still looks pretty fresh for a hidden object game. I also enjoyed the story, has a few little scares. The extra story was also pretty good and shows the origins and motivation of a resistance group in the main story.
The hidden object games were doable and the puzzles pretty easy, to be honest not very challenging, but ok.
All in all, I recommend it as a relaxing pass time.

review: This is a superior Hidden-Object game, a bit better than average even for this publisher.  Slightly harder than normal, too, though not excessively so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161332004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1585951076}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020049439', 'num_games_owned': 2611, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1585349579}
review:
[h1] TENTÃCULOS, PUZLES Y CINTAS DE VIDEO[/h1]

Pues otro juego mÃ¡s de Objetos Ocultos que sigue al pie de la letra la fÃ³rmula mÃ¡gica del gÃ©nero, es decir, una misteriosa trama salpicada con gotas de culebrÃ³n dominguero y muchos objetos bien escondidos donde puede dejarse uno la vista... todo sazonado con unos puzles sencillos y a la vez que complacientes con el jugador. 

O sea, nada nuevo en el horizonte y mejor hacer los expermientos con gaseosa vaya a ser que nos de la risa.

Lo cual no es malo necesariamente porque el si bien el juego no innova nada en absoluto y se mantiene muy fiel a la fÃ³rmula del gÃ©nero en general y a la de la desarrolladora en particular el juego cumple con creces y le proporciona al jugador habitual de este tipo de juegos lo que venÃ­a buscando.

Y lo hace sobradamente bien.

Me gusta el gÃ©nero de los Objetos Ocultos, me relajan mucho y con frecuencia me resultan muy refrescantes para descansar de otros juegos que requieren mÃ¡s implicaciÃ³n. Y dentro del mundillo los juegos que hace Artifex Mundi no me suelen defraudar. Suelen ser de los mejores en la factura del juego y en el necesario equilibrio entre la trama, los puzles y cierto sentido del espectÃ¡culo para mantener el interÃ©s del jugador. 

En ese sentido Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden no defrauda en absoluto y presenta ademÃ¡s una trama interesante y apetecible con claras influencias lovecraftnianas por un lado y del Rapture de los Byoshock por otro...lo que da lugar a un juego bastante apaÃ±ado y ciertamente divertido.

Eso sÃ­, a pesar de que este gÃ©nero nunca a destacado por tener unas traducciones al castellano impecables en esta ocasiÃ³n el encargado de la traducciÃ³n seguro que se fue de bares porque las incorrecciones y los gazapos abundan de tal forma que casi llega a ser insultante por la falta de interÃ©s. 

Una lÃ¡stima. 

En definitiva, juego cumplidor que sigue escrupulosamente las reglas del gÃ©nero, que no defraudarÃ¡ ni sorprenderÃ¡ a los jugadores habituales del gÃ©nero y que puede ser una muy buena opciÃ³n para los jugadores mÃ¡s novatos. 

Especialmente recomendable para adoradores de deidades tentaculares y nostÃ¡lgicos de Rapture que no se sientan obligados a ser muy exigentes. 


6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198821234868', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1925, 'last_played': 1590315878}
review: Un juego bastante sorprendente, una historia con un desarrollo muy profundo, plagado de misterios y un maravilloso mundo submarino mas propio de un bonito sueÃ±o que de un juego. Una de las mejores cosas es la gran ambientaciÃ³n, no conozco juego de este tipo que se desarrolle prÃ¡cticamente bajo el agua, creo que eso aporta mucho a la experiencia. La jugabilidad es totalmente acertada, en el transcurso de la aventura no he visto ningÃºn agujero de guiÃ³n ni fallo de argumentaciÃ³n. Todo estÃ¡ bien definido en la historia y eso hace que esta se desarrolle de una manera natural y sin cambios injustificados. Las escenas y puzzles muy cuidados, sobretodo las escenas muy mimetizadas con el entorno, realmente estas te ayudan a crear ese buen ambiente que te mantiene literamente dentro de la historia. Un capÃ­tulo extra con una buena calidad y muy bien combinado con la temÃ¡tica y escenas, harÃ¡ disfrutar un tiempo extra por si el juego se hiciera corto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198223274944', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1583277251}
review:
Si bien no suelo ser muy exigente con los juegos de este gÃ©nero, ya que uno sabe que suelen ser de presupuesto mas bien reducido, me cuesta bastante recomendar Ã©ste.
La parte grÃ¡fica y de sonido estÃ¡n dentro de los estÃ¡ndares aunque flaquea mucho en las actuaciones de voz, que son realmente malas. La estÃ©tica es claramente inspirada, por no decir copia, de BioShock. AÃºn asÃ­, lo que me impide recomendar este juego no es eso, sino el hecho de que la traducciÃ³n estÃ¡ muy, muy mal, lo cual no solo dificulta entender la historia, sino sobre todo los puzzles, dificultando la interpretaciÃ³n de que es lo que hay que hacer y las escenas de objetos escondidos, en las que he tenido que ponerme a pensar cÃ³mo se podrÃ­a llamar el objeto que me piden en ingles y ver como podrÃ­an haber malinterpretado la traducciÃ³n. Por ejemplo, en una escena te piden una Pipa, en inglÃ©s Pipe, que puede malinterpretarse al traducirla como TuberÃ­a, asÃ­ que estuve un buen rato buscando una tuberÃ­a que nunca iba a aparecer, y asÃ­ otras tantas veces mÃ¡s. AdemÃ¡s, jugÃ¡ndolo en una buena PC, aÃºn asÃ­ las escenas de objetos escondidos funcionan a entre 8 y 15 FPS, que no tiene sentido siendo un juego de requerimientos tan bajos y sin duda arruina un poco mÃ¡s la experiencia, ya que a cuadros por segundos tan bajos se nota clarÃ­simo en la escasa fluidez de movimiento del cursor.  Los logros no funcionan bien, nunca recibÃ­ el logro por completar el juego en modo experto a pesar de que lo hice. Por Ãºltimo, en poco mÃ¡s 3hs de juego completÃ© el juego, lo cual me parece bastante corto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177099229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1580596752}
review:
Entretenida aventura de objetos ocultos, con muchos aires a cierto juego famoso por la atmosfera generada, luce unos estupendos detalles visuales y son agradables, traducida al espaÃ±ol, aunque hay palabras o frases que no concuerdan, imagino que usaron el famoso "google Translator", aun asi, se entiende perfectamente la historia.

Si lo que buscas es una tarde entretenida, sin estresarte, con este, estaras resolviendo puzzles, buscando objetos, y disfrutando de una historia fantastica, su duracion es corta, 4 horas me a durado a mi haciendo pequeÃ±as paradas.

Si lo encuentras a precio reducido o en un paquete de aventuras de este genero, y lo que es mas importante, te gusta este genero o lo quieres probar por primera vez, te recomiendo su compra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008580226', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1580330832}
review:
Game generally pretty enjoyable...puzzles not too hard ... plot ok ....quite 'Call of Cithuluish' if you ask me.
The biggest irritation, that most other artifex mundi games do seem to have, was the absence of being able to travel from one location to another by using the map as a form of quick travel. I could not find a way of doing that in this game. Otherwise, quite fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198045145245', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1578115543}
review:
This game is 100% worth at least $5.  I played for 4 hours from beginning to end, got "spooked" three times, enjoyed every single one of the puzzles in Casual mode, and did not have to resort to Tequila to relax after work.  
Yes, Definitely buy this next time it's on sale if you enjoy casual puzzles.  Tequila may help if you're playing just to be spooked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198809955799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1577914285}
review:
Because I had played True Fear: Forsaken Souls Part 1 and 2 before this game, I started to spot similarities regarding the art choices! Haha! It's Art Deco straight in the face! The Dark Falls Asylum from True Fear games and this Eden Complex from this game share the same art choice! 

Since I am a big fan of True Fear, I've started thinking that Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a spin-off where the Dark Falls Asylum villains had enough money one day so as to build an under-water complex! Boy, the Eden Complex even has domes like the Administration building and a Greenhouse just like in True Fear Part 2! 

So, this game have been very amusing for me to play! I recommend you to play True Fear: Forsaken Souls Part 1 and 2 first, if you want to feel the same funny feeling I got when playing this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064850410', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1577894375}
review:
In Abyss: [strike]Phantom Splicers of Rapture[/strike] The Wraiths of Eden, you play as a woman in search for her lost fiance, Robert Marceau within a bedeviled underwater city. 

[h1]I feel as though there is a reticent bevy of people that are deeply passionate about these Hidden Object games from Artifex Mundi.[/h1]
Not even just the achievement hunters and/or card farmers. But people who [i]really[/i] enjoy casual, campy point and click adventure games. 

[b]I'm not a huge point and click fan, I've literally had panic attacks playing them.[/b]
I've got an issue when I'm just clicking around trial and error style and not seeing or feeling any progress. Especially when most point and clicks I've played have obscenely obscure solutions to things that seem like very trivial problems. Things like, the thing I need is behind the glass, I can see it! I was just holding a hammer AND a crowbar. There are demons after me! Just smash it! No says the game, you need to find some coins to operate the machine. However, those coins are in a different room and you'll need to clear the gas out first. This, my friend, my dear reader, is unacceptable. Luckily, these games have clear hints, as well as telling you on the map where â€œactionsâ€ are available. I appreciated being able to know what room I should be looking in rather than be told precisely what to look at in the room. Unless I asked nicely. 

However, there is also seemingly what is effectively TellTale's Puzzle Agent or Professor Layton popping out of nowhere and giving you a completely absurd and totally irrelevant problem to solve. â€œOh, sorry about the skeleton giving you a spook, I'll eh... I'll get that later. Please first solve this school riddle.â€ Ok, then. 

[b][i]THE GIST:
I really enjoyed this game despite my aversion to point and click games. Mostly due to it not being overtly complicated and in the rare moments it was, there are plenty of options to alleviate those tensions. And degrees to which they can be alleviated. The Hidden Object mini game can also be completed by doing a domino minigame where you need to reach certain places on the board given certain stipulations. So, if Hidden Object games aren't your thing, or you just sometimes want to do a different sort of puzzle. Those options are there. I tend to play these sorts of games at the end of the day when I can't â€œbrainâ€ anymore. Which becomes an interesting dilemma upon finding a genuinely difficult puzzle. Makes for interesting dreams.[/i][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197975413392', 'num_games_owned': 7384, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1576201578}
review:
I won't over-complicate things: this game is exactly what any experienced HOG player expects from Artifex Mundi at this point. The art is familiar, but solid, the puzzles are ones you've seen before, but well-executed, and the HO scenes are genuinely well-structured (the plot is ridiculous and full of holes, but it's pretty much what we expect from HOGs, as the authors are usually forcing a plot upon a lot of static scenes with puzzles and trying to have it make sense and carry a proper order of precedence). This one offers an alternative mini-game to the HO scenes (which is becoming more common as well, mostly to encourage multiple playthroughs via achievements) in the form of a domino game. 

As such, I can recommend this title without much hesitation. However, I have a few criticisms, and I hope that an Artifex Mundi rep gets a chance to read them, as I believe that paying attention to these things will help improve future HOG releases: 

1) Sweet Jesus, the voice acting...I know there's not a big budget here, but between characters referring to each other as "angel" and "darling" constantly (I mean, blech...just the worst, Hallmark-level ooey-gooey dialog) and the either over-dramatic (Logain) or underwhelming (Robert) delivery, it's all just very cringey.
2) Please, please stop making an elevator with a single lever (meaning that you have to stop at EVERY floor EVERY time) a central navigational point in HOG games. The back-and-forth with multiple stops just to get where you need to go is infuriating. It artificially lengthens the time it takes to play the game. In fact, [i]especially[/i] when you have an elevator, let the player jump to explored areas via the map.
3) Separate achievements for all HO scenes and all domino mini-games requires two full playthroughs to 100% the game. Again, this is artificial lengthening. It's a linear game with the same puzzles and same plot...doing it twice is unnecessary, and frankly I'm ready to move on once I've solved the thing. Making me play it a second time so that I can play all of the domino games to get the final couple of achievements is ridiculous. If you're going to do that, at least just let me access all of the domino games directly through the Extras menu after I've solved the main game...don't make me go through the entire plot again.

So, good HOG, but there is room for improvement. If AM will take these items into account in future games, it will really increase the enjoyment factor and decrease the frustrating points.

6/10 - if you like HOGs, you should probably add it to your never-ending list ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198337071802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1680293929}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994909078', 'num_games_owned': 2613, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1575057906}
review:
Of all the Artifex Mundi adventure lite games I have played this may be the better one. On one hand... I seem to recall that a survey or similar got to the conclusion that guys liked delimited genres and women like their genres to be mixed, like drama and comedy and adventure. Well, I am eager to know the control group behind this game, because it is the craziest mix of horror and science fiction tropes I've seen in a story, and actually it is more coherent than usual. Well, it may be not, but it has an underwater city, and underwater cities are my favourite trope.

Puzzles are the usual kind, and I really believe all these games would benefit with not having hidden object parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091958907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1567643735}
review:
Definitely recommend!

Pros
.Engaging story
.Very well done atmosphere
.Lovely clear artwork/graphics/scenes
.Enhancing music/sounds
.Three difficulty modes (no custom)
.Mini-map with action indicators
.Complex, intricate adventure play
.Easy to moderately challenging hidden object scenes
.Easy to moderately challenging mini-puzzles
.Bonus chapter

Cons
.Below average voice acting
.No fast travel
.Cannot lock toolbar in up position
.No indication when objects in correct position for possible use
.Repeated hidden object scenes
.No collectables 
.Very short

Final verdict (7.5/10):
Very impressed.  I am not really into this type of setting but the story, artwork and music/sounds worked so well together to create an immersive experience, I was won over to the concept and, after a few jump scares actually scared me, I was sold on the horror aspects.  Add in enjoyable adventure play, hidden object scenes and mini-puzzles and I can recommend it wholeheartedly, despite a few annoyances (like the unlockable toolbar which is a pet peeve of mine) and will replay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198840790878', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1679758989}
review:
Story was meh(Not so good not so bad like that).
Interesting Deep Sea under water city setting.
Plenty of puzzles are there with alternative Domino game(Some puzzles was  average and some weer good)
Thrilling cutscenes and Jumpscary moments <3
Bonus chapter was good. But i think is its not releated to the main story.
Overall good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047540387', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1564003255}
review:
Decent little point & Click.

Has pretty strong Bioshock vibes with the underwater Eden going bad.

The facial animations are pretty terrible, but its a 2012 game, so to be expected really.

Nice variety of puzzles, point & click and dominos

Overall I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344904307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1554686793}
review: Abyss is a hidden object game with a mystical touch. The story is strongly based on the Bioshok series and has some jump scares that really scare the player. especially when you're playing in the middle of the night and you really didn't expect it. In contrast to other hidden object games, the puzzles are really simple and as a beginner you have no difficulty finding hidden objects. The art-work and design is really good. There is a map with which you can orientate yourself in the game world, which is quite practical in some places. The protagonists of Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden are designed in 3D. The playing time is about 4.8 hours and is therefore about half as short as other game titles. Story: The heroine has to find her husband who disappeared on a diving mission to the underwater world of Eden. You have to save prisoners of a evil power who are held captive by a demon. All in all a good production.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987731882', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 1410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1298, 'last_played': 1560264760}
review:
Rather straightforward Hidden Object game.
Much attempts to create Jumpscares.
Considering as its an old game.
Rather dull and awkward facials of the actors during talk scenes.

To save time and effort to complete in one playthrough.
Play game in Expert difficulty.
Make backup save at every Hidden Object puzzle scene, 
play and complete Dominos game, then reload backup save to complete Hidden Object.
Same sequence concurrently for all 22 puzzle scenes to unlock both Dominos and H.O puzzles.

When stucked, keep clicking around on back scenes for Hidden Puzzles, and flip thru pages of books and collection small hidden objects.


Decent.
Purchased  while discounted in a package.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978460754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1559954237}
review:
I won this game as a "random steam key" from a prize website, so I wasn't expecting much. This game took me back to my childhood and reminded me of the old point/click hidden item adventure games that were much more popular in the early-mid 90's.  Relaxing and entertaining for what it is. This is mostly a hidden item/iSpy kind of game with a few somewhat challenging puzzles thrown into the mix (challenging in that they require some level of problem solving). Would definitely recommend this for someone who's looking to go down memory lane/the nostalgia factor that point/clicks can give. 

TL;DR:Fun, casual iSpy point and click with simple but challenging puzzles

author: {'steamid': '76561198122673637', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1559875861}
review:
As others have said, this is mainly a hidden object game with some additional puzzles thrown in to keep it interesting. I rarely play games this casual and simple but they are nice occasionally when I just want to relax and not think too much. Nothing about this game is difficult and it'll take around five or six hours to complete.

Production quality is good but I didn't care for the voice acting at all. You play as a female and Alexa sounds like she has more personality. The English, in general, is fine overall with no major grammatical errors but there are times when some of the comments sound jarringly unnatural aside from the voice acting which itself is fairly robotic.

The Lovecraftian storyline stays interesting throughout. I really enjoyed all the Cthulu references and the creepy atmosphere. 

There is a bit of backtracking to do, especially towards the end, but the game is pretty much over by the time it starts to be a burden. There also aren't as many hidden object games as I expected and I found myself wishing there were more by the end. I suppose that's a good marketing tactic!

Played on Ubuntu 18.04 Bionic Beaver with no issues.

Overall, I'd give it a 7/10.

review:
I would rather prefer give a neutral review, but the system doesn't allow it so it will go with a negative one.
The main problem with that one is it's simply too old and suffers a lot of clichÃ© that were soothed on the later HOG from Artifex Mundi. The animations are rather terrible, the reactions of the character don't change as the story goes. It's from 2012, play this one when you have no other to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1587810892}
review:
Did not like this one like others from same dev. This had way too many obtuse object-placement puzzles (for example: the nuts go in bowl ... to get hidden-squirrel with key) and the map was so large that there was tons of backtracking for every step of the story, especially when using the hint to lead from room to room. Playing on Advanced, not Expert mode, will helpfully show the object-placement locations on the map. The art and voice acting was great, to be sure, but the gameplay is regretfully too loose for my tastes.

I played on an ubuntu desktop with radeon mesa graphics. I used a mouse for the whole game, and I did not have any technical issues. Game takes 1,000 MBs of diskspace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029220607', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1555246474}
review:
It is alright. A convenient afternoon-filling experience but no really more than that.
A little too easy at times, rough facial expressions on characters and going back and forth through the elevator becomes a little tedious. But the artwork is pretty decent, music is even quite great, and the atmosphere overall is set right. I also liked that the hidden-object sections also had some decent puzzles within them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345336369', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1549388977}
review:
The good:
- Beautiful environments
- Decent puzzles
- Pleasant interface including a full map

The bad:
- Weak story
- Flat characters
- Lacking in atmosphere and tension

The ugly:
- The voice acting, dear god. How do these people keep getting work?
- The downright creepy animations. What a shame to see these beautifully drawn scenes come to life in such cringey ways. Worst are the facial animations. Is that meant to be an affectionate smile from your lover? Looks more like an involuntary contortion of pain.

I know HOGs have a tendency to be melodramatic, poorly acted, and a little subpar when it comes to graphics, but this game really took the cake. They need to hire better animators, voice actors, and writers. I'd be willing to pay more $ for a more polished product.

Final score: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198205359575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1545770121}
review: Overall it was a fun game, I finished in 4 hours on advanced and only needed to use the hint feature once...so it's a little on the easy scale. I enjoyed the story and the graphics were nice. Personally, I don't like hidden object components and was happy that you had the option to play "dominos" instead. Still, there were way too many of them for my taste and you'd sometimes have to wander around just to find the hidden object game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995982646', 'num_games_owned': 4611, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1544119745}
review:
This time, the protagonist has to locate and retrieve her lost partner, who is employed in an underwater city, called Eden, made by mankind. Some sort of strange happenings have occured in Eden. Up to the player to find out and piece the puzzle together.

Compared to other Artifex Mundi hidden object games, this installment focuses more on storyline. With significantly more cutscenes and NPC animations, the developers really made an effort to immerse the player.

Overall, the locations are colorful and rather busy & a bit overwhelming, with more than enough backtracking between them. The elevator used to reach the 3 different niveaus, has a animation which can't be skipped and gets very tedious towards the end of the game. Especially when you complete the game twice or more, which is needed to complete all achievements.

Puzzles are quite fun however and some can even be considered hard. They alternate well between the plentyful, well designed hidden object scenes.

Instead of the hidden object scenes, there can be opted for a minigame of dominos. To get all the achievements, a whole playthrough has to be completed solving all the hidden object scenes, and another playthrough which requires you to play all the domino games.

The Domino minigame consists of laying out one or more arrays of domino tiles, to reach multiple areas on the playing board. At the bottom center of the screen is the default starting tile. By pairing the symbols on those tiles, paths can be layed out to the designated locations. Once all locations have been reached, the game is won. Out of 3, always replenished, tiles can be chosen to place the next one. All of those 3 tiles can be refreshed by pulling the cord on the left, which slowly recharges afterwards.

Like other Artifex Mundi games, it is straightforward & easy to achieve a perfect game (100% achievements). As stated before, all achievements can be unlocked within 2 playthroughs, on the same (ingame) account that is. Also, do note, that you cannot restart a game if there's already one in progress.

There is an achievement "SPEED REACH", which requires the player to complete a domino game in less than one minute. Which is nearly impossible, without applying a little trick. Not wanting to spoil, this procedure can be found at the end of this review, under the spoiler bar.

Extra's come in the form of wallpapers, menu-accessible replayability of hidden object scene's, etc... There's also a bonus chapter, which is excellent. It has some good puzzles and a fair amount of hidden-object scenes. Some of which make you wonder why there not in the base game instead of the extra content. A welcome addition for those who've completed the game.

Only recommended for: Achievement hunters and or Hidden Object game players
My conclusion: Definately not one of the best Artifex Mundi games i've played. Way too much backtracking, and the minigame is brainless and unpleasant. Cutscenes and character animations are fearly good though. Up to the next one.
(You can also check out my other reviews of AM games)

Easy SPEED REACH achievement
[spoiler]It is particularly hard to complete a whole full game of dominos in less than one minute. The trick is to start with the hidden object scene and to find nearly all of the objects, until let's say two or three are left to be found. Now switch over to the domino minigame. You'll notice that only a few locations that have to be marked are left. Simply achievable in less than a minute.[/spoiler]

Cheers
SultanK

author: {'steamid': '76561198036906138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1539641525}
review:
I'm a big fan of hidden object games overall and Artifex Mundi has made some really interesting, wonderful games, but this one feels like it falls short. It's good for an hour or two to pass the time. But the Voice Acting and Writing is... really bad. And it doesn't take a lot to really please/entertain me. 

If you enjoy Cthulu aesthetics along with a nice Bioshock inspired environment, then you'll at least enjoy the look of the game. The jumpscares aren't really startling (and I'm a big baby when it comes to those things), and the 'hidden object' scenes seemed very lacking. It's more point and click with HoG elements sprinkled throughout.

Get it on sale, don't get it full price.

review: Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a fun HOG. It has good puzzles, nice hidden object scenes, and an interesting story. It also has  stupid dominos which I don't think belong in a HOG. A HOG is about the hidden object scenes and the option to play dominos instead in just dumb. Get it cheap or in a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024311750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1537750791}
review: An older Artifex Mundi-developed hidden object game, Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is another fine example of the genre. I thought it was a little lacking when it comes to puzzles compared to other hidden object games I've played and it feels somewhat like a point and click adventure. Despite featuring the ubiquitous trapped-demon stalwarts, the story is decent and it's an enjoyable game overall. The underwater setting is nice as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056468503', 'num_games_owned': 4820, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1537655796}
review: Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is an entertaining adventure game with hidden picture puzzles and awesome atmosphere. Played through the normal campaign so far and liked it. Nice story, nice atmosphere, nice riddles...and if you don't like them you can either play a mini game, skip them or get hints. Furthermore you get the soundtrack, some wallpapers and an extra campaign. I recommend it to people who like old-school point & click adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045380427', 'num_games_owned': 4982, 'num_reviews': 513, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1527372593}
review:
[code][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33025671-Missi-the-Achievement-Huntress/] Please see my curator page for more games that are worth your time [/url][/code]

Approximate amount of time to 100%: 10h
Estimated achievement difficulty: 6/10
Minimum number of playthroughs needed: 2, One in which you solve all the hidden-objective scenes and one expert game in which you complete all the domino puzzles
Has it been in a bundle: Yes
Is there a good guide available: Yes [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1375694151] here [/url]
How many people have complete this game at the time I'm writing this review: 1430 on Astats

Multiplayer achievements: No
Missable achievements: Yes, don't ask for hints during the game. Complete one playthough with all the hidden-objective scenes and one playthough (on expert) with the domino games.
Grinding Achievements: No
DLC-Only achievements: No
Time-gated achievements: No
RNG-achievements: No
Does difficulty affect achievements: Yes, one playthough one expert is needed.
Unobtainable/glitched achievements: No

I like those story drive hidden objective games. This is no exception. Warning: if you screw up something, don't start a new game right away to just get that one achievement. Because both games with domino and hidden objectives has to be on the same profile and you can't quite a run while in the middle of it. I had to play this game 3 times because I made that mistake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044675179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1601331654}
review:
4 almost 5 hours to finish ! (without extra game -wow and i did it kinda fast at times .
 this game was long and i enjoyed it another good artifex game .

 how ever i will agree with people that the animation in this was reather bad at times compared other artifex games, and it did bother me at times like fx  when characters was moving their lips xD 
also at some scenes the animation felt almost rushed and unfinished  ( ik about 3D animation/ modeling so ik what  am talking about ) and the line for a charcter in this story ( i wont spoil it)
was horroble and kinda wimpy ( in other words the dialog with a character felt very characterless). i think u could have done better in dialog . 

and yet i still enjoy the journey ;D in the Abyss and the backgrounds are as always stunning.

i didnt like the elevator

author: {'steamid': '76561198033388937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2006, 'last_played': 1531253699}
review:
Enjoyed this Artifex Mundi offering quite a bit.  While many of their published games are good, I've begun to notice that the ones where AM is the developer (as well as publisher) are just that much better.  

This particular game seemed a tiny bit short, but the story was interesting with the right amount of immersive creepiness (not much, but the atmosphere definitely works).  All I can say is that the protagonist is a truly brave woman.  It was fun, it had all the elements I was looking for, and I'm glad I added it to my AM collection!

A solid 8.5/10 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019373741', 'num_games_owned': 4050, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1532633936}
review: Good story, together with extra content 5hrs playtime. Finding and combining objects is a bit repetitive and sometimes you have to backtrack a bit too much to my liking. But it stays casual entertainment  and doesn't get frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023685531', 'num_games_owned': 1440, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1530493043}
review: Standard Artifex Mundi fare. Definitely has a distinctly Bioshock-esque feeling to it. I recommend it if you're a HOG fan or enjoy Artifex Mundi games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990448462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1532368785}
review:
Artifex Mundi have always distinguished themselves on having cool hidden-object games that stumble with the "adventure-light" portions that connect them, but Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden seems to break that curse. 

It keeps the fun of the hidden object screens (along with the standard Artifex Mundi mini-puzzles built in to liven it up) but the point-and-click adventure portions that connect them really come together this time and tell a fun story with more puzzles and game pieces that feel grounded in the game world, rather than an infinite array of silly-shaped keys.

Explore a Bioshock-inspired underwater city and piece together what happened to its citizens while working past some mild jump-scares.

If you're looking for a pure point-and-click adventure, there's better games out there, but Abyss is surely the best hidden-object/adventure hybrid I've had the pleasure of playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060688491', 'num_games_owned': 2427, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1424463227}
review: This is one of my favorite hidden object games. Unlike a lot of them, the story in this one is actually pretty engaging. The art is great and I found the scenes to be well put together. I love the underwater environments as well. Puzzles are easy to grasp, so you don't have the frustration of zero instructions. I definitely recommend this one, it is one of the few HOGs I would actually replay!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054808105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1541617520}
review:
I have not been able to finish this game. I've tried three times and I get bored and can't go on every time. It's not that it's a Artifex Mundi game, and it's not that it's clearly inspired by Bioshock (I kind of like that aspect?); it's just somehow incredibly boring. 

These games don't have great writing and the voice acting is worse but there's always been some thing about other AM games that keep me playing. I've played five or six of them now and every few months I pick up another one, so it's not that I have a problem with the genre. 

Maybe it's that there are fewer hidden object scens? I don't know. I don't like this one.

edit: So I finally (finally) finished this monster and I think I have a better idea now of why I hate this game so much. 

Most AD games I've played gradually cordon off earlier areas of the map as you progress so that you're always dealing with a manage chunk of map to keep in your head at any one time. They also allow fast travel; the advantages there are obvious. Abyss does neither (it does block off a small beginning part of the map but nothing after you enter Eden proper) and it makes getting through the already clumsy story infuriatingly tedious. They clearly made these choices because they were trying to make a horror game and they probably thought making you walk everywhere would increase tension or whatever. 

But the game is also really bad at doing anything scary; so maintaining tension by restricting map movement is kind of a moot point. The 'scary parts' are relegated to a handful of tame jump scares that are heavily telegraphed in advance. And I want to be clear here; I'm not a horror snob. I'm easily scared. My issue isn't that the game wasn't scary enough but rather that AM sacrificed player movement and story flow for a genre they were throughly unable to do any justice to.

It's a bad game. The story's also un-engaging and the puzzles weren't good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1529845628}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

La direction artistique Ã  la Bioshock est plaisante, ainsi que la musique. Graphiquement, c'est pas mal, dans la moyenne des Artifex Mundi. Les puzzles sont trop peu nombreux Ã  mon goÃ»t, et j'en ai dÃ©jÃ  vu une bonne partie dans d'autres jeux du mÃªme Ã©diteur, faudrait penser Ã  renouveler :).

Au niveau des scÃ¨nes d'objets cachÃ©s... elles sont moyennes. Rien de dur, rien de trop facile non plus. Mais la difficultÃ© vient souvent des traductions, qui sont vraiment faites n'importe comment... il faut arrÃªter de faire des traductions sans montrer les objets aux traducteurs - ou arrÃªter d'utiliser des outils de traduction automatiques (ex: Spring->Source au lieu de Spring->Ressort).

La partie bonus est courte et offre un prologue au jeu principal, mettant l'histoire en place.

[h1]RejouabilitÃ©, achievements[/h1]

Le jeu se termine assez vite, environ 3h30. Comptez entre 1h et 2h pour le refaire en mode dominos. J'ai un temps de jeu un peu supÃ©rieur car je l'ai refait plusieurs fois, ayant ratÃ© certains jeux de dominos lors des puzzles de construction d'objets...

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Une bonne petite aventure d'Artifex Mundi, ambiance Bioshock.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

Comme pour tous les jeux Artifex Mundi auxquels j'ai jouÃ©, la version Linux est excellente. Je n'ai rencontrÃ© aucun problÃ¨me.

OS: Linux Mint 18.3 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i5 760, Nvidia 570GTX, 8GB ram.
Screens : Dualscreen, 1x 1920x1200 & 1x 1600x1200, un seul screen X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043863729', 'num_games_owned': 1083, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1529344557}
review:
Overall Score: C+

Pretty standard hidden-object game. Which of course means that, at times, it's frustrating to see things in your inventory get discarded only for you to need a similar object 2 scenes later. Why are you throwing away the screwdriver/knife/flashlight after you use it one time?! Of course, without that mechanic, there wouldn't be much of a game.  Also, why is the same tool called a spatula in one hidden-object scene, then a scraper in a later one?

Graphically, this game has a pretty interesting art style, what with the (seemingly Bioshock-inspired) undersea art deco civilization, as long as things (people, mostly) aren't moving. The moment characters start to move their mouths to talk, they seem more inhuman than the wraiths. The Abyss mentioned in the title is probably the uncanny valley.

I knew what I was getting into when I started, though, so overall, I'll still give it a thumbs up. If you like the genre, then I don't see any reason why you wouldn't like this game. If you don't like the genre, you're probably not interested in this game, anyway. If you're curious about hidden-object games, but haven't played one before, this might not be the best one to cut your teeth on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004233477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1525235618}
review:
This is one of Artifex Mundi's mid-tier games. It's got a tight story, with a variety of characters, featuring a woman with a unique skill set (scuba diving and adventuring related skills like knowledge of machinery), saving her fiance? boyfriend? from certain doom. With a Lovecraftian threat in the form of wraiths and a Cthulhuoid deity, a good mix of beautiful art and horrific gross art, and a tight storyline, this game offers both hidden object puzzles, regular puzzles, and domino puzzles for people who want to skip the hidden object sections.

I personally found this to be one of the easier Artifex Mundi games, even on expert mode, but for those new to the genre, this is a good introductory game. Do note there are more horror elements than you'd find in a standard HOPA (there's a few corpses, a few skeletons?, the titular wraiths, some scary animals, and Lovecraftian magic), but I would not categorize this as a horror game, as the overall setting, hidden object puzzles, and standard puzzles did not have a horror tilt. 

There's only one glaring glitch, and this may or may not be a glitch. To get the achievement that has to do with finishing the game on expert mode, you MUST watch the final cut scene. I didn't, and am going to have to play through it again.

Reasons I didn't list this as a top-tier Artifex Mundi game:
- It could have done with more puzzles. There were various times a puzzle might have made sense and wasn't implemented. There were lots of "combine these objects to make a thing" puzzles, involving the inventory, but not a lot of non-inventory based complex puzzles.
- The hidden object scenes could've been harder and there could've been more of them.
- The issue with the achievement. I had to play the game twice on Expert Mode to make the achievement pop. That was four full play throughs: one on regular for the hidden object scene achievements, one on regular for the domino achievements, twice on expert for the expert achievements. You could do it in two tries, getting both the hidden object and domino achievements on two different expert mode runs.
- It was short. In 10 hours, I beat the game four times, and only three of the times were in the last week, for achievement hunting. That's around two and a half to three hours per play through, if I'm being generous.

If you're a fan of games with a Bioshock-type Art Deco aesthetic, and like the idea of exploring an underwater city to solve a mystery, this is definitely a good casual game to play on a rainy day.

If you are looking for another Bioshock-type Art Deco underwater city type of HOPA, with a similar tone, but with a focus on dreams, check out The Emerald Maiden: Symphony of Dreams. That game does not have a puzzle mode available for people that want to skip the hidden object puzzles, but does have collectibles. Abyss also has scarier bits that The Emerald Maiden, and features more adventuring than mystery solving. I would also say that The Emerald Maiden is definitely more historical in terms of tone, and definitely a mystery game as well as a work of historical fiction. The heroine of The Emerald Maiden is exploring an area created contemporaneously with her exploration, whereas the heroine of Abyss is exploring a dilapidated underwater city.

If you just want to check out more HOPAs with a nautical tilt, I absolutely recommend Artifex Mundi's classic Nightmares From The Deep series, which should be played in released order.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970282042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1522015677}
review: Good length, varying difficulty of puzzles. Like this HOP much better than ones where half the items are hidden behind something. Think the bonus chapter was a little short, but considering the overall game time I guess was okay. I like the HOPS, but you have the option of playing dominoes instead. I like it better when they used mahjongg. Which think have only seen in a couple of their games. Bring back the mahjongg. The artwork was great as usual, but the people talking were little more than off in this game. Usually it is better. Would rather have less real looking people with better vocal coordination then the way it was. Little offsetting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010267364', 'num_games_owned': 1213, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1406868118}
review:
This is one of the many Hidden Object games on Steam by Artifex Mundi, and while that's a humble genre to specialize in they're pretty good at it. The ones made by them tend to feature great visuals for the scenes, weird supernatural plots, and usually the same female voice actor doing all their leads. In Abyss' case it's pretty obviously based on Bioshock, without Ayn Rand or genetic mutation (though the character models on some of the children in the game might make you wonder). 

These sorts of games obviously won't appeal to anyone but if you want something more relaxing and with some puzzles, you won't go too wrong here. If you get stuck there's a hint system, and if you don't feel like doing the actual hidden object scenes you can play dominos instead. It's a decent adventure game and often appears in bundles along with other titles by them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089505080', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1520966119}
review:
Ni os hacÃ©is una idea de los tirones de pelo para conseguir el 100% de este juego. Y no porque sea dificil, el juego en sÃ­ es bastante sencillo, sino por perder los datos del juego en varias veces. He tenido que completarlo unas 5 contadas, y acabÃ© completamente quemado. Al meollo.

Abyss es un juego de buscar objetos de fantasÃ­a bastado en una ciudad sumergida bajo el mar. Nuestra prota busca a su marido que fue de buceo y desapareciÃ³, fue a buscarle y encontrÃ³ tal lugar. Hasta ahÃ­ meh. No es un argumento sÃºper avanzado, pero oye, los he visto peores. Una vez la historia va avanzando, se vuelve peor y cada vez mÃ¡s fantasiosa, incluso llegan a incluir un demonio y posesiones como "boss" final (Que de boss mis huevos, tienes que pickear un item y pinchar en Ã©l, uuuuff) Total, que una vez lo terminÃ© quedÃ© con una cara importante. 

El aspecto grÃ¡fico, a pesar de ser lo de menos, en este gÃ©nero de juegos acaba siendo importante. Si el jugador no entiende lo que ve, no va a encontrar eso que le mandas buscar. Pero debo admitir de que los he jugado con una calidad grÃ¡fica muy impresionante. Eso sÃ­, el sistema de niveles, avance y detalles del gÃ©nero es una pasada, y no es para menos. El estudio que lo desarrollÃ³ cuenta con ingentes cantidades de juegos del gÃ©nero. Son unos veteranos y unos profesionales. 

Las animaciones son sinceramente el peor punto. No solo son pobres sino que algunas se me han buggeado durante esas 5 veces que lo he completado. Y quÃ© hablar del doblaje. Estamos hablando de un estudio con decenas de juegos de este estilo. Genera mucha pasta, quÃ© le costaba doblarlo correctamente. TambiÃ©n es cierto que es de 2012, y es posible que sus juegos mÃ¡s recientes sean muchÃ­simo mejores, pero lo importante es que estoy hablando de este. Y hablando de presupuesto, las traducciones. Oh dios, la traducciÃ³n al espaÃ±ol. Horrible. No quisiera saber cÃ³mo lo han traducido, pero tengo la sospecha de que fue con un traductor automÃ¡tico. Eso es muy de pobre. Yo mismo estoy desarrollando mis propios juegos y minijuegos, y ya tengo lista una traducciÃ³n en InglÃ©s completamente profesional. Un estudio se ve su ama sus juegos por como cuida los detalles que van directamente al pÃºblico, y por aquel 2012, este estudio iba un poco flojo.

Este gÃ©nero es bastante casual. Eso hace que este tipo de juegos sean muy importantes de hacer bien,y de saber quÃ© se hace en todo momento. Este estudio es profesional, y cuenta con mucha experiencia, sÃ­, pero transportÃ¡ndonos a este 2012 las cosas iban realmente mal. E insisto, estamos hablando de un estudio que genera bastante pasta, y si fuese yo, cuidarÃ­a de estos juegos antigÃ¼os. Actualizaciones, parches, mejoras visuales. Nunca, jamÃ¡s, nunca abandonÃ©is un juego antigÃ¼o, da muy mal imagen. MantendrÃ© este juego instalado y pendiente de parches, porque me gustarÃ­a ver como este estudio algÃºn dÃ­a cuida de sus juegos. Hasta entonces, tendrÃ© que dejar mi pulgar abajo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071375554', 'num_games_owned': 2813, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1517073291}
review:
This is one of AM games I didn't enjoy much in the beginning, I even left it for months before deciding to finish it. The story is about a woman who's fiance is missing in an expedition to a forgotten underwater city called Eden which was invaded by some wraiths. For me the story was average, there was a couple of jumps scares and some twists. The bonus chapter was a good addition to the story. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1282345013

Your adventure will be underwater which is one of the things I don't like much. However, in mid game, I started to enjoy the sceneries.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1282345608

Puzzles and hidden objects scenes were relatively easy. What I disliked is the voiceovers, it seems this woman voiced all of AM games but she failed in this one, her emotions sounded so staged. 

Another biggest issue is the map, see how pretty is this map? There is no fast travel option in it. I kept going back and forth in 40 locations as what it is stated in the game features. It felt as if I'm doing the Ooga Chaka Baby dance when I want to reach a certain area, you need to go back two steps, then take something and go to the previous area, it felt like a loop and too painful to backtrack all the time. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1282344387

Pros:
+Beautiful graphics and locations.
+Average story with jump scares.
+Beautiful useful journal.
+Steam achievements.
+Good bonus chapter.

Cons:
-Repetitive soundtracks.
-Bad voice over.
-No fast travel map. (Lots of backtracking)
-Bad characters animations.
-No replay value. (You are already forced to play it twice to get all achievements)
-I disliked the elevator.
-Inventory with no lock to keep it up

It is not the best game out there, but not necessarily a bad one. I do recommend it to people who ran out of HOGs and want to try out an older one. Don't pay full price though, it already been bundled many times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201178622', 'num_games_owned': 1357, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1515178653}
review:
Obviously, as this is an Artifex Mundi game, it'ss going to get a recommend. Beore they gave up on the genre, AF was the pinnacle of HOG gaming. This game is no exception.

I have two major complaints, however. The first is a story issue. Eden is a very interesting idea that was kept vague, even in the bonus story. As I (and likely a large percentage of others who will play this) have never played Bioshock, the reports of numerous references do little to explain the backstory of Eden. Some scattered notes describing its history would have been nice.

The second complaint iss a mechanical one. You get a lovely map at the very beginning, but there is no fast-travel. This isn't so bad in games where you explore small areas at a time, but for one where you must travel across the map and deal with elevator animations each time you change floors, the lack of uch a mechanic makes things more tedious.

Beyond these points, however, the game is rrather enjoyable and the puzzles are fairly simple, making it a great choice for casual gamers. The plotline also has some elements that aren't often explored, even if the main goal is rather clichÃ©.

review:

Les graphismes et les couleurs sont jolis, les traductions sont correctes et l'histoire prenante, mÃªme si je n'ai pas aimÃ© la fin.
Pour ce qui est de la difficultÃ©, c'est asser simple avec une ou deux Ã©nigmes qui sont plus corsÃ©es mais sans plus. En revanche, aprÃ¨s la moitiÃ© de l'histoire, les aller et retour pour naviguer dans le monde sont trop prÃ©sents, il n'y a plus de linÃ©aritÃ© et c'est plus un jeu de ballade and click qu'un jeu d'aventure puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011340401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1700555525}
review:
Story and scenery:
A rather short story, and although it's a bit of fun to detect all the references to bioshock (especially in the first couple of hours),it's all a bit too humourless and bland. 
That said, it's still Artifex Mundi, so the presentation and is more than ok.
For example the scene with the bridge is viewable from the elevator. Depending at which point in the story you see this, this view alters.For a simple hog this betrays an uncommon attention to detail.

Hidden object : 
You're given words and try to find the pictures. They're very easy and as english isn't my native language, I always pick up a word or two from these kind of games. They're very (too ?) easy and as usual in an AM-game they can be changed into a mahjong-board.

Puzzles : Now and then you'll need a couple of tries but they're mostly very easy (again, too easy ?) and fortunately no sliding puzzle in sight.

There are no secrets to find and the extra's let you have the standard stuff (wallpaper, music, cut-scenes, etc...). All in all, not the best AM-game I played but decent enough to warrant an upvote.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167963567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1511332039}
review:
The game is some what short, but of typical length as I understand it for a point and click adventure. this was my first time playing through a point and click adventure and i had a great deal of fun doing it. The only times I really had any trouble was when i happened to get in a rush and forget to read the puzzle directions.

I am looking forward to replaying this game in an attempt to gather all the achivments I missed the first time.

if you see it on steam sale for cheap I reccomend grabbing it even if you cant play it right away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316163593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2082, 'last_played': 1510143886}
review:
Pour les FranÃ§ais, le jeu a Ã©tÃ© traduit avec un traducteur online. Vous devrez donc chercher un ressort quand on vous demandera de trouver "sources" , un hochet quand il y aura marquÃ© "rÃ¢le", une aiguille pour "main", une plante pour "canne" et j'en passe des tout aussi mal traduites. Pour ceux qui veulent faire le jeu en FranÃ§ais, quand on ne s'y attend pas, Ã§a fait bizarre. 
Les clics sont Ã©galement une plaie. Le curseur n'est pas prÃ©cis, la moitiÃ© du temps il faut s'y reprendre a plusieurs fois ou aller lentement (pour certains succÃ¨s de rapiditÃ©, c'est pas Ã©vident), et Ã§a ne correspond pas toujours au visuel (par exemple, si vous dÃ©placez un truc dans une boite, l'objet reviendra a sa place parce qu'il considÃ¨rera ne pas avoir la place de se mettre a un endroit oÃ¹ il devrait avoir la place selon le dessin. 
Mon temps de jeu n'est pas accurate, parce que je laisse le jeu allumer quand je vais faire autre chose (et que j'ai du le refaire pour avoir tous les succÃ¨s), mais il n'est pas trÃ¨s long. Ã§a aurait certainement fait un bon jeu gratuit. Mais payant, Ã§a dÃ©Ã§oit.

review:
Se nota que es de los primeros de Artifex, no es malo, pero a nivel tecnico flojea un poco. Aun asi, por el precio que te puedes encontrar estos juegos si te gustan los HOGs este no puede faltar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091442007', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1509504410}
review: This is a decent game. I purchased this along with several other point and click games in a bundle, so this game was really only $0.20 for me. For that much money, I thought it was a pretty good game. I would never pay full price for this though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056223771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1509397853}
review:
In Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden, people have moved to Eden, an underwater colony, to find freedom and enlightenment.  [spoiler] Eventually their world turned dystopian. [/spoiler]  Some time later, you find your way there on the trail of your missing fiance.  He was diving in the area and disappeared.  

Aside from the fact that bad things SHOULD happen to people dumb enough to move to the bottom of the ocean to live at the complete mercy of technology and their leaders, it's an idea that I haven't seen a game about before!  Except maybe Original X-Com, part 2.  In any case, you show up and are there to solve all the problems that these potential cultists find themselves amidst.

This is where everything gets sort of ... meh.  The graphics are average and the writing seems ... bland.  The voice acting and puzzles are completely underwhelming.  They try to liven things up with some jump-scares, but these scenes are mildly amusing rather than scary.  Oh, and there is walking ... lots and lots and lots of walking ... back and forth  ... to and fro ... taking objects from one corner of the map to another, only to have to return.  

Also, you will have to do all this twice to get all the achievements, as the dominos and hidden object scenes are mutually exclusive.

Not great, not awful.  It's just a run-of-the-mill HOG.  There are much worse ways that I have spent 4 hours, so I'll recommend it, but only slightly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987144795', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1510339810}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994971393', 'num_games_owned': 2927, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1561648528}
review:
Definitely one of my favorite hidden object games. The team that puts these together really knows the genre. They have top notch UI polish, and their puzzles in expert mode are the perfect difficulty - challenging without being frustrating. A relaxing brain workout and attention-grabber.

The plot is actually quite fun - sort of a mashup of Lovecraft and BioShock.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372064534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1508622663}
review:
This game is... well, yes... i think it is awesome. It is Artifex Mundi and it is NOT a fluffy pink everything will be great game. 

When I saw the starting video, I wasn't sure about the kind of the game. Honestly, I thought, it would really suck. But it got a chance-and I am glad I did it. After ten minutes I couldn't stop playing because I wanted to know, how the story would go on. The game itself is a little bit more tricky than others but I liked this more, too. The story... well, everything I would say would be a spoiler. Just do yourself a favor and don't do too much research on the game because it lives from the surprising things. I hope you enjoy it as much as i did. i can highly recommend it. 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198267393126', 'num_games_owned': 1360, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1506777893}
review:
I genuinely did want to like this game, but considering the price and what you get, I can't

The art is good, the story is good, the characters are okay, but the mechanic turn what could have been a perfectly fine HOG into a tedious and annoying slog for achievements

Not to mention how much I hate the general idea of forcing people to play the game again on expert difficulty (which I do anyway, but is bullshit for people who get this expecting a casual game), but also having to play it through twice in order to get the achievements for BOTH puzzle options, HOG or Domino, which is just redundant and unnecessary. I like achievements in games, but they should feel like achievements, not like I've just removed a fingernail everytime I complete one

Not to mention the backtracking, now I don't mind being made to go back and find things, but this games map is idiotic, with the elevator being the worst of it. What kind of stupid engineer decided to have this elevator stop at every damn floor? You wanna make a convoluted map? Fine. But give the option to shortcut to different areas. If you're FORCING me to bounce between two levels to complete this game, then don't make it a damn chore to do so

Get it on sale or in a bundle, otherwise it's not worth it. Took me about 10 hours to finish this game with all achievements and I feel like I need to apologise to my mother for wasting this life she gave me

author: {'steamid': '76561198130262111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1506715489}
review:
â€œAbyss The Wraiths of Edenâ€ una interesante aventura acuÃ¡tica de bÃºsqueda de objetos, que presenta muchos puzles, que ya se ha visto en otros juegos de Artifex Mundi. La historia tiene connotaciones oscuras, la cual se cuenta en un castellano subtitulado lleno de erratas. Cuyos errores ortogrÃ¡ficos, provocan que no sepamos muchas veces, que estamos buscando entre los objetos.
TambiÃ©n sorprende, que no leamos palabras de un espaÃ±ol neutro, si no, de un espaÃ±ol latinoamericano, lo que dificulta bastante el entendimiento, para saber que buscar.
Lamentablemente, todos sus logros, siguen siendo solo accesibles, a travÃ©s de la jugabilidad de su modo historia principal, por lo que olvÃ­date de obtenerlo desde el menÃº de acceso a los puzles de â€œBusqueda de Objetosâ€ o la aventura adicional.
Ofrece variedad de extras, y como ya mencione antes, una ampliaciÃ³n de la aventura, protagonizado sorprendentemente por un hombre. 
Lo que hay que reconocerles, son las secuencias de video, que estÃ¡n bien trabajadas.
Aun tras mi critica, lo recomiendo, porque el juego merece la pena. 
Si lo compras, adquiÃ©relo solo por 1â‚¬, si lo encuentras formando parte de algÃºn bundle.

review: This game has a lot of detail and very interesting to move through. You backtrack a lot though which i was afraid i'd miss something lol. The graphics are pretty awesome. author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1611668074}
review:
This is a routine point and click hidden object puzzle game.  It's got widescreen support and looks decent on a modern PC, so you don't get distracted by technical failings/distorted aspect ratios/pillarboxing.

A very casual game and not everyone's cup of tea but if you like this sort of thing it's one of the better examples.  Unfortunately the developer wants $14.50 for the privilege of playing this mobile port on PC, when they give it away free to mobile gamers.  Screw those guys for having such disrespect for PC gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077907555', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1504562507}
review: Despite the game having many forays into the uncanny valley, I really enjoyed the puzzles. The story and dialogue are hammy as hell, but that somehow just adds to the charm.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062247697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1503343662}
review:
One more of the traditional Artifex Mundi hidden object adventures with a considerably challenging extra.

Your fiancÃ© Robet was last seen in an underwater expedition, in which he found a mysterious underground facility. To rescue him, you need fo venture in the facility while avoiding the bizarre Legates, who seem to be plotting something. Like the other titles from this producer (such as the Nightmares from the Deep series), you will need to solve Hidden Object puzzles and some other Minigames in order to collect items which will allow you to proceed the story. The Hidden Object puzzles can be freely swapped by a form of a Domino game. In my opinion, the Domino games are particularly disappointing and dull, however. The game also allows you to choose a difficulty too, between Casual and Expert.

The flow of the puzzles is good and most of the things feel logical. There is no "pixel hunting" as some other games of the genre, which is definitely a plus. The art is pretty, but sadly the whole game is in low-res. Fullscreen will just stretch it out.

Now, the extra chapter was a bit of a surprise. Its minigames are far more challenging than those of the regular game and was definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048659492', 'num_games_owned': 5460, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1451911981}
review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a puzzle game from publisher Artifex Mundi. The story asks you to explore a sunken city while destroying the evil hiding in this remote, underwater area.

The game provide hidden object scenes and various mini-games as puzzles, its all the usual, cant think about any special mini-game i not seen in any other HoG. Hidden object scenes could be finished by playing domino.

Just like in all Artifex Mundi games, the artwork is beautiful, the cutscenes and voice acting enjoyable. 

If you like these kind of games you will definetly enjoy this as much as i enjoyed it. Worth its price, but there are so many sales out there each year..... you can always wait for one.

As your Average Achievement Hunter ill share some informations about achievements:
20 steam achievements available. Just like for all these games, you need a playthrough without hint/skip. 2 playthroughs required, in one you need finish hidden objects scenes, in other one you need finish them via dominos. One of the playthrough should be on expert difficulty. You need finish 1 domino and 1 hidden obejct game too, each in less than 1minutes, so i suggest domino walkthrough for expert so you can spamclick hidden object scene on normal for the 1min speed achievement. Finishing bonus contect once also required for perfecting the game.
Time to 100%: 8-9h

author: {'steamid': '76561198044566427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1479548627}
review: A Bioshock-ish atmospheric hidden object game. A bit gloomy with some mild horror, which I enjoy when I'm in the right mood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001960104', 'num_games_owned': 1833, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1499549104}
review:
So, Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is not a bad game in itself. It is certainly a decently made hidden-object game, with plenty of nice illustrations and the riddles are okay as well. That is, however, where the good points end already. The story is meh, the animated sequences are worse and riddled with clipping errors, and the voice-acting is, well, not really deserving of the term "acting". And in order to obtain all achievements you have to play through the whole slog at least twice (ideally once for all the hidden-object scenes and once for their domino-based alternatives). At least you can go through it for a second time rather quickly, as skipping the animations and talk parts is possible in most cases and without them the game is actually rather short (roughly 3 hours).

So, while I won't completely condemn this game, I'd say get it only if you're a fan of the genre and don't care too much about decent storytelling and acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971048113', 'num_games_owned': 10059, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1500733661}
review: Pretty good story which is all that really matters here. Like other reviews have mentioned, it borrows stuff from several sources. Puzzles and hidden object scenes were solid. Recommended if you can get it for a good discount or from a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115984362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1500439370}
review: For a casual game, this one really tries to go above and beyond what's standard. There's a decent attempt at a story that's actually fairly interesting. It borrows a LOT of elements from Bioshock, especially in the aesthetic, as well as Lovecraft. The story and jump scares were all fairly predictable but it was fun nonetheless. The voice acting and dialog are really bad though to the point where it can be pretty funny. The animation and visual design were really appealing, but rips off many better things. Overall, though, pretty good game. I bought it on sale recently and probably wouldn't buy it for the full listed price. It's definitely not a $10 game, but if you can get it on sale, I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062030709', 'num_games_owned': 1379, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1500430706}
review:
[h1]This review will not cover the whole game, [i]yet.*[/i][/h1]

So far, I've really enjoyed the story within Abyss, and I've admired the artwork as well. While seemingly graphically mediocre, it still seems nice. It's obviously not the best looking game, but it still looks good. *I would really like to complete the game some day, but right now there are other games on sale that I know I'd play a lot more often than this game, so I'll be refunding it, [i]for now.*[/i] So far though, it's got a decent story, decent graphics, standard "hidden object/point & Click" gameplay, and it's at a decent price, and frequently on sale due to it's age and gametype, so I really would recommend you at least try it. There's always the refund option if you don't like it, or think you'd rather spend the same money on another title.
