author: {'steamid': '76561197982332500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1600688701}
review: Probably one of the best hidden object games I have played. It mixes classic hidden object skills with click and point adventuring and a good story as well. 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093236408', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1503022876}
review:
Pros:
*Nice Graphics
*Decent story, you want to know what is going on. The extra episode bumped it up to 7.5!
*Protagonist doesn't feel cheesy
*Villains do not feel cheesy
*A bit scary (I scare easily), but not too much!
*Relaxing
*Nice puzzles, I like the Domino game
*Classic Artifex Mundi, you get what you expect

Cons:
*Plot could have been fleshed out more, more details, there was room for it!

Comment: Definitely worth it if you can get it on sale and like these types of games, wouldn't pay full price. It says I have only 70 minutes played, but I have finished it.

Grade: 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198101342452', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1446154086}
review:
[b]Spielwertung:[/b] 6,5/10

7 Stunden und 2 1/2 DurchlÃ¤ufe spÃ¤ter. Was soll ich sagen? Eigene UnfÃ¤higkeit. 

[b]Spieldauer:[/b] ca. 2 bis 3 Stunden fÃ¼r einen Durchgang auf hÃ¶chstem Schwierigkeitsgrad

+ leichter bis mittlerer Schwierigkeitsgrad 
+ gut erreichbare Errungenschaften (erfordern aber ein zweites Mal durchspielen)
+ alternativ zum Beenden der Wimmelbildszenen kann man diese durch Domino lÃ¶sen (fÃ¼r die Errungenschaften benÃ¶tigt man aber beides)
+ Bonusabenteuer (ca. 1 Stunde)
+ schÃ¶ner Grafikstil mit teilweise hÃ¼bschen Unterwassergebieten

- viele Jumpscares (die nicht wirklich erschrecken)
- keine Schnellreisefunktion
- Fahrstuhlfahrten ohne ÃœbersprungmÃ¶glichkeit

[b]Zusammenfassung/Kommentar:[/b] 

Ein gutes Spiel aus dem Hause Artifex Mundi. Wer schon einige Spiele von diesem Entwickler gespielt hat, wird auch dieses mit hoher Wahrscheinlichkeit mÃ¶gen. Vertraute Steuerung und Funktionen machen es nicht schwer in das Spiel einzutauchen. 

Die Errungenschaften sind fast alle gut zu erreichen. â€Tempostreckeâ€œ bildet hier eine Ausnahme, die nicht ganz so einfach war. (Ein Dominospiel in unter einer Minute abschlieÃŸen.)  Man kann diese Errungenschaft aber auch mit Trick 17 erledigen. Bei Interesse einfach mal einen Guide auf Steam lesen, da wird diese MÃ¶glichkeit erÃ¶rtert. 

Die Wimmelbilder befinden sich in der Regel auf einem guten Level: nicht zu schwer aber auch nicht zu einfach. 

Wer Spiele von Artifex Mundi kennt, wird in den Minispielen auf vertraute Thematik treffen. Schwierigkeitsgrad liegt zwischen leicht und mittel. Sind in der Regel gut lÃ¶sbar, es gibt aber auch ein paar, wo man eventuell etwas lÃ¤nger knobeln muss. 

Schade finde ich, dass hier auf eine Schnellreisefunktion verzichtet wurde, besonders in Verbindung mit den unvermeidbaren Fahrstuhlfahrten. Gelegentlich muss man mit einem Fahrstuhl in andere Ebene fahren und ich bin diese Szenen sehr schnell leid gewesen. Ich denke, das dÃ¼rfte fÃ¼r die Meisten aber ein ertrÃ¤glicher Makel sein. 

Jumpscares sind auch in Wimmelbildspielen nichts Neues mehr. Dieses Spiel hat wirklich viele eingebaut, die nur leider nicht funktionieren und daher von mir eher mÃ¼de belÃ¤chelt wurden. 

[b][i]Fazit:[/i][/b] Gutes und solides Wimmelbildspiel mit ganz kleinen Makeln. Leider war es jedoch eins der Spiele von Artifex Mundi, welches mich nicht so sehr fesseln konnte. Ohne das ich sagen kann warum. Verkehrt macht das Spiel nicht viel, die Story ist passabel, die Grafik gut und dennoch ... Der Zeitraum den ich benÃ¶tigt habe, um â€Abyss: The Wraiths from Edenâ€œ zu vervollstÃ¤ndigen spricht fÃ¼r sich. Nicht desto trotz bleibt es fÃ¼r mich ein gutes Spiel, das eine Empfehlung verdient hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141404871', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1449906697}
review:
Yet another utopian society gone awry, this time due to human curiosity. (Though Pandora was not the one who opened the box this time.)

Storyline: Marine explorer Robert stumbles upon an underwater city.  Before being able to report his finding he is taken captive by a mysterious entity with glowing red eyes in a black robe.  After not returning from his dive, his female companion sets out to find him.  She follows his underwater trail to the underwater city of Eden.  Once inside she discovers the ruins of a once magnificent underwater utopian metropolis build to seek harmony and peace.  Her mission: Find Robert and along the way she discovers there are others still alive in this decaying city.  Some are survivors, some are rebels, and some are possessed.  Second mission: Escape.   (Any more storyline would spoil the mystery and adventure.) 

Reveiwers have blasted this game (circa 2012) for various things but the biggest complaint seems to be is it is a rip-off of Bioshock.  I have never played Bioshock so for me it was fresh and I did not compare two entirely different types of games with entirely different storyline concepts.  Besides anything written about any underwater utopia, if one wants to get technical, is a rip-off of Jules Verne's "Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea" and "Mysterious Island" or even Dr. No (the movie) of the James Bond franchise originally authored by Ian Fleming. 

Gameplay: Beyond the jump scares and the death count, (both of which should be expected due to what occurred in the storyline), the game plays in a sectional linear fashion with a find and use inventory that needs to be completed before being able to move into the next section/area.  The storyline is revealed through discovery as the gamer explores the complex.  Generally there is little backtracking but some items found in some areas can not be used until later in the game.  (So if playing on expert mode remember where there are.)   The Hidden Object scenes are scattered throughout and for the most part are only played once.  There are several times where the same scene is played twice but generally only after the gamer has progressed the storyline.  Certain Hidden Object scenes (generally a replay scene) and certain items only show up after the game progresses.  If stuck in an area that means something has not been done yet.

There is a lot of point and click hunt, find and solve to this game.  In my opinion this game leans toward point and click with Hidden Object finds as a secondary.  Which oddly enough works well with the storyline.  The same can be said for the puzzles, despite how random they seem.  The puzzles overall are fairly easy to solve and the usual fare.  However the puzzles work well for where they are, what needs to be done, and how they fit into the storyline.  So overall the continuity remains pretty much in tact.  

Final note:  In Artifex Mundi tradition, the Hidden Object scenes can be played with an alternative game.  In this case, it is dominoes.  Added 12/12/2015:  Here is a trick to getting the 1 minute time in the dominoes game: Play the Hidden Object scene as List find.  Play until only one List find clue is left then switch to the dominoes game.  Finish the dominoes game and walla achievement earned.

Overall, I liked the tight well-written storyline, which though a bit far-fetched is no better or worse then most "sci-fi horror" flicks, shows or books.  Oh last thing, there is a rather awkward proposal of marriage at the end which I thought I should mention being such a rare occurence in any game and gives this game a very personal touch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054269960', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1440638863}
review: Thoroughly enjoyed this game. Good story with lovely graphics. The puzzles are tricky but all the more rewarding when you solve them. Would definitely recommend this game for lovers of Point and Click or hidden object games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106837655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1445433800}
review:
Bella grafica (a parte le persone) e storia interessante, enigmi facilmente risolvibili e comandi semplici. Buono per chi ama il genere. Consigliato.
Voto 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198113862025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 298, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1445304838}
review:
[i]"AbyssÂ : Les spectres d'Eden"[/i] fait partie de ces jeux d'objets cachÃ©s / puzzles qui tentent avec plus ou moins de bonheur de se prendre pour des jeux d'aventure. Il n'est ni meilleur ni pire que ce qui se fait habituellement dans le genre dirons nous. PlutÃ´t dans la moyenne. Alors pourquoi une Ã©val nÃ©gative demanderez vous?

Parce qu'ici la traduction franÃ§aise est absolument [b]dÃ©-gueu-lasse[/b]!
Pour vous donner une idÃ©e de la qualitÃ© de la traduction de ce titre, la 1ere cinÃ©matique  vous accueille avec un bouton "saut" incrustÃ© en dessous [i](qui signifie apparemment "passer" dans le contexte)[/i]. La VF des sous titres comme de l'interface sont trÃ¨s approximatives, mais Ã§a n'empÃªche pas de jouer - par contre, lÃ  oÃ¹ Ã§a devient inexusable, c'est quand des erreurs se glissent dans les listes d'objets Ã  trouver :
Quand on vous demandera de trouver un "filet", vous dÃ©couvrirez qu'il fallait en fait cliquer sur du "fil" en bobines â€“  "raine" c'est une grenouille (rainette j'imagine, sauf qu'il manque 3 lettres) - et si vous bloquez en cherchant la "balance", il s'agit ici d'une tÃªte de poisson. (Une sorte de sardine O_o  lÃ  j'ai mÃªme pas compris comment ils ont pu aboutir Ã  cette "traduction".)
Bref, catastrophique & handicapant.

[i](Une autre chose qui m'a personnellement bien agacÃ©e : L'utilisation trop abusive de jumpscares tout le long du jeu... -_-' ExtrÃªmement mal dosÃ© et fort pÃ©nible Ã  la longue. Donc si comme moi vous dÃ©testez Ã§a, vous Ãªtes prÃ©venu(e) qu'il y en aura un paquet Ã  supporter. )[/i]

Mentionnons quand mÃªme quelques trucs positifs, car il y en aÂ : Les environnements sont jolis, (un plagiat Ã©hontÃ© de Bioshock, mais passons) - les mini jeux sont aussi plaisants que dans la plupart des titres du genre, et on le trouve souvent bradÃ© Ã  un prix ridicule...

Bref. Personnellement je trouve la traduction tellement inadmissible pour un jeu dont le gameplay est basÃ© sur son texte, qu'il ne mÃ©rite clairement pas d'Ã©val positive de la part du public francophone tant qu'Artifex Mundi n'aura pas patchÃ© la VF de son jeu. (Et Ã§a n'arrivera sans doute jamais : Ã§a aurait dÃ©jÃ  Ã©tÃ© fait depuis longtemps pour un jeu de 2012).

Pour autant, il serait mesquin de prÃ©tendre que le rapport qualitÃ© prix est malhonnÃªte pour un titre chopÃ© en solde Ã  2â‚¬. Et ce n'est heureusement pas trop risquÃ© de tenter le coup Ã  ce tarif lÃ  si vous aimez le genre (...et que vous supportez qu'on vous formule des devinettes de faÃ§on complÃ¨tement erronÃ©e).

author: {'steamid': '76561198000564950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1553130880}
review: While the puzzles and minigames were fun I sadly cannot reccomend paying money for this game.  The setting is obviously inspired by bioshock to the point that it comes off as a sort of store-brand version of Rapture.  The story is boring and not really too neccesary.  I think this could have just been made as a flash game if not for the full voice acting and partial 3d animation, both of which were poorly done.  The 2d art was fabulous though and I'd say was probably the best part of the game alongside it's really solid item puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089656901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1438568453}
review:
I started to like Hidden Object games because of this game.
But the regular price is expensive, maybe you can buy it in a bundle or discount season.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036146369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1444676527}
review: Man muss direkt vorab sagen, dass die Idee und auch die Artworks SEHR stark an Bioshock erinnern, also .. sozusagen schon abgekupfert sind. Aber da ich ein groÃŸer Bioshock-Fan bin, stÃ¶rt mich das Ã¼berhaupt nicht. Die Geschichte ist interessant, wenn auch etwas vorhersehbar und die Liebesgeschichte ziemlich plump. Aber trotzdem waren die RÃ¤tsel sehr gut (zumindest ein GroÃŸteil). Schade fand ich, dass bei einigen Szenen, die Lippenbewegung schrecklich abgehackt und keine flieÃŸende Bewegung ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1593151755}
review:
Auf der Suche nach einem verschwundenen Freund entdeckst Du ein versunkenes Reich mit fantastischen,mystischen, unglaublichen Orten und Charakteren.

Auf deiner Reise gibt es viele RÃ¤tsel und Wimmelbilder zu entdecken, diese gibt es widerum zu lÃ¶sen, um hinter das Geheimnis einer unheimlichen Macht zu kommen, die hier herrscht und den vermissten Freund sowie die Bewohner der Unterwasser-Stadt zu retten.

Das Spiel hat insgesamt 3 Schwierigkeitsgrade: leicht, normal und schwer,diese zeigen sich wie folgt: HÃ¶herer Schwierigkeitsgrad bedeutet weniger inaktive Hilfe im Spiel wo man bekommen kann. An der Geschichte Ã¤ndert sich daran aber nichts. 
Davon kann auch die Gesamtspielzeit abhÃ¤ngig sein. Auf Leicht hat diese zwischen 5- 6 Stunden bei mir gedauert.  

Wie von Artifex-Mundi gewÃ¶hnt hat man mit " Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden" wieder ein schÃ¶nes, spannendes und gut inszeniertes Wimmelbild-Abenteuer abgeliefert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062558470', 'num_games_owned': 903, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1443878127}
review:
This Game is a lovely point and click game with amazing graphics and a lovely art style! The Story was also rather interesting. The Puzzles are challenging, but I had alot of fun to accomplish them and I was always looking forward to the next one!

This whole game reminded me a bit on the first Bio Shock game and had a similar atmosphere!

Although the animations and the fact that people never blink ever, was a bit odd and not very well made. The Voice Acting wasn't good but neither it was bad. I personally found it alright. 

Due to the fact that this game only got 20 Achievements it shouldn't be hard to get a perfect game in it, as long as you are willing to put some effort with it.

I can recommend this game to all players with a good memory or which just want to play a nice calm point and click game with amazing graphics. But due to the fact that the main story is only 3 Hours Short I recommend grabbing this game in a Sale.

review: My second game played from Artefix - this one was a lot better. Beautiful scenes, thrilling cutscenes and fun puzzles. I still think the hidden object scenes need a bit more clutter, but they are beautifully made, though. Expert mode is a welcomed option because that makes the game a bit more difficult and I had to play longer. These games tend to be casually short so that's a plus. I'm waiting for another discounted title because the right price for those games should be no more than 2.50 euro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139328230', 'num_games_owned': 2324, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1434465556}
review:
The first time I've played this game was around the beginning of summer, looking for a decent HOG to spare the day for. As a HOG lover, I can most assuredly say that Artifex Mundi has always presented me the best examples of the genre, and [i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i] is no exception.

The story is about an underwater city established to seek "Enlightenment", mysterious wraiths called as "legates" taking control over the city, a limited number of survivors forming a resistance against them, and our poor, frustrated main character who is only there to look for her missing husband. Yes, the plot practically screams the [i]Call of Cthulhu[/i] meets [i]Bioshock[/i], but the game manages to handle a clichÃ© combination to craft a refreshing setting quite well. As any other Artifex Mundi game, the curtain opens up to an elaborate chaos which could only be sustained by our puzzle solving and item collecting genius.

Story and environment, with well-made artwork as always, are interesting enough to keep you going until you complete the game, which can be said for a select few games in this genre. There is a common formula for crafting HOGs which never fails: pick a mystery, add a missing person or at least a high stake, stir the pot with some HOG scenes and offer a complimentary cheesy ending. In our case, it comes with Artifex Mundi caliber artwork. All checked, we are ready to go!

Hidden Object scenes are decent, puzzles are fairly simple and adventure elements are easy to track down with the aid of your map. What I'd like to take a note of, is that item usage and combinations actually make sense too! Playing dominos as an alternative to Hidden Object scenes is creative and entertaining. Oh, and it is possible to finish the game without the aid of any kind of manual or walkthrough.

If you like the genre, or maybe the game is on sale, buy it already! It's Artifex Mundi. It basically cannot be bad. If you've played [i]Bioshock[/i], you'll be having a small voice in your head, whispering: "laaaaame", but you'll still play it out of curiosity. You are facing another beyond par HOG, so you are welcome!

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11672469/]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

And also Lady Storyteller's HOG Gems [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/27766387/]here[/url] - for casual games and HOGs you may enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048785147', 'num_games_owned': 1629, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1399235677}
review: I'm a fan of Artifex Mundi. Their games look great, have some nice variety, and are as long as they need to be. I wasn't a huge fan of the story, but the visuals spice it up a lot. If you want something relaxing, fairly easy, but still satisfying, this game will do the trick. I'd wait for it to go on sale, though. $10 for a game you may spend 5 hours to beat and never play again is a bit much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993803638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1443021064}
review:
Firstly, I must admit I was spoiled by playing "Nightmares from the Deep 2: The Siren`s Call" first. The 3D renders aren't as smooth and you can't use the map to jump to locations. One thing it doesn't have like that game - thankfully - is no collectibles to find along the way.

Apart from the odd 3D, it's mostly a good looking, nice sounding game with decent puzzles. It's really hard for me to articulate any particularly good parts so I have to indulge in some criticism.

There are 2 sections that involve moving around objects that are weird and unintuitive. Too many pieces, too many large pieces and pieces will often jump back or lie somewhere close.

Elevator gets annoying. You have to stop at each floor, waiting a second or so for the door to open till you can continue. Particularly weird is that you can't control its direction so at one point in order to go up 1 floor, you need to go down first then up 2 floors. Aestetically annoying is that you can't shut the panel once you've fixed it...

Story seemed dubious at first but does gets explained near the end.

Jump scares not particularly scary for me, especially the first one.

Some hidden object clues are'nt clear but that's to be expected. One I really didn't approve of was "sugar bowl". I did an Image Search for that and it did NOT come up. What it should have been is "sugar dispenser".

Some achievements mean you'll have to play the game at least twice: once for the hidden objects and once for the dominos. Both times on Expert Mode. Else, like me, you'll have to play it about 5 times.

Speaking of Expert mode, Hiding HO areas is cruel especially considering they're repeated in some. Also for the reason that some interactive areas are just for flavour text. In fact, one is repeated AND has flaour text. I had to use the hint twice because there's no logical reason to go back a specific area and click on it again, especially if it's not nearby.

I managed to get all the achievements in 8 hours without a walkthrough so I'm satisfied with that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103090723', 'num_games_owned': 3001, 'num_reviews': 344, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1418612167}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041006664', 'num_games_owned': 3876, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1415010679}
review:
I don't have anything against this sort of game really. Hidden Object games are a fun casual experience from time to time. My problem with the endless flood of these things on steam is that they aren't very good. The art is nice (barring the characters themselves) and the object finding is good enough but each game lacks anything to make it stand out from the others. 

The best Hidden Object games in my mind remain the I-Spy ones, Treasure Hunt and Haunted House in-particular. They had simple goals but they were fun to pursue. Each Hidden object was a good time and clicking on things made them animate and made a simple game that much more entertaining. In this game everything just fades out of existence when you click on it. This makes each puzzle a chore instead of an experience. 

The I-Spy games were also made or kids in mind so the goals were pretty simple, escape the house, find the treasure etc. However these were fun and relate-able in the sense that they were likely things kids imagined on their own. These games opt for some overly complex bull crap story with no real substance whatsoever. They choose to have characters with backstories and what not and still every one of them feels and sounds entirely disinterested at all times. 

The other big problem I have here is backtracking. Sending the player all over this needlessly large environment to either pick up loose objects or do the same hidden object puzzles with different items to find. In I-Spy backtracking was done once at the end of the game to find hidden clues inside each puzzle that linked together. This was a really cool reason to backtrack because it meant the treasure, key, or whatever had been in plain sight all along. Here its just another chore to get another item so i can proceed to go to another puzzle.

Plus as far as this story goes... I defeated the dumb evil sea monster by literally messing up his drawing on the floor. That's what we call a payoff right there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970882976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1441233507}

author: {'steamid': '76561198123054255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1437416154}
review:
Despite having the most absurd story of them all, Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is my favourite HO game of the same developer. Like the others, it is graphically very beautiful, and the story is somewhat silly.
Yet the female protagonist this time seems to have a spark of initiative the others geneally lack. It is refreshing to see a female protagonist save her male counterpart and everyone else.
In a perfect balance between all the things that make HO games fun and what makes the utterly horrible games, this one has a good enough story, a good enough scenario, and lacks all the things that make the other games so terribly annoying, like horrible voice acting, a stupid character or the solution to the puzzles too obvious.

Not extremely long, but I got a nice kick out of this one, and a somewhat satisfactory sensation when it was over. This one is worth buying. Maybe for a discount, but go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971341065', 'num_games_owned': 3377, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1467141022}
review:
Abyss will seem very familiar to a lot of us, there is clearly a lot borrowed from Rapture (Bioshock) in terms of the scenario and even the look and feel of Eden and the fall of a supposed libertarian/freedom enclave under the sea into a supernatural fascist police state - and then it gets worse. The storyline at least is somewhat different from its thematic inspiration, so it doesn't feel like a complete retread.

In terms of gameplay the HOG scenes all play fine, and the puzzles were also pretty good - a reasonable mix and a moderate difficulty in most cases, and the point and click sections in between it all works well enough, nothing too illogical or jarring, and of course the HOG genre fits quite well into this semi-apocalyptic scenario of scavenging around for tools and clues as to what is happening. An alternative to playing the HOG scenes - dominos - is available, although it is pretty bland, and it seems a bit odd when these sorts of things are provided, as it seems unlikely there is big market of people that would play a HOG if the HOG scenes weren't there, as they tend to make pretty weak point and click puzzlers with this part taken away. 

As has been mentioned in other reviews, one of the weaknesses here is the animations when characters are talking to you which makes them look like mannequins (although due to they story in a few cases this is somewhat appropriate), which is a bit jarring. Another minor issue is that the achievements are set up so you have to play the game twice - once doing only HOG scenes, once playing Dominos at each such scene, in order to get 100%. 

However in summary this is a well made, if derivative, game that is easy to play, mildly challenging in places, and with an okay storyline and atmosphere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971532357', 'num_games_owned': 2752, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 1662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1589123430}
review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a beautiful tale about a diver set to save her lover from a terrible fate in the lost City of Eden,  a town living under the waters. Helped by people hiding and having survived to the terrible years of dictatorial rulings under surnatural forces, she's the only one that can stop everything.

The game has a strong story. You're going from surprise to surprise and the landscapes are beautiful and scary too as you're dealing with a fallen city under evil forces. Yet, the puzzles and the hidden objects are just what you need for a casual game.

I speak from memory because it's long time since I've played but the only thing that annoyed me is Robert, the lover. The voice acting was weird. I don't know why though, because the rest is correctly done. The soundtrack is also good.

No, really, Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a beautiful tale, like Artifex Mundi can do. Don't hesitate!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968357064', 'num_games_owned': 11834, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1439692432}
review:
Dalsi povedena adventura od Artifex Mundi a znovu drzi sve kvality. Tentokrat v podmorskem prostredi tajemneho mesta. O tom by se dalo asi nejvic diskutovat. Hra je sice krasne nakreslena, ale je to stylem fakt brutalni kopie Bioshocku od 2K Games. Docela by me zajimalo, jestli to nenarusuje nejaka prava :) Ale co, pro hrace je to jen plus. 
Zachranujete sveho snoubence ze sparu prizraku, ktere jsou ovladany mocnym demonem. Grafika je velmi povedena a atmosfericka, 16:9, dokonce i videosceny jsou celkem fajn. Az na rozhovory s postavami - ty dostaly neprirozene prkenne obliceje, kterym se casto hybou jen usta a pusobi to docela amatersky. Kdyby udelali rozhovory s celou postavou, ne jen "obliceji", pusobilo by to myslim lip. 
Hadanky jsou opet dost jednoduche (zase ruzne posouvani a skladani) a doufam, ze uz autori nebudou dale zlehcovat. Sice je fajn, ze minihry nebrzdi tempo, ale i na expertni obtiznost (je za to achiev.) je hra docela snadna. Hidden object screeny (HOS) jsou prehledne a dobre prokreslene a daji se nahradit hrou s dominem. S tim souvisi opet moje vytka vuci achievementum. Nesnasim, kdyz kvuli 100% musim adventuru dohravat 2x (jednou s HOS, jednou s dominy). Hra je porad stejna, takze je to dost nuda (to neni jak RPGcko, kde si clovek aspon muze pokazde udelat jinou postavu). Take jezdeni vytahem ve hre bylo trochu otravne, jelikoz jsem neprisel na to, jak se posunout naraz o dve patra (presouvani pres mapu chybi, skoda). 
A posledni vytka je hlavne pro znalce dalsich her od Artifex, hlavne prvniho dilu "Enigmatis". Jedna z postav jakoby z oka vypadla kazateli z Maple Creek. Take lokace se stromem, kde je i vzhledove podobna hadanka jako v Enigmatis, jakoby odkazovala na tuto hru. Coz ale vubec nedava smysl. Nenapada me jedina mozna souvislost mezi temito hrami, a tak tyto "easter-eggy" zustavaji spis velkou podivnosti. 
Zbytek je ale fajn, postup je logicky a nemel jsem zadny neprijemny zakys. V CE edici navic hrac dostane prequelovou bonusovou kapitolu a jako vzdy wallpapery, OST a dalsi. Pokud si hru stahnete z Alawaru, muzete ji hrat v kvalitnim ceskem prekladu (ale opet, uz je to temer pravidlem, se nevyhli bugum v HOS kvuli vice vyznamum angl. slov, takze napr. misto "prutu" hledejte vetvicku, misto "stetce" kartac nebo misto "vahy" rybi supiny).

70%

author: {'steamid': '76561198017843065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1439702486}
review:
Quick and fairly easy Hidden Object game.

Nice underwater setting and story with fitting graphics and sound. Each HO scene has an alternate 'Domino' style puzzle accompanying it, so second play through is a must for achievement hunters. Good amount of logic puzzles to keep it interesting.

Recommend for your smarter kids.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014442793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1535523192}
review:
I'm not the sort to prejudice games over things like their being hidden object puzzlers; and the Artifex Mundi games are by far the best examples of the genre. Nonetheless A.M. has followed the method of if it isn't broke don't fix it, meaning they reuse their puzzles with cosmetic variations from one game to another. This has the unfortunate result that if you've played one of their games you've played them all.

That's O.K. if you think of the games as more visual novels with bonus puzzle content. Granted the writing isn't amazing; but it isn't bad either. I know I've yet to play an A.M. game I could make myself stop playing before the end. That's, on average, over 3 hours in one sitting. And, most of their games include a bonus chapter that extends gameplay another hour.

They do manage to do this without unnecessarily padding game length that overstays its welcome. I know that doesn't sound like much in an industry with triple AAA titles that boast hundred of hours of gameplay. But, for cheap casual games this is an achievement.

My recommendation, because of the "if you've played one you've played them all" problem, is pare your selections down to their better games. That would be Enigmatis 2 (but not the mediocre Enigmatis: the Ghosts of Maple Creek) as a top pick, Grim Legends 1 & 2 if you liked that, and the Nightmares from the Deep trilogy if you just can't get enough of these games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153689102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1451188738}
review:
O jogo Ã© bom. Tem uma boa jogabilidade, boa histÃ³ria, bons puzzles, bons grÃ¡ficos. Embora algumas falhas irritantes, como erros terrÃ­veis na traduÃ§Ã£o e algumas cenas que fazem a histÃ³ria parecer bem cafÃ© com pÃ£o, o jogo vale apena se vocÃª gosta de point n' click e estÃ¡ procurando um jogo diferente.

A histÃ³ria poderia ser melhor? Sim, poderia... mas nÃ£o Ã© tÃ£o ruim, e depois nos "extras" vocÃª ainda pode jogar uma outra histÃ³ria e descobrir o que realmente aconteceu antes de tudo aquilo, o que exatamente era aquele lugar, e ter um ponto de vista diferente, atravÃ©s de outro personagem.

Quanto aos sustos... eu sÃ³ me assustei uma ou duas vezes no mÃ¡ximo, entÃ£o nÃ£o espere algo assustador, Ã© muito mais suspense. E nada que te deixe realmente com medo.

Os puzzles seguem os jÃ¡ clÃ¡ssicos e conhecidos puzzles de todo jogo do estilo, nÃ£o vi muita coisa nova, diferente, mas sÃ£o bem elaborados. Alguns sÃ£o atÃ© difÃ­ceis, se vocÃª nÃ£o cometer o pecado de jogar no modo iniciante.

Eu daria nota 6... talvez 7 se eu estiver em um dia bom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024972696', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1438310175}
review:
"Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden" is pretty much your standard Artifex Mundi casual adventure Hidden Object Game (HOG).  The graphics are fairly nice, the story is trite but adequate, the voice acting is mostly tolerable, the puzzles enjoyable, and the Steam Achievements a bit irritating.  If you've played any Artifex Mundi HOGS, there's nothing unexpected.  Really, the only minor negatives are those Steam Achievements:  the HOG and the Dominoes Achievements are mutually exclusive.  So, to get 100% Achievements, you're forced to do two run-throughs.  And, as usual, since there are no saves, if you mess up, you have to finish that run-through regardless and then do it again.  One thing to point out with this game (like a lot of these HOGs) is that it's old enough that the user profile is not saved in the Steam folders or even in the standard Saved Games folder.  Instead, it's saved in the hidden folder [username]\AppData\Roaming\ArtifexMundi\Abyss_TheWraithsOfEden\CE.  So, if you're worried about losing it, make sure you back that up.

I got about 9.6 hours of good game play out of the game (6.5 hours for the first run-through with the Bonus Chapter and another 3.1 hours for the second run-through).  So, even at it's list price, the game is close to being worth it.  Of course, if you can find it on sale (as I did), then go ahead and snap it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096764382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1469376741}
review: Ein wirklich schÃ¶nes P&P Spiel mit wirklich tollen Bildern und auch Ã¼berraschend gute Sprechern, was wirklich nicht selbstverstÃ¤ndlich ist bei solchen Spielen. Klare kaufempfehlung meinerseits, macht bis zum Ende spaÃŸ, welches man leider viel zu schnell zu gesicht bekommt, nach knapp 2 stunden ist es schon um. Aber im Sale wÃ¼rde ich es mir auf jeden Fall gÃ¶nnen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013914895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1581306769}
review:
While it is obvious this is one of the earlier game (they hadn't quite gotten people to not look horrying when they talk), this is a really fun game! Some of the scares made me jump a little and very much kept me on my toes.  Found the timeline a little confusing  as if someone had mashed up modern day and 1920s into one, and the 'bonus' game is a little harder to find (go into extras you'll find it there).  

Overall though; if the game is on sale? Pick it up. 

If you don't like being scared you might want to go for their grim legends seires instead or the clockwork tale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120993683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1438039485}
review: I wouldn't buy this game again. Even for the $2.30 I spent on it. Cliche story, bad art, way to much running around instead of more puzzles. And the tips aren't even that helpful. Half of the time I was lost because I forgot to grab some stupid item and had to back track half the whole map to get it. And a lot of the puzzles were just plain boring.

review: If I had found it on Newgrounds, I'd have been impressed.  As it stands...the whole hidden object genre feels like adventure games, minus any sense of character or story.  The best thing I can say about this game is that the voice acting is hilariously bad, especially in the extra content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970149845', 'num_games_owned': 3732, 'num_reviews': 453, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1437921078}
review:
A nice hidden object game, with (mostly) pre-rendered scenes.

Animation are of rather poor quality, voiced audio is pretty good, music is great but limited (by the end of the game, youâ€™â€™ notice it always repeats).

The first playthrough took me 3 hours. Has additional bonus content on top of that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095247113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1437713818}
review:
Short version: if you always admired the artistic style of Bioshock but hate first person shooters, you'll love this game instead.

I loved the aesthetics of this game from start to finish.  Great graphics, art deco meets underwater steampunk style.  There is a fun horror-esque surprise element that gets your attention without being gruesome.  The storyline makes resonable sense and kept my attention.  I finished the whole thing plus the bonus chapter in about 4 hours, which is about twice as long as most of the ridiculously-short hidden object games out there.  I'd file this game as more of a point-and-click adventure game, with some HOG screens thrown in.  The HOG screens are colorful and varied enough to be fresh as the game went on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117791534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1436730159}
review:
If you're a HOG fan, then you probably already know that Artifex Mundi games are good stuff and that Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden won't disappoint you.  Like most of their games, there's decent variety in the scenes and puzzles combined with just enough running around, item combo, and actual story line to keep you interested throughout the game.  You do locate a map in this game, which becomes helpful in the later part of the story when you are running around more.  

The ending was done well and leaves itself open for a sequel.  If there is a sequel, I will definitely play it.  Side note - I also enjoyed the bonus chapter, which is a prequel for two of the characters in the main storyline.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028450654', 'num_games_owned': 5809, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1578391672}
review:
Ich spiele total gerne Wimmelbildspiele. Ich hatte mich vorhin noch einmal gefragt warum eigentlich. Ich glaube es liegt daran, dass sie nicht besonders anspruchsvoll sind, aber meistens eine recht interessante Story erzÃ¤hlen. Letzteres ist mir an Spielen soweiso immer am wichtigsten. Zudem ist es so, dass ich tÃ¤glich sicher 10-12 Stunden arbeite, meistens 6 Tage die Woche und Abends dann keine groÃŸe Lust mehr habe auf einen AAA Titel, sondern eher noch 1-2 Stunden vor der Daddelkiste entspannen will. Dann kommen solche Wimmelbildspiele immer gut bei mir an, weil sie eben nicht sehr schwer zu lÃ¶sen sind, ein entspanntes spielen also.

Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden hat mir dabei besonders gut gefallen, weil nicht nur die Story gut erzÃ¤hlt wird, sondern weil sie auch spannend ist. Man will sozusagen die ganze Zeit wissen wie es weitergeht und klickt das Spiel in einem Rutsch durch. Zugegeben, das ist nicht sehr lange, etwa 3 Stunden, aber 3 interessante Stunden. Das Besondere war auch, dass man an einer Stelle irgendwann dachte "Jetzt kÃ¶nnte es zuende sein", also man das GefÃ¼hl hatte man ist dem Ende relativ nahe und dann passierte noch einmal was, was man so nicht erahnt hÃ¤tte und das Spiel wurde dann, obwohl es schon anfing langweilig zu werden, noch einmal sehr spannend. Das Finale wurde dann sozusagen eingelÃ¤utet und ab da hatte das Spiel noch einmal richtig SpaÃŸ gemacht. FÃ¼r mich ein Highlight unter den Wimmelbildspielen.

[url=mediennerd.de/neu-auf-steam/]Mehr STEAM Spiele die mir gefallen[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197997741024', 'num_games_owned': 7542, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1441371459}
review:
Another Artifex Mundi point and click puzzle adventure game. Reminds me a lot of the days spend playing 7th Guest back in the day. Unlike '9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek' - this game shows a great deal of promise - having only played an hour so far. It has striking smooth visuals, and the puzzles won't leave you throwing your computer out of the window - and will run on most systems. It's Â£7 in the UK, and even if the game only gives you a few hours of entertainment, it'll be worth the money, and judging by how the game has proceeded thus far, I'd be inclined to recommend this to anyone who likes puzzle adventures.

Not so sure about the 'spot-the-item' sections, which can be bypassed by playing dominoes - perhaps this is to avoid having sections which may prove too hard for some. Who knows. In any case, it looks like a great family-friendly game, with added spookiness!

If you see it on sale, it's a no-brainer.

Once again, I've recorded my gameplay for your perusal:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m-nftCrs-y4

author: {'steamid': '76561198027424772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1520491489}
review:
[b][u]Game Information[/u][/b]

"Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden" is a Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game. The game was developed and published by Artifex Mundi.

[b][u]The Game Review[/u][/b]

Game Visuals

I want to mention that the visuals in the game are nicely done with a painted feel to them. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mention that audio for the game is well done. Even though the audio is somewhat simplistic and repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are three different game difficulty modes to choose from: Casual; Advanced and Expert.

The notebook keeps track of progression in the game. Such as story events and clues.

There is no padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place to make it stationary. The inventory panel does slide up whenever it is being moused over.

There is an interactive map in the game. It allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly without having the need to constantly backtrack. It also indicates that there are a variety of tasks that can be completed at various locations within the game. The interactive map is automatically given at the start of the game.

The hidden object scenes consist of the following: Traditional word lists and Fragmented items. Some of these hidden object scenes may require little or no interactions. Most of the hidden object scenes can be replayed in the game's extra feature section.

There is an optional mini-game: Domino. It is only available during hidden object scenes.

The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them.

There is a bonus chapter in the game. But it can be accessed only after the main story is completed.

There are twenty different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that need to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Miscellaneous

There are extra features in the game: Bonus Chapter; Bonus Hidden Object Scenes; Soundtracks; Concept Art and Wallpapers. Most of these extra features can be accessed only after the entire game is completed.

There are six different trading cards to collect. Only three of those trading cards are given out by the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading cards: Purchased from the Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to certain extent. The replay for the game is low. I would recommend this game, but not at the game's full price value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102236617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1434968072}
review:
Now depending on what you looking for this might be great or boring.

The pro's of this game:

+Love the artwork, really nicely done
+ Love the sounds / music 
+The puzzles aren't too hard and are fun to do
+It's a quick game and a good game to kill some boredom.
+Nice cut scenes in between the puzzles

The cons?

+Just like most point and click games it is a rather quick game to play (so don't expect a lot of hours of playtime )
+Travelling is gruesome, you have to click each room (lets say those are 5 steps) so you have to click 5 rooms before getting to a small task (for example finding an object) only to click the same steps back (you do have a map, but you cannot use it for shortcuts...)


All in all i liked most of the game (i played it 2,8h so finished it in one day) But now, after continuesly clicking through those rooms i have to say that my hand / wrist hurts So maybe for all you people out there; buy it on sale and don't play it straight through to avoid my problems xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198048206769', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1501156259}
review:
I like these games for the puzzles (mini games), I would be happy with just them and no Hidden Objects and no story. Most of the time, the rest is fun too though. As is the case here.

I played this through a while ago, but not the bonus adventure yet, and wasn't much bothered by achievements. Now I replayed it for those two things. I enjoyed it the first time and had fun a 2nd (and will for a 3rd - for Domino) time. During the 2nd play-through I noticed that the hidden objects in the various scenes change in each play-through. Nice touch.

The hidden object games are just right for my taste (medium difficulty), the story is intriguing. The colourful places have something that really appeals to me.

The puzzles and the Domino as alternative to the hidden object games are fun to do.

I'd have liked an option to jump around on the map as is possible in some of the other games by Artifex Mundi.

It's a shame that the achievements for all hidden object/all Domino games can't be done via the extras, and needs a 2nd play through. On the other hand, as I said the story and the puzzles are fun, so I'll enjoy doing the replay twice even. 

There are few games where I don't turn the music off first thing, so I can't say anthing about that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054571191', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1433336725}
review:
Wie von Artifex Mundi gewohnt, weist auch dieses Wimmelbildspiel eine hohe QualitÃ¤t auf. 
Anhand einer Story wird man durch verschiedene SchauplÃ¤tze gefÃ¼hrt, an denen man Aufgaben lÃ¶sen muÃŸ um im Spiel voran zu kommen. Diese Aufgaben bestehen zumeist daraus, Objekte zu finden, mit denen man dann ein Minispiel starten kann, welches wiederum zum weiterkommen gelÃ¶st weden muÃŸ. Die zu suchenden Objekte sind dabei meist in Wimmelbildern versteckt.
Die Wimmelbilder und Minispiele sind dabei nicht besonders schwer zu lÃ¶sen, machen aber dennoch SpaÃŸ. Zumal dadurch jeder die Chance bekommt, das Siel auch durchzuspielen. Schwerer ist es schon, den richtigen Ort zu finden, an dem man dann weiterkommt, oder ein neues Objekt findet. Viele Orte mÃ¼ssen mehrmals besucht werden, was einem manchmal hin und her laufen lÃ¤sst.

Alles in allem kann ich dieses Spiel fÃ¼r Fans von Wimmelbildspielen nur klar empfehlen, wie Ã¼brigens alle Tilel von Artifex Mundi, die ich bisher gespielt habe.

Anmerkung zu den Errungenschaften: Wer alle Errungenschaften erspielen mÃ¶chte, muss das Spiel zweimal spielen!
FÃ¼r jedes Wimmelbild kann man alternativ auch ein Dominospiel spielen. FÃ¼r beides gibt es aber eigene Errungenschaften. Macht nicht den Fehler und spielt mitten im Spiel ein Dominospiel anstelle des Wimmelbildes, oder merkt euch die Stelle genau, um beim zweiten durchspielen dann hier das Wimmelbild zu spielen. Sonst mÃ¼sst ihr unter UmstÃ¤nden das Spiel ein drittes Mal starten um alle Errungenschaften zu erhalten. Den Fehler habe ich jedenfalls gemacht! ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037092141', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1433188918}
review:
Very enjoyable game. A bit darker than the usual HOG. The game has a lot of jumpscares.

You play a woman (whose name does not come up in the game iirc) trying to find her fiancee who went missing at sea while diving.  When following his footsteps she discovers a mysterious underwater city.

The art is beautiful and the music is good. The puzzles, I found, were either a bit too easy with a few exceptions with "wtf am I doing -spamclick until it works-". The game has 3 difficulty levels, the lowest difficulty shows actions availible on the ingame map and everything useful in the world sparkles. On the hardest no availables are shown and there is no sparkle. 

There is an achievement for not using hints in the HO scenes, but for progressing in the world the hint button is near spammable. As an option instead of the HO scenes this game has a domino game you can do. To get all the achievements in the game you have to go through the game twice; once playing hidden objects and once with dominos. My playtime is one game on hardest difficulty and HO scenes and once with skipping absolutely everything and speeding it.

Pretty much all cutscenes and dialogues are skippable. The map has no teleport option and is mostly useless on the harder modes as you're unlikely to be lost. The story is good,, though I wish you learned more about the world in the game. 

The game is the Collector's edition by default, so it has an extra chapter when you're done with the game as well as wallpapers, music etc. Small nuisance of how the opening cutscene to the game starts playing every time you open it, before the main menu, but as it's skippable it's not a big problem. I encountered no bugs and the game ran smoothly. As tends to be with this company the animation cutscenes is the least impressive part of the game, but still they're not terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027282668', 'num_games_owned': 2016, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1432016030}
review: Pretty good game. I got really sucked into it. The environment was well constructed. Eden is reminiscent of Rapture from Bioshock and slightly like Sierra Madre from Fallout: New Vegas too (what with the weird monster guards roaming the place). The puzzles were enjoyable but a bit on the easy side. I didn't feel compelled to use hints or skip or even look at the map once the whole game. The voice acting was pretty bad though. Very robotic. The story could have been a lot better because the setting and background story to the setting was really good. As it is, it kind of felt like you only touched on the surface of things. The bonus adventure was very worth playing too. Delves a bit deeper in to the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058635054', 'num_games_owned': 2629, 'num_reviews': 341, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1432267104}
review: Interesting and relaxing hidden object adventure game. A little short and not great voice acting but surprisingly cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972086995', 'num_games_owned': 1983, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1432264370}
review: Never a dull moment with these games by 'Artifex Mundi'. I've played a few of theirs and they're always good. Fully enjoyed this little gem, got it at sale price too. Point and click your way to having fun.

review: This game is pretty entretaining :D the puzzles are really funny and not so hard to solve, the graphics are pretty good only bad part of it is sometimes when the characters talk and in the extra story they look really stiff, if you don't mind the classic "Oh wow, thanks god this unussual object was right here" kinda thing it is really goodespecially if you get it in a bundle or a sale :D

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198078799348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1431028206}
review:
Y quien a dicho que una aventura de buscar objetos no puede ser entretenida y de calidad, y encima con una buena historieta, Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden es todo eso y deja un buen sabor de boca, acostumbrado a jugar a este tipo de juegos no representa un reto excesivo pero cumple su cometido de entretenimiento como si de una historieta de libro o comic se tratara, con lo cual invita a llevarlo hasta el final.

El apartado grafico no es ninguna maravilla en tecnologia pero muestra gran colorido y detalle para su desarroyo, la banda sonora y efectos entran en un apartado acorde con el juego, el control y jugabilidad son totalmente correctos y simples, dispone de traduccion de texto en espaÃ±ol, por lo cual entenderemos la historia del mismo.

Resumiendo: Estamos ante un buscador de objetos interesante y entretenido, con gancho por la historia que se nos ofrece, y aunque corto, no mas de 2 a 3 horas jugando tranquilamente, nos ofrece un contenido apropiado.

Valoracion final: 8/10 Recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013815387', 'num_games_owned': 1553, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1430886653}
review:
Length of Time Played: ~4 Hours
Distance Played: 100% Achievements
Personal Grade: B

Opinion of Each Aspect

Grading System - Outstanding, Excellent, Good, Acceptable, Poor, Horrendous, Abysmal

Gameplay: Excellent
Stability: Acceptable
Story: Good
Controls: Excellent
Graphics: Acceptable
Music: Good
Sounds: Excellent
Difficulty: Outstanding

Notes: + (Positives), = (Small Gripes), - (Negatives)

+ Addicting gameplay for its genre
+ Great challenge for children or casual gamers
+ Fluent controls allow for precise clicking
+ Well done sound effects
+ Music fits the atmosphere of the environment
+ Superb backgrounds and 2D animation
+ Domino game provided to let you skip Hidden Object Scenes

= 3D cutscenes can be very hit or miss when it comes to movement
= The game can freeze if you click too quickly when loading the Hidden Object Scenes

- The facial movements for the 3D dialogue parts is laughably bad most of the time

Summary: A great addition to the Hidden Object Game (HOG) Genre by easily one of the best developers in the trade. The puzzles are good at keeping your brain active as well as an alternative domino game if those aren't your style. While it suffers from a rather cliche storyline, the scenery makes it worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1428940660}
review:
Yet another great hidden object adventure game from Artifex Mundi.  While the story may not seem original, very Bioshock -esque, the story itself is good enough to keep you interested and also differs enough from Bioshock to keep it entertaining.  The graphics are beautiful with great animations and cut-scenes.  The puzzles can range from super simple to somewhat difficult.  The hidden object games aren't the most difficult that I've seen, but at least offer enough variety of objects to choose from that it's above par compared to other games of the genre.

Overall, this is one of the top of its kind, so definitely worth the play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124275446', 'num_games_owned': 1852, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1427432224}
review:
Let me start off this review by saying that I'm not too well-versed in hidden object games (yet). I played a free-to-play hidden object game years ago and remembered liking it well enough. I love finding things in games. Anything. Collectibles, secret areas, shinies, etc. Heck, I love searching for and finding things in real life, too. I'm a married woman and I still insist on my mother hiding my Easter basket every year. I'm not sure what's sadder; that my mother actually listens to me and hides my basket every year, or that she still gives me one at all.

Nonetheless, thanks to the Steam queue, I have been introduced to the genre yet again. I purchased a few on a whim one day, and Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden was the first I played. I was in a casual game type of mood after putting much thought and effort into a lengthy RPG, and this game was really enjoyable in that respect. 

The game opens up with your character's voice laying out the prologue to the story, and it made me giggle a bit because she sounded like a generic Microsoft computer voice at first. While the environments in this are beautiful and colorful, the entire game has a type of B-movie feel, with iffy voice actors, a "meh" story, and no sense of danger at all. The game definitely tries to throw some creepy moments at you, but never did I feel like my character was in danger or that a save would need to be reloaded. The game isn't scary at all for adults, but for young kids, it might be sufficiently creepy on rare occasions (and this game is definitely E-rated).

Abyss surprised me in that the game, while in the Hidden Object genre, was not overflowing with hidden object puzzles. I saw one review mention there were too many of them, but I wished for more. The game relies on an exceptionally well done and intelligently designed point and click adventure model for most of the gameplay, and the hidden object screens are mostly a distraction that include an object or two that you'll need to take from the hidden object puzzle and insert into the story gameplay. Sprinkled throughout the game there are also various mini-puzzles that go from sliding puzzles to jigsaw types to wire connecting puzzles. Not once did I feel like a puzzle was out of place or overly complicated. Even if (say, for kids) a puzzle is too confusing or hard, you can skip it. The game encourages you not to via some unlockable achievements, but it is an option. Unlike many point and click games, I never felt like combining objects to meet a goal was unnecessarily complicated. All of them made sense, so this game never frustrates.

Overall, while I did wish for more hidden object puzzles, I felt like Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden surprised me in its quality. It's relaxing and takes you on a nice little journey over about a four hour playthrough (I played on Expert despite being fairly new to the genre and never once was frustrated, so it's definitely casual!). While I would personally advise you to wait for a sale because I go by the $1.00 per hour of gameplay rule, I definitely recommend this game to anyone looking for a casual romp through some pretty environments. I'm giving this a 7/10. This is a great game for kids or for adults looking for a shorter game with little commitment. I was pleasantly surprised with this game, and I now consider myself a fan of the Hidden Object genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971963787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1426654494}
review:
Do you like the sort of games where you have to find items 'hidden' in a mass of other items tied loosely into a story line? If so this is the game for you. 

Whoever designed the puzzles are geniuses, its simple enough that nearly anyone above 12 can solve them but complex enough to not require a reset regardless of how the player randomly clicks bar 1 or 2.

Not recommended if you are looking for a challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064445036', 'num_games_owned': 1447, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1426119598}
review:
Was ist Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden? Ein Wimmelbild Spiel welches starke EinflÃ¼sse von H.P. Lovecraft hat. Warum starke EinflÃ¼sse? Es erinnert mich an die Geschicht â€œder Tempelâ€ von ebend erwÃ¤hnten Lovecraft, ausserdem ist die Geschichte auch stark mit dem Cthulhu-Myhtos verbunden. Die Spielmechanik ist halt wie in jedem dieser Spiele, finde A und bringe es zu B, was mit Minispielen und halt Wimmelbildern aufgelockert wird. Was man auf jedenfall noch erwÃ¤hnen muss ist das es verschiedene Schwierigkeitsstufen gibt, ein Bonuslevel und man kann jedes Wimmelbild nochmal extra im MenÃ¼ auswÃ¤hlen und erneut spielen. Mehr gibt es nicht zu sagen, die Geschichte ist in Ordnung, hat einige Schockmomente, welche bei mir aber nicht zÃ¼ndeten und die Grafik ist fÃ¼r so ein Spiel mehr als in Ordnung. In diesem Sinne Daumen auf jedenfall hoch.

Abyss von TNA gibt es hier:http://www.twitch.tv/thebenjaminkendrick

review:

Apesar de ser um jogo relativamente bem curto, te coloca para quebrar a cabeÃ§a e raciocinar bastante em cada cena que Ã© passada. O jogo se passa no fundo do mar, aonde uma mulher, vai em busca do seu noivo (Robert) que saiu para dar uma "passeada" no fundo do mar e acabou nÃ£o voltando, nesse passeio, ela acha uma um submarino naufragado, entra e assim Ã© arrastada para literalmente o fundo do mar junto com ele, a partir dai, tudo comeÃ§a.

O objetivo principal do jogo Ã© achar Robert, mas com essa busca ela acaba descobrindo vÃ¡rias coisas, incluindo uma ameaÃ§a, criando assim objetivos distintos. O seu Ãºnico comando Ã© com o mouse, clicando nos cenÃ¡rios para achar itens e resolver os quebra cabeÃ§as do jogo para assim seguir adiante. Tenho uma certa facilidade com jogos puzzle e Hidden Object, mas tenho que assumir, tiveram momentos que eu nÃ£o sabia para onde correr hahaha

Aconselho jogar em modo avanÃ§ado, para que o jogo nÃ£o fique tÃ£o fÃ¡cil, afinal, no modo iniciante, ele basicamente entrega aonde vocÃª deve clicar para seguir em frente, tornando assim o jogo bem fraco. NÃ£o posso deixar de ressaltar, sou fraco para sustos e jogos de terror, entÃ£o nÃ£o me usem como parÃ¢metro, mas conseguir saltar da cadeira umas trÃªs ou quatro vezes. Sem mais, o jogo ta valendo cada centavo gasto!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023323444', 'num_games_owned': 1672, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1648285191}
review:
I didn't play many HOPA games but I enjoy this one alot so far.

UPDATE:
I stopped playing this game for some real-life reasons, but I started it again today and finished it.
Here are my thoughts:

+ Beautiful art style
+ Very good puzzles
+ It can either put your brain to work or give you hints if you don't want to
+ Good story
+ Keeps you engaged
+ Nice music

- IMO the ending was a bit sudden. Not a big deal tho

TLDR: I recommend it whole-heartedly

author: {'steamid': '76561198126733109', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1600087166}
review:
"Abyss" hat eine schÃ¶ne Grafik und eine angenehme Storyline, der man gut folgen kann.
Man kann zwischen drei Spielmodi wÃ¤hlen - leicht, mittel, schwer - und je nachdem, fÃ¼r welchen Schwierigkeitsgrad man sich entscheidet, ist das Spiel eben unterschiedlich schnell.

Ich selbst habe das Spiel auf "mittel" gespielt und auch wenn viele der Bereiche noch angezeigt wurden, mit denen man interagieren konnte, war es zeitweise eine Frickelarbeit, die richtigen Stellen zu finden, wo es nun weiter geht.
Im Vergleich zu anderen Wimmelbildspielen, liegt die Grafik bei Abyss bzw. bei allen Spielen des Herstellers im oberen Bereich, sowohl die Szenen, als auch die Filmsequenzen - alles wirkt stimmig, nichts ruckelt.

Das Einzige, was schade ist, ist die teilweise mangelhafte Ãœbersetzung, bei der man teilweise um viele Ecken denken muss, oder sich einfach durch eine Wimmelbildszene klicken muss, weil der gesuchte Gegenstand falsch Ã¼bersetzt wurde. Diesen Mangel machen aber die wunderschÃ¶ne Grafik und das Sounddesign wieder wett.

Ich kann ideses Spiel leidenschaftlichen Wimmelbildspielern nur empfehlen.

review:

Manche RÃ¤tsel forderten meinen grips doch dann gab es eher einfachere bis vorraussehende rÃ¤tsel. Abyss : The Wraiths of Eden ist jetzt nicht einer der besten seines genres aber durchaus fÃ¼r fans dieses genres einen blick wert kann ich nur empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050478086', 'num_games_owned': 1672, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1407699171}
review:
This game is a mix of an adventure and casual puzzle game , constantly you encounter different puzzles to solve like match the cable figure patterns, find all the hidden objects or how to turn off the electricity, like most puzzle games it doesn't make sense where you find the item you need to grab the other item but who cares?.
The game offers a few hours of fun for just 8$, the story is about finding your lost fiance in the underwater city of Eden, you might notice how Eden resembles a little on bioshock's rapture, underwater city ruined?, but nothing else in common.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045200324', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1434753879}
review:
[h1]Um incrÃ­vel desafio no fundo do mar![/h1]
Um problema do cara ter muitos jogos Ã© que passo mais tempo escolhendo um jogo do que jogando eles entÃ£o peguei o primeiro da lista e achei esse Ã³timo jogo, me fez lembrar dos meus tempos de PC da Positivo e que sÃ³ jogava jogos de "Objeto Oculto" e posso dizer que foi uma Ã³tima ideia jogÃ¡-lo.
        
[i]Obs: Se quiser ler o resumo da anÃ¡lise pule direto para "ConsideraÃ§Ãµes Finais".[/i]

[b]â—„ EstÃ³ria / Objetivo â–º[/b]
	[quote=] Tome bastante fÃ´lego e encontre sua noiva desaparecida no abismo negro do oceano. Descubra e investigue uma esquecida cidade submersa construÃ­da em um intrigante estilo art-dÃ©co. Esta antiga utopia esconde muitos segredos arrepiantes e forÃ§as sobrenaturais, cujos resquÃ­cios ainda se ocultam em cada canto. Enfrente o antigo mal que estÃ¡ se escondendo nas profundezas das cÃ¢maras da cidade do Ã‰den. [/quote]
Com essa premissa, a estÃ³ria de [i]Profundezas: Os Fantasmas do Eden[/i] Ã© um tanto quanto clichÃª mas boa o suficiente para te manter interessado, algo que muitos Hiden Objects falham em proporcionar. Algo importante a se notar: Interface, legendas, textos (incluindo texturas) todos em PT-BR!

Para quem curte, as conquistas proporcionam ainda o fator replay. A estÃ³ria principal e todos os puzzles giram em torno de 3 a 4 horas dependendo de como jogado, jÃ¡ com as conquistas esse tempo sobe para 6 ou 7 horas.

[b]â—„ Jogabilidade / Controles â–º[/b]
Junte os gÃªneros "Apontar e Clicar" e "Objeto Oculto" o jogo nÃ£o apresenta muitas difÃ­culdades pois os puzzles sÃ£o muito fÃ¡ceis de resolver, algo que pode agradar tanto jogador mais familiarizado com o gÃªnero quanto novatos.

O game consiste apenas em clicar em portas/passagens para se movimentar atravÃ©s dos cenÃ¡rios, interagir com objetos e resolver puzzles divesificados. Existem 3 tipos de puzzles:
[list]
 [*]Objetos Ocultos: Como o prÃ³prio nome diz, procurar em determinado cenÃ¡rio os objetos ocultos listados;
 [*]DominÃ³: VocÃª pode optar de ao invÃ©s de resolver o desafio dos objetos ocultos, jogar um jogo de dominÃ³;
 [*]Mini Games: em certos pontos do jogo vocÃª precisarÃ¡ resolver certos puzzles para prosseguir com a histÃ³ria;
[/list]
[b]â—„ GrÃ¡ficos / Visuais â–º[/b]
Ã‰ incrivel que jogos de produtoras indies [u]na maioria[/u] das vezes conseguem nos cativar com seus visuais e traÃ§os belÃ­ssimos, [i]Profundezas: Os Fantasmas do Eden[/i] teve um capricho incrÃ­vel por parte da "Artifex Mundi sp. z o.o.".

A ambientaÃ§Ã£o da cidade no fundo do mar Ã© magnifica! Quem jÃ¡ jogou ou jÃ¡ viu imagens, Ã© praticamente impossÃ­vel nÃ£o comparar determinados lugares com o famoso e glorioso [i]Bioshock[/i] (que ainda pretendo jogar), como por exemplo [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=361720668]essa screenshot[/url] tirada em um elevador logo no inÃ­cio do game. Inclusive veja outras anÃ¡lises, vÃ£o falar a mesma coisa.

Um problema que presenciei, algumas texturas que contÃ©m texto demoram para carregar de vez em quando do inglÃªs para o portuguÃªs. 
AnimaÃ§Ãµes da boca dos personagens ao falar sÃ£o extremamente bizarras, teria sido bem melhor deixar sem animaÃ§Ã£o do que fazer o personagem ter uma animaÃ§Ã£o robÃ³tica na boca.

[b]â—„ Efeitos Sonoros / Soundtrack â–º[/b]
Os efeitos sonoros foram bem implementados, vocÃª realmente se sente em uma instalaÃ§Ã£o submarina e passa a sensaÃ§Ã£o de um lugar misterioso e assustador.
Assim como os efeitos sonoros, trilha sonora Ã© muito boa, se ajusta a atmosfera assustadora do lugar.

A dublagem nÃ£o Ã© lÃ¡ grandes coisas, nÃ£o passam a emoÃ§Ã£o que tem que passar em determinadas cenas.

[b]â—„ Multiplayer Local / Multiplayer Online â–º[/b]
O jogo nÃ£o possui nenhum tipo de multiplayer, seja local ou online.

[b]â—„ DLCs / ExpansÃµes â–º[/b]
JÃ¡ incluÃ­do na compra do game vem um conteÃºdo adicional que pode ser acessado atravÃ©s do menu "Extras", trata-se de uma histÃ³ria que ocorre bem antes dos acontecimentos da histÃ³ria principal onde Ã© mostrado e falado mais sobre essa misteriosa Cidade.

[h1]ConsideraÃ§Ãµes Finais[/h1]
[b]PrÃ³s:[/b]
+ Enredo interesante;
+ Interface, legendas e textos em PT-BR;
+ Horas de gameplay atÃ© grande para o gÃªnero;
+ Conquistas aumentam o fator replay;
+ Controles simples;
+ Diversidade de puzzles;
+ Visuais belÃ­ssimos;
+ Efeitos sonoros bem implementados;
+ Trilha sonora se ajusta a atmosfera assustadora;
+ EstÃ³ria adicional jÃ¡ inclusa;

[b]Contras:[/b]
- Demora de renderizaÃ§Ã£o de algumas texturas;
- AnimaÃ§Ã£o da boca do personagem ao falar bizarras;
- Dublagem muito simples;

[b]Nota Final: 7.7/10[/b]

ExperiÃªncia agradÃ¡vel, certamente voltarei a jogar jogos desse gÃªnero, Ã© uma boa dica para quem quer fugir dos gÃªneros mais comuns. Recomendo para quem gosta do gÃªnero e principalmente para quem quer experimentar pela primeira vez.

Mas apesar da qualidade, nÃ£o acho que o jogo vale o preÃ§o cheio de R$15,99. Recomendo pegar em alguma promoÃ§Ã£o de pelo menos 50%.

    [*]22/06/2015: CorreÃ§Ãµes de concordÃ¢ncia e adiÃ§Ãµes de comentÃ¡rios.

review: Un'avventura punta & clicca Hidden Object da manuale. Ne particolari lodi ne difetti quindi, ma perfettamente in grado di offrire un rilassato intrattenimento per le poche ore che richiede per essere portato a termine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055451405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1421792856}
review:
I love Artifex Mundi games, they are the best in market. But this game, is notably worse than others. Enigmatis was great, Nightmares from deep was great. But Abbys... it was a dissipoinment sadly.
However, if you love hidden object games, this game is still great. Not a clasic sadly. But it has potential. You should play it. But, other games of the company is better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121018137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1330, 'last_played': 1421722956}
review: An enjoyable, if a bit monotonous game.  I suppose this is to be expected from this genre, which is a new one to me.  The story is adequately suspenseful, though predictable.  I found the wordplay involving the hidden object games amusing and often clever.  The one problem I have with the game, and this is near a deal breaker for me, to be the voice acting of the main character.  Her tone constantly seems overly cheerful or questioning, and the voice itself has almost no character or depth to it.  At one point, when she encounters a sea ghost, the last of whose kind imprisoned and then attempted to murder her, she exclaims, in a flirty quip, "What's your game?"  His game is to kill you!  Why aren't you scared?  This would only be a minor fault, where it not for the fact that this robo-woman is tasked with half of the dialogue in the game.  In the end, I was forced to add my own excitement to the character.  Picturing her as a lovesick psychopath, intent on gaining the pleasure of killing her beloved Robert for herself, she wanders an abandoned sea-station, laughing at the impotent attempts of sea-ghosts to scare her.  Psycho-Grade = B-

author: {'steamid': '76561197975565526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1421584802}
review:
He jugado a la mayorÃ­a de aventuras de Artifex Mundi con mi hija de 6 aÃ±os y nunca me defraudan. Historias originales con grandes dosis de misterio y toques sobrenaturales, pero apto para pÃºblicos muy jÃ³venes. No hay nada de mal gusto que les pueda estropear la experiencia.

Los problemas que plantea la aventura se resuelven con la tÃ­pica mecÃ¡nica de usar los objetos que vas encontrando en las distintas pantallas. En el inventario nunca llega a haber muchos objetos a la vez, lo que simplifica mucho las soluciones. Tampoco es necesario combinar objetos entre sÃ­ para crear nuevas herramientas. No hay opciones de diÃ¡logo como en otro tipo de aventuras, pero sÃ­ muchos puzzles, y muy currados, tanto que los mÃ¡s pequeÃ±os no serÃ¡n capaces de resolver la mayorÃ­a por sÃ­ solos. No pueden faltar tampoco los juegos de "Objetos Ocultos", un imprescindible de este tipo de aventuras sencillas, que aunque no plantean un gran reto, son muy atractivos para los niÃ±os.

Absolutamente todos los juegos de Artifex Mundi, a pesar de estar orientados a un pÃºblico no muy exigente, rezuman buen gusto por todos lados, y este Abyss no es una excepciÃ³n. El arte del juego es sobresaliente y cada estancia estÃ¡ llena de detalles. Los enigmas son sencillos pero no estÃºpidos, y todas las soluciones tienen mucho sentido, no habiendo nada absurdo o ilÃ³gico.

La duraciÃ³n del juego no suele ir mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de las 5 Ã³ 6 horas si juegas con niÃ±os. Si eres un jugador experimentado y te enfrentas solo a un juego de este tipo (no sÃ© muy bien por quÃ© querrÃ­as hacer tal cosa) seguramente no te lleve mÃ¡s de 3 Ã³ 4 horas.

Lo recomiendo sin dudar, teniendo en cuenta a quÃ© pÃºblico estÃ¡ dirigido, y sobre todo al precio tan reducido que sueles encontrarlo en Steam.

review: I'm not going to offer any theories as to whether this whole thing should be legally actionable, but setting potential plagiarism aside, Abyss is a high-quality hidden object game more than enough content to keep anyone entertained.
