author: {'steamid': '76561198011726945', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1420926518}
review:
After my experience with Enigmatis 2 it was pretty obvious that it wasn't the last Artifex Mundi game I played, but since the first Enigmatis game wasn't released at that time yet, I got the game which seemed the most interesting instead and that was this one.
Judging by the voice actor we're controlling the same character who this time takes a dive into the sea to find her love who had gone missing, only to discover an...aaand that's where I stop, don't wanna spoil that one for you, but still to give a point to this review I think that the story is just as good as it was in Enigmatis 2 while the gameplay is almost completely the same with some very minor design differences.
It has the atmosphere, the challenge factor (which I found noticeably harder regarding the "100%ing" in terms of achievements which I gave up on this time xD) and some replay value as well, just like in the other game.

It's one of those cases when you have a well working recipe for a good experience and the only thing you have to do is to make very minor changes, just to give this other experience it's own identity, nothing else. 

In other words, play this one if you prefer underwater environments and abandoned places to chilling forests. I personally prefer Enigmatis 2 over this one so far, but ONLY because of the environments, nothing else. 
In terms of everything else, it's just as good as that game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079017859', 'num_games_owned': 1174, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1420880296}
review:
Cons:
-Wooden voice acting and emotionless characters (especially your character, who is apparently dead to all emotion, including fear)
-Poor translation to English in places (notably for the names of certain items in hidden objects scenes)
-Repetitive music that gets annoying pretty quickly
-Standard nonsensical progression (ie there are thin vines blocking a puzzle which you can't pull off with your hands or cut with scissors or a knife; you have to wait until you have the hedge clippers)
-Standard hackneyed plot
-Puzzles are too easy
-Game has zero replay value, yet in order to get all achievements you must play it all the way through at least twice

Pros:
+The entire cast of characters is made up of what appear to be outdated animatronic puppets with terrifying faces and dead eyes to match their wooden voices. It's like playing through a ride at Universal Studios, about 20 years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004372851', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1451787914}
review:
Artifix Mundi games have their hammy moments, but these games are very easy to play with my wife and are a nice bonding experience.  Voice actors are reused game to game, and the mouth movements look like the same technology used in "Fallout 2" but they are fund games.  Abyss is designed well with appropriate music, sound, and level design, the only major problem is the elevator to navigate floors takes is frustrating when you're trying to find the magic pile of hidden objects to click on.

7/10 - A good game to initiate people into the hidden object genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974226436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1420067748}
review:
I'll give this one a recommendation, though a warning as well.  You can complete the game, including all achievements, in about half an hour.  3-5 hours would be more realistic.  Buy it when it's on sale.

It's pretty blatent about ripping off Bioshock's milieau, but it's a completely different game type and plot, so oh well.

It's also not consistent with it's time settings - things like modern car keys, thumb drives and such mixed in with the older look of Bioshock, a bit jarring to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971074683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1419728321}
review: This game was solid. Heavier on puzzles than hidden object and the domino HO alternative was interesting. Absolute unabashed rip-off of the Bioshock environment but the story (iffy as it was) was not a copy. In order to get all of the achievements, you have to play at least twice (once for all the HO and once for all the Domino). All in all very solid even if the story was not amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2477, 'num_reviews': 929, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1419738503}
review:
Mais um jogo da produtora de 9 Clues que peguei em um bundle, e Ã© igual aos outros jogos de franquia no quesito do modo "ache o item", os puzzles obviamente sÃ£o diferentes, jogo bom para passar o tempo, ou para pessoas que gostam de jogatina mais tranquila. A historia Ã© um pouco clichÃª, mas um pouco interessante, se assemelhando em muitos aspectos a famosa franquia Bioshock - sÃ³ que em point and click. 
--------------------------------------------------
Another game from the makersof 9 Clues that I got in a bundle, and is equal to other franchise games in the question of the  "find the item" thing, the puzzles are obviously different, good game to pass the time, or for people who love more "quiet and slow" gaming. The story is a bit clichÃ©, but also a little interesting, resembling in many respects the famous franchise Bioshock - but in point and click mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072110088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1419625842}
review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden ist ein Wimmelbildspiel, dass in einer Unterwasserwelt spielt. In rund 3 Stunden Spielzeit muss man seinen vermissten Freund suchen, retten und aus dem vermeindlichem Paradies flÃ¼chten. 
Es hat mir von der AtmosphÃ¤re und der Umgebung her sehr gut gefallen, es wirkt etwas ausgefallener, als andere Spiele von Artifex Mundi. Der Soundtrack fÃ¼gte sich gut ein und untermalte das ganze.
Lediglich viele falsache Objektbezeichnungen haben mich in den Wahnsinn getrieben, hier hat die "Ãœbersetzungsabteilung" sehr schlampig gearbeitet. Ich sllte einen "BaseballschlÃ¤ger" finden und das Objekt, was tatsÃ¤chlich gesucht wurde war eine (lebendige) Fledermaus. Die Minispiele hingegen liefen wie geschmiert.
Die Steam-Erfolge kann man in 2 DurchgÃ¤ngen erledigen, wegen der Dominospiele-Erfolge. Dauert das Spiel beim ersten Mal 3 Stunden, so wird man beim 2ten Mal nur die HÃ¤lfte der Zeit benÃ¶tigen.
Ingesamt kann ich Abyss empfehlen, das Spiel hat mir persÃ¶nlich viel Freude bereitet.

review: Very good hidden object game with a decent plot. Beautiful and detailed graphics and decent enough voice acting. There was some little graphic bloopers in the sceneries here and there but they really did not ruin my playing.However demon and demonâ€™s possession are worn out. Demons? Seriously?! All you could think of? There are lot of other mythic beings or ancient parasite. Especially when the â€œdemonâ€ looks to be no other than Chulchu. It had worked well even letâ€™s say like â€œold deityâ€ of long lost civilisation. But I suppose demon had been just the quickes and easiest to explain things?

author: {'steamid': '76561197985232409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1418531297}
review:
Is a man not entitled to the sweat of his brow? "No" says the hidden object section, "he has to find it in a big pile of crap along with an umbrella and three gears." "No" says the puzzle section, "he has to assemble a map or arrange sliding blocks the right way." I rejected those answers. Instead, I chose something different. I chose the impossible. I chose . . . the "casual" difficulty and abused the hint system.

This is a standard hidden object game with some point and click adventure game elements, puzzles and using objects on things, added in to keep things varied. Probably the most notable thing is that the plot and setting are copied from the original Bioshock.

The puzzles are bit simplistic and the hidden object sections aren't quite as cluttered as they could be, but the art is fantastic and difficulty isn't really the appeal of this kind of game anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008887930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1418295119}
review:
So this game likes its jumpscares so be warned.

As always hidden items games for me can be simple to super hard depending on the game.
For this one on the easiest setting the hints reset fast enough to not be frustrating and didn't reset when used for a "which way do I go" style hint.

This game suffers from the "item name/common convention/colour contrast" issue I've seen with afew of these. You're looking for a key? Well odds on its gonna be almost the same colour as its background. Looking for an umbrella? Better keep and eye out for images of one that blend into the background.

As to the voice-acting; Bland; End of story
Speaking of story its interesting and worth sitting through.

Would I recommend? Yes; At full price? Maybe not

author: {'steamid': '76561198116845541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1417714830}
review:
Ein nettes Spiel fÃ¼r zwischendurch. Es ist in etwa vier Stunden durchgespielt und die RÃ¤tsel sind eher einfach gehalten. Diese sind jedoch abwechslungsreich gestaltet, von Suchbilder Ã¼ber Logik-Puzzle bis hin zu traditionellen Point and Click Aufgaben -in diesem Punkt also Daumen hoch.

Die Story wirkt hingegen recht gezwungen und vorhersehbar, allerdings ist es offensichtlich dass die Geschichte nicht das Hauptaugenmerk bei der Entwicklung war. Ich finde es jedoch super, dass man nach dem Durchspielen noch eine kurze Extrakampagne bekommt, in der die Vorgeschichte mehr beleuchtet wird.

Die Grafik (meist Standbilder) ist hÃ¼bsch anzusehen und die Musik dezent gehalten.

Mein einziger und sehr klarer Kritikpunkt: Ein ÃœbermaÃŸ an Jumpscares. Die wirken nicht nur billig und nervig, sondern sind in diesem Genre auch noch vÃ¶llig deplaziert.

Insgesamt ein guter Zeitvertreib fÃ¼r einen Abend, aber mehr als 5â‚¬ solltet ihr dafÃ¼r nicht ausgeben.

review:
This game looks beautiful like pretty much all of the other Artifex Mundi games and of course quite fun too.

The one thing that disappointed me was that if you do dominos on even one time you can't get the achievement for completing all hidden object puzzles without using the hint button. Likewise I'm sure is true for the achievement for completing all dominos puzzles. So, I'll have to play through the game 3 times just to get those 2 achievements. If you don't care about achievements this one really won't bug you at all.

Overall a very good game and it runs well under Linux (Ubuntu 14.04 in my case).

author: {'steamid': '76561198078143581', 'num_games_owned': 3295, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1416355167}
review:
Antes de jugar a Abyss, creÃ­a que los juegos de objetos ocultos no eran para mÃ­. Vistos desde fuera me parecÃ­an aburridos, sin argumentos, lineales. Y seamos serios: "Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden" no va a ganar ningÃºn premio por sus magnÃ­ficos guiones o sus complejas animaciones. No harÃ¡n una pelÃ­cula ni venderÃ¡n merchandising. 

Pero es un juego muy entretenido. 

Es un tÃ­tulo genial para echar un rato delante del ordenador, olvidarte de todo y centrarte en salvar a tu marido Robert (que es un poco inÃºtil). Personalmente me parece una aventura grÃ¡fica simplificada, donde tan sÃ³lo te mueves por unos cuantos escenarios y vas superando distintos puzzles. No hay mucha complejidad, pero si aÃºn asÃ­ te quedas atascado en algÃºn momento puedes darle a ese bonito botÃ³n de Â«SaltarÂ» y continuar jugando como si nada. El argumento y sus personajes, aunque no resultan excesivamente originales, cumplen con su cometido y consiguen meterte en la historia. El apartado grÃ¡fico cumple con creces en cuanto a diseÃ±o y dibujo; las animaciones son otro cantar (sobre todo las de los personajes cuando hablan, auch).

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1414514605}
review:
[h1]Short version: 89%[/h1]
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden offers everything one can want in a hidden object puzzle game: a good story, fluent game flow, interesting puzzles, nice graphic design. A definite grab if you like this genre.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
There are hidden object games that try to ascend the limits of their genre to stand out. Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden chose to be good in the known game elements instead.

Although the story is just a mishmash of Bioshock and Cthulhu, it is an almost perfect mixture. It is engaging, features genuinely good twists, and has a realistic, interesting main character. The only real downside is the voice acting, it is spectacularly bad even by hidden object standards.

The puzzles themselves are spread out evenly and offer a steady progression. They require a fair amount of backtracking, but the map design doesnâ€™t make you feel like you are walking around endlessly. The hidden object scenes are drawn well, although they have a few problems, especially if the required item is in the water.

I also have to mention the bonus chapter: not only it gives you great insight of the main story, but it even puts one of the side characters in the limelight, adding even more depth to the game.

Bei "WarmhaltebehÃ¤lter" kann man sich gerade noch so eine WÃ¤rmflasche vorstellen, aber es gab noch viel abwegigere Sachen, die aber zum GlÃ¼ck nur sehr selten auftraten. 
Auch stimmt das VerhÃ¤ltnis Wimmelbild zu Minispielen und man fÃ¤llt nicht von einem ins andere. In einigen Sequenzen hab ich mich so sehr erschocken, dass ich tatsÃ¤chlich die Maus losgelassen habe.

review:
Bastante bueno, la verdad es que es distinto a los que he ido jugando.

BÃ¡sicamente es de nuevo una buena historia con un buen planteamiento de situaciones donde tendrÃ¡s que buscar objetos escondidos, hacer puzzles e intentar descifrar acertijos diversos (que puedes cambiar, como en todos los juegos de Artifex Mundi). Esta vez no cambia a Mahjong sino a dominÃ³, y es bastante mÃ¡s adictivo (al menos para mÃ­).

La historia buena, la ambientaciÃ³n bastante distinta (podrÃ­a compararse con Rapture) y en definitiva, un juego que merece la pena tener cuando bajan de precio. Mejor que el Clockwork Tales a mi ver.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058810024', 'num_games_owned': 5970, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1415227395}
review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden

Uno de los mejores juegos de Artiflex Mundi, la historia es interesante, los graficos realmente son muy bueno, se nota que tienen mucho trabajo, los puzzles son muy entretenidos.
Una de los factores positivos de este juego es la posibilidad de hacer la parte de hidden objects de dos modos distintos, de la forma tradicional o mediante un juego de domino, con lo cual es imposible trabarse.
La unica contra es que como todos los juegos de este genero, tienen una historia divertida con mezcla de suspenso pero llegando al final es como que se le terminan las ideas a los desarrolladores y terminan muy rapido y sin explicacion de porque suceden ciertas cosas.
Algunos de los puzzles que hay en este juego tambien los podran encontrar en otros juegos de Artiflex Mundi en que el contexto es diferente y la ambientaciÃ²n otra, los puzzles son los mismos.

De todas maneras es un indie del genero puzzles muy entretenido y si tienen la oportunidad de comprarlo en un bundle les anticipo que va a ser una buena compra.

Saludos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046407276', 'num_games_owned': 6090, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1561800827}
review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a Hidden Object Game. 

The adventure backdrop is fine, the areas are rendered with great details and the hidden object scenes are even in Expertmodus quite simple. Instead of Hidden-Object Riddles you might also opt to play a kind of Domino to solve the HOG. The riddles in the game are also quite simple and none of the riddles required a deeper explanation than a simple sentence. 

The story of the game is mysterious, and sinister. I like mysteries, and I love lovecraftian horror - but even with some hints in this direction the game has overdone it in a way that in the end all is only ridiculous.

This is no "Nancy Drew" game, that is for sure, and the riddles are much less challenging than any of the Nancy Drew game series. Still it is a decent HOG-Game, and sure something that fans of that genre can't wait to dig their teeth into.

Even though I am sceptical about this genre, it was a pleasing - even if at times insultingly ridiculous - game. Of course they are short casual games, but that is - what they were made for.

Graphics: 7/10 (Adventure style graphics with some artistic sights)
Sound: 8/10 (A fitting soundtrack to the game, that is fitting to the game)
Playability: 7/10 (It is fun to play it through once, and try out the two other modes of game - but once played through, they soon loose their ... color?)
Story: 6/10 (Ok Story, a bit far-fetched. But hey it's all a fantasy, isn't it?)
Value: 6/10 (The value of the game might lie between 4 and 8 bucks, so 6,49 isn't bad at all, if you can try to get it cheaper)

Overall: 6,8 (A mediocre game, which might please friends of the genre or people who love underwater adventures)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030080447', 'num_games_owned': 1277, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1414444010}
review:
[i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i] is only my second encounter with a so-called "Hidden Object Game". It's a prime example of the quality that Artifex Mundi delivers in this particular genre of games, which can best be defined as a point-and-click adventure light with as an extra ingredient the Hidden Object-screens. Artifex Mundi delivered a really interesting game with this one, which is like an overtly hommage to [i]Bioshock[/i]. The setting shows a lot of parallels to that of the famous and revolutionary shooter: just as in [i]Bioshock[/i], I found myself exploring an underwater city where an utopian society had crumbled into tyranny and civil war. Even the art dÃ©ceau-style of the city is very similar in Abyss to that of Bioshock. It may be a bit too obvious for some, but it's so well done and the screens are so well-drawn and full of details, that for me it felt more a parallel reality, an alternative, to the world of Bioshock than like any sort of plagiate.

In all possible departments, [i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i] truly shines. Artifex Mundi invests a lot in putting a convincing story into their Hidden Object-games, and they certainly managed to do so in this game. They also managed to integrate the several hidden object-screens and the mostly cleverly designed puzzles very convincingly into the story. The adventuring-part of the game plays very smoothly and intuitively, helped by the minimal inventory. As far as the musical score and sound-effects are concerned: they do their job in conveying the sometimes scary atmosphere in the game. It would be too much to call this a horror-game, but there are some very rare scaring moments.

Being a collector's edition, there are quite some neat additions included, such as an extra chapter to the story and some downloadable screens. All in all, this is a very recommendable game. Hidden Object Games-lovers will certainly know that they safely can expect a high level of excellence from this company, but I'd surely recommend it as well to those gamers who haven't yet played this genre before. They may not be difficult or competitve, but certainly entertaining and addictive!

Overall score: 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000608288', 'num_games_owned': 3299, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 866, 'last_played': 1414372946}
review:
Another terrific casual adventure from Artifex Mundi!  This one mashes up a bit of the Mythos with a whole lotta Bioshock, for a story in which you head out to rescue your undersea-explorer husband who has gone missing.  You dive at his last known location and find first a broken-down lab, and then a stark, sprawling, deserted city on the sea bottom.  

The city is called Eden, not Rapture, but the principles are the same, and the explorations and puzzles that follow are tricky enough to be interesting and pliant enough to cave under pressure.  NOTE that the "Hint" button becomes a "Skip" button during puzzles, so if you are paying the wrong kind of attention, trying to figure out what the puzzle rules are can turn into a whoops-skip (this happened to me twice).

author: {'steamid': '76561198005701579', 'num_games_owned': 2413, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1414364830}
review:
Nice hidden-object game with a good variety of puzzles and an interesting domino minigame for those who don't like object-hunting. The story is simple but nice and mysterious. The graffics are really beautiful (especially those underwater and some inside eden) and a lot of them are quite realistic but I can't say the same about the characters. The sound is really nice and relaxing, however,  the voice-acting is really bad.
Even at the original price it's a nice choice for those who like hidden-object+puzzle games and it offers about 4-5 hours of gameplay (without a walkthrough) or 8-9 hours if you are an achievement hunter since you will need to finish the game at least twice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969957382', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1438770294}
review:
This game is basically Bioshock -- art deco everywhere, a ruined underwater city, lots of creepy little kids -- except there's no shooting, and the end boss is Cthulhu instead of Ayn Rand. The gameplay elements are alright -- mostly keeping to the line between 'too easy' and 'too challenging', except for a few of the more obstinate puzzles. The story itself was kind of stupid, and I kept hoping that the resistance leader would turn out to be secretly evil so I could punch him in his stupid, stupid facial hair. 

I would recommend against buying this title...but there was an awesome squirrel, so buy it if you lub dem cute squirrels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005683840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1413840532}
review:
Buen juego, con sus secuencias 3D, largo y con una historia adicional ya que es ediciÃ³n coleccionista (al menos la mÃ­a) incluye las canciones, fondos de pantalla y arte conceptual. Buena trama, y buen juego. Solo tiene un fallo y es en algunas traducciones de objetos que meten la pata bastante pero son puntuales.
Si te gustan las aventuras point and clic + busca-objetos te gustarÃ¡.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1413837600}
review:
Spielwertung: 8/10

Mit sehr viel Wohlwollen eine 8 und keine 7 oder 7.5. 
Das Spiel ist wirklich schÃ¶n, sehr liebevoll gemacht und macht auch SpaÃŸ!

Die WimmelbilderrÃ¤tsel sind spannend, manchmal etwas zu leicht, manchmal etwas kniffliger.
Man kann aber immer auch alternativ Memory spielen, wo man immer gewinnt. 

Die Story ist das HerzstÃ¼ck und klasse erzÃ¤hlt. Die ein oder andere Wendung ist vielleicht etwas platt, aber in diesem Rahmen alles paletti. Man spielt hier ja nicht die NacherzÃ¤hlung eines Literaturnobelpreisbuches. 
NatÃ¼rlich sind die Anlehnungen Ã¼berdeutlich, gerade zu Anfang fÃ¼hlt es sich an wie bei Bioshock, etwas Jules Verne und Atlantis inklusive. Aber was solls, man erfindet die Welt nicht mehr neu. Im Gegenteil. Gerade diese Momente sorgen fÃ¼r ein gewisses Prickeln. 
Die Graphik ist sehr Ã¼berzeugend. Das Comichafte hat manchmal kleinere Aussetzer, man merkt, dass die Engine nicht in der A-Klasse mitspielt, aber die flÃ¼ssigen ÃœbergÃ¤nge zu den Ingame-Cinematics sind super, die Ladezeiten fÃ¼r LevelÃ¼bergÃ¤nge fast nicht spÃ¼rbar. 
Der Sound ist atmosphÃ¤risch, aber auch etwas klassisch. 
Die Steuerung ist ein SelbstlÃ¤ufer. 

Mit einer LÃ¤nge von ca. 5 Stunden imo auch keine EnttÃ¤uschung an dieser Front. Wenn man es einmal gespielt hat, gibt es aber keinen wirklichen Grund, es noch mal zu spielen. Tut man es doch und merkt sich ein bisschen was, kann man es auch in 1.5 Stunden schaffen. AuÃŸerdem positiv der "Mini-DLC", der zumindest bei mir gratis unter Extras lag und noch mal fÃ¼r ein paar Minuten bis einer Stunde Abwechslung bot. 

Kommen wir zum Negativen:

Neben kleineren "Bugs" bzw. Ungereimtheiten, die alles in allem nicht stÃ¶ren, ist das Erfolgssystem eine Katastrophe. Zwar beeintrÃ¤chtigt das nicht das Spielerlebnis als solches, gehÃ¶rt aber nunmal zum Spiel und zu Steam dazu. Warum, frage ich, gibt es 3 Schwierigkeitsgrade, von denen 90% der Spieler beim ersten Mal vermutlich den Mittleren nehmen, nur damit man das Spiel fÃ¼r 2 Erfolge noch 1x auf "Expert" durchspielen muss? Klar, kann man vorher sehen, aber ich mag diese Streckung der Spielzeit nicht. Vor allem, wenn nach 2x durchspielen auf Expert immer noch kein Erfolg da ist (siehe Forum, das Problem haben einige, aber LÃ¶sungen sind purer Zufall...). Auch so 2 "Hammererfolge": 1x Alle Wimmelbilder ohne Hilfe lÃ¶sen, 1x alle Dominos. Tja, habe ich gemacht... keine Erfolge. Warum man diese LÃ¼cken nicht einfach im "Extra" Fach, wo man beides extra spielen kann, ohne Hauptgame, ist mir schleierhaft. 

Erfolge gehÃ¶ren nun mal dazu! Wer sie einfÃ¼hrt, sollte sie auch anstÃ¤ndig programmieren bzw. auf allzu groÃŸe Gemeinheiten verzichten. Zumindest wenn es sich um ein Spiel handelt, dass in die Kategorie B oder C vom Preisniveau fÃ¤llt und auch von der Spielzeit und -motivation in diese Kategorien gehÃ¶rt. Niemand wird dieses Spiel wohl mehr als 1x, vielleicht 2x durchspielen wollen, Vergleiche zu Langzeitzeitfressern und stetig erweiterten Spielen wie WoW oder CSGO verbieten sich daher, wo natÃ¼rlich auch komplexe, zeitfressende bzw. fast unmÃ¶gliche Erfolge ihren Platz haben mÃ¼ssen. 

Abseits dieses Ã„rgernisses: Eine volle Spielempfehlung! Man wird hier 2-3 schÃ¶ne Spieleabende verbringen, wenn man sich nur einen Hauch fÃ¼r einen Mix aus GeschichtenerzÃ¤hlen, Adventure und RÃ¤tsel interessiert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035989661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1413744298}
review:
If you have played an artifex mundi game before, by this point you know what to expect; a beautiful blend of puzzle solving, object hunting and hidden object finding (or domino playing instead), all bundled in a gripping adventure, full of mysteries, that slowly unfolds before your very eyes. If not, grab your mouse and relax: the ride is thrilling and wonderful.
There is usually some curse or supernatural element involved in their games and Abyss (the hidden object game version of Bioshock) is no exception. As you travel in a ruined underground city that aspired to be a beacon of freedom and enlightenment, you face and have to overcome mysterious adversaries that look like demon-eyed Wraiths in order to free your beloved (and also save the few free people that were left, some tired bloke pushing his forties and about three kids).
It turns out that the cause for all this is Cthulhu, or rather a strange statue found deep inside a mining shaft at the bottom of the ocean, depicting a humanoid body with the head of an octopus. Sounds familiar? I hope so.
At this point I am sure that Artifex Mundi have a Cthulhu and Cthulhu-mythos obsession and I love them for it (Cthulhu statue in Abyss, fishmen in nightmares from the deep: siren's call and the Necronomicon in 9 clues:the secret of serpent creek).
The avatars in this installment have really stepped up their game, the faces are life-like which is mostly due to the vivacity of the eyes and that is a delight to watch - although I also enjoy their painterly ones in other games.
The shock value of corpses showing up everywhere is also thrilling and adds to the unsettling atmosphere of Abyss, making it just the right amount of creepy.

TL;DR: *Cthulhu possesses underwater city people and tries to expand his empire.
*Explosions!
*Giant octopi!
*Dinosaur skeletons!
*Corpses! Corpses everywhere!
*Save Cthulh---eeerrr the world!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972826045', 'num_games_owned': 7223, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1413755398}
review: Totally not Rapture in a hidden object game, sounds bad but it isn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034928324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1413500869}
review: Davvero poco interessante, trama scopiazzata da piÃ¹ film e giochi differenti, animazioni pessime e cosa ben piÃ¹ importante, una traduzione italiana davvero schifosa, con nomi di oggetti tradotti male e in modo del tutto arbitrario, si vede lontano un miglio che per gli oggetti sono stati utilizzati traduttori automatici...il che rende certe sezioni di "trova l'oggetto" praticamente impossibili da fare senza aiuti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037259809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1413485403}
review:
Fun story, pretty visuals. Made me think of Bioshock for a bit. That said, I liked this less than 9clues for 3 reasons:
1) lot's of backtracking
2) no fast travel like in 9clues
3) maybe a bit too many 'hidden object puzzles'

author: {'steamid': '76561198001113182', 'num_games_owned': 3205, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1413367467}
review:
Enjoyable Hidden Object game with a 'BioShock'esque story.

The minigames/puzzles vary in difficulty but most of them are pretty simple, the Hidden Objects parts are of average difficulty. There's a lot of backtracking in this game and sadly there is no fast-travel like in some other HO games. Overall it is a bit too easy to complete but still a fun game nonetheless.

Encountered no bugs or broken achievements.
A second run-through is required to get 100%.
One of which needs to be in expert mode.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198033967307', 'num_games_owned': 12144, 'num_reviews': 490, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1413315589}
review: Bei dem Spiel handelt es sich um eine Mischung aus einem Point&Click-Adventure mit Puzzlen und WimmelbildrÃ¤tseln. Man durchsieht hier nicht nach und nach jeden Raum, sondern findet immer mal wieder einen Gegenstand den man irgendwo anders benutzen muss, wenn man der Story folgt weiÃŸ man eigentlich wo man hin muss. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist vÃ¶llig in Ordnung und das Spiel ist schÃ¶n anzuschauen, die musikalische Untermalung ist auch gut. Beim Setting haben sich die Entwickler wohl etwas bei Bioshock abgeguckt - Denn auch hier gibt es eine Unterwasserstadt, hier heiÃŸt sie jedoch Eden. Alles in Allem ein klasse Spiel sowohl fÃ¼r Genre-Neulinge als auch -Veteranen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025448561', 'num_games_owned': 1042, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1413232398}
review: If you happen to be a fan of hidden object games or point and click adventures then this is the game for you.  A very creative game that does a very good job with it's limited budget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044030124', 'num_games_owned': 2496, 'num_reviews': 577, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1413340284}
review: Wife likes these kind of games and liked this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046343516', 'num_games_owned': 2899, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1414711299}
review:
Wenn man weiÃŸ, worauf man sich einlÃ¤sst - ein Wimmelbildspiel mit einigen (einfachen) Adventure-Einlagen - dann bekommt man ein qualitÃ¤tsvolles und atmosphÃ¤risches Spiel geliefert. Die "Bioshock-esque" Geschichte ist gut erzÃ¤hlt und enthÃ¤lt einige kleine Schock- und Twistmomente, der Soundtrack und die Untermalung hat mir sehr gut gefallen. Insgesamt kann das Game einen fÃ¼r 3 Stunden beschÃ¤ftigen, will man alle Achievements haben, muss man es zumindest 2-3 mal durchspielen (was schlecht gelÃ¶st ist, da der Wiederspielwert gering ist). Grafik und Szenerien sind hochwertig gehalten, die Wimmelbilder gut prÃ¤sentiert (wenn auch seltene Ãœbersetzungsfehler auftauchen), die kleinen Logik/MechanikrÃ¤tsel relativ einfach gehalten.
[b]Fazit:[/b] Ein gutes Spiel fÃ¼r Zwischendurch mit netter Geschichte und guter Unterhaltung; besser als manch andere Hidden Object Games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076721797', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1413061599}
review:
Really, pretty good for a "casual" game. You can turn the difficulty to "Expert" at the start and make it more like a real adventure game which probably helped.

Anyways, the game's got some good atmosphere (courtesy of Bioshock) and a decent plot. The hidden-object games can get a bit tiresome, but hey, there's dominoes too if you don't care for them. Achievement set is a bit annoying in that it requires you to play through the entire game at least twice but ehh, it's quick enough the second time through anyways. I wouldn't call it a top-tier adventure game or anything but it's certainly worth checking out if you can get it cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987773302', 'num_games_owned': 1952, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1412965897}
review:
Abyss: The wraiths of Eden is a point & click game. The story is quite intriguing and the game features unique puzzles besides the usual "find these items" puzzle. The game takes a while to beat (2-3h if it's your first time and you're not using any walkthroughs) so it'll keep you busy for a while. I recommend this if you love casual point & click games.

Besides the main story, it also has a bonus story which will take you roughly 1h to beat. If you're any achievement hunter like me, the achievements aren't hard to get but it'll require you to beat the game a second time (which is quite boring).

author: {'steamid': '76561197970887820', 'num_games_owned': 4531, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1409536257}
review: A really solid Hidden Object game with a good story, those of you who have played Bioshock will certainly see some similarities with the design of Eden though the plot itself sets itself apart. I wasn't really a fan of the domino mini game but it was useful when I absolutely could not find an object and did not want to use a hint. It's not quite as refined as the companies later games and you will find some recycled puzzles if you have played their later stuff but I still really reccoment this to HOG fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031638779', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1412910800}
review: Slow and boring after while... Only a good game when u r bored in a cold winter night otherwise theres some free version of this online as flash games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109333284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1408009336}
review: You know how in [i]Bioshock[/i] you can find ammo, health and money if you keep your eyes peeled?  Ever wonder what it would be like if the entire game was nothing but that?  Artifex Mundi sets out to answer this question in [i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i].

author: {'steamid': '76561198019560052', 'num_games_owned': 1783, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1412460945}
review: I don't usually like puzzle games like this, but this stood out like a pearl in the mud to me. If you're interested in the genre in the slightest, this is a great game to start with. It has a decent story, engaging environment and great puzzling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107485604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1412210310}
review: I love point-and-click games that also have puzzles and hidden objects BUT they must have a wonderful story to go along with it. This story was interesting from start to finish and moved smoothly through the game-play. The puzzles weren't too difficult and the hidden object portion was sometimes a little too easy (if you prefer there is a dominoes game you can play instead) but overall it was a fun 5 hours. I definitely recommend if you like this genre. OH and while it's definitely not scary it was pretty spooky to play with headphones on in the dark. Very fun for the month of October! I'm looking forward to playing it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984658005', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1412438160}
review:
Die dunklen Tiefen des Meeres beherbergen mehr Geheimnisse, als die simpel klingende Rettungsmission verraten mag. Eine Stadt, seltsame Gestalten und eine groÃŸe Menge an Aufgaben, die uns unserem Ziel nÃ¤her bringen, aber auch tiefer in die Geschehnisse dieser Metropole eintauschen lassen. 

Das schaurige Bild einer zerstÃ¶rten Zivilisation kommt dabei gut rÃ¼ber, denn die HintergrÃ¼nde sind schÃ¶n prÃ¤sentiert. GetrÃ¼bt wird das Gesamtbild jedoch von einer mittelmÃ¤ÃŸigen Synchronisation und schlechten Animationen von Bewegungen und Gesichtern. 

Die Wimmelbilder, sowie Kombinationsaufgaben erfordern zumeist ein gutes Auge und logisches Denken - die RÃ¤tsel sind zumeist logisch und von der Schwierigkeits her auf einem niedrigen Niveau angesiedelt. Das Hilfesystem wird tatsÃ¤chlich nur ganz selten bis gar nicht gebraucht, funktioniert dafÃ¼r aber tadellos!

Freunde von Gelegenheitsspielen, sollten sich [i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i] genauer anschauen. Die 4 Stunden Spielzeit sind zwar relativ kurz, bieten aber gute Unterhaltung fÃ¼r ein bis zwei Abende.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025245849', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1412140191}
review:
Gameplay was fun, nice mash-up of puzzlles along with the reason I got the game - hidden objects. I played throughit on casual in one sitting and plan on playing the higher diffculties soon.

Main downside (but not a deal-breaker) was the really bad voice acting and story in general. It's not really a drawback because you're not expecting a triple A story from a game like this but some moments just made me go "...what?"

author: {'steamid': '76561198084594480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1412190295}
review:
A nice and entertaining adventure although a bit on the easy side. My main problem  was that I didn't know all the names of all the objects in the "hidden objects" minigames.. 

That being said, the story was interesting, the puzzles doable and the graphics more than good enough for the game. An entertaining 3 evenings adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136563302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1412095748}
review: I love the visuals in this game and the storyline flowed very well. That is hard to achieve in point and click game. I regret playing the game on easy because I finished it within three short hours. To enjoy the game and not fly through it you need to play it on a higher level. Really fun game and would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997788394', 'num_games_owned': 9653, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1583087785}
review: I like point-and-click adventure games, especially when Artifex-Mundi makes them. Abyss is no exception to the great games they have made so far. The puzzles, story and artwork was great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092065417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1482489226}
review:
For a casual, primarily hidden object game, it's not bad.  The story's interesting, the graphics are nice, and the sound effects are decent.  I beat it in a little over 3 hours.  In addition to hidden object style minigames, there are also various renditions of other minigames like pattern matching, hit every location only once to move your token, as well as some very basic point and click adventure mechanics.

On the flipside, the music is repetitive, it has no replay value once you've beaten it unless you HAVE to get every achievement, facial animations are weird, character animations are just ok (for about 8 years ago), and the dialogue and voice acting sounds like it was written and performed by a high school amateur troop.  But hey, it's a small game publisher, possibly with English not being the language the game was originally written for.  It's a decent game, but I wouldn't buy it unless it was on sale considering the lack of replayability and the short playtime.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971490143', 'num_games_owned': 1321, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1411777148}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017110772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1408751388}
review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden ist ein wunderschÃ¶n gestaltetes Adventure-Wimmelbild, dass einen in eine Unterwasserstadt (Rapture aus Bioshock nicht unÃ¤hnlich) entfÃ¼hrt.
Die verwendeten RÃ¤tsel sind, wenn man schon einige solcher Spiele gespielt hat, nicht gerade neu, aber auf jeden Fall schÃ¶n umgesetzt. Als AusweichmÃ¶glichkeit zu den Wimmelbildszenen bekommt man hier eine Art Domino-Spiel angeboten, bei dem durch korrektes Anlegen der Dominosteine bestimmte Felder belegen muss um die Szene abzuschlieÃŸen.
Wer also keine Wimmelbilder mag kommt an ihnen herum.
Die allgemeine "Logik" des Spiels bleibt sich, im Gegensatz zu anderen Spielen, grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils treu und wird nicht abstrus.

Freunden solcher Spiele kann ich Abyss nur herzlichst empfehlen. Artifex hat hier saubere Arbeit geleistet!

review:

Lo que realmente me sorpendio fue encontrar una amplia colecciÃ³n de fondos de pantalla asi como la musica, que es usada en el juego lista para ser guardada para ser disfrutada fuera del juego, hojala que mas juegos tuvieran estas opciones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008169116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1410831195}
review: Este juego es una pequeÃ±a aventura que mezcla puzles, objetos ocultos y point&click. El arte esta conseguido, aunque las animaciones son mejorables, y lo mejor es que consigue no hacerse aburrido. La historia es entretenida, aunque algo predecible, parece una version endulzada de Bioshock. En general lo recomiendo para pasar un rato agradable, y destacar la completa traduccion al castellano, que aunque no alcanza al doblaje, si incluso a los textos en juego y  no unicamente a simples subtitulos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025254064', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1549765437}
review:
I was really impressed by Artifex Mundi's Alex Hunter: Lord of the Mind,  but I didn't enjoy this one anywhere near as much. It does have some nice scenery when walking around the underwater city, but once it switches to a Hidden Object Scene, it's noticeably uglier. The HO scenes are also fewer and farther between, and they're over with too quickly. The bonus chapter is ridiculously short. Yeah, I know, it's just a bonus, but Alex Hunter's bonus was almost as long as the main game. The plus side is that there are a lot of puzzles to solve, but many of them are similar to puzzles in other games of these types (and in at least one case, exactly identical). The human models are some of the most terrifying I've ever seen, and there's a weird, inconsistent blend of hand-drawn art with CG art. Also, constantly having to go up and down an elevator with no way to skip the animation was really annoying.

Unlike Alex Hunter, it has achievements and trading cards, so if that's important to you, it's the only thing it really has over it. So, no, I can't give a strong recommendation unless you just can't get enough of these types of games.
Rating: 2/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197971251537', 'num_games_owned': 993, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1410094034}
review: Artifex Mundi probably make the best hidden object / point and click adventure games, no exception here. To say the setting is a rip-off of Bioshock is putting it lightly, and the storyline lacks any of the nuance of that game, but it's suitably atmospheric and the gameplay uses it well. As for the rest, it's a point and click adventure game interspersed with set-piece puzzles and hidden object challenges. The artwork is very good, the character animation is pretty dated, the puzzles are mostly fairly undemanding although there's the occasional headscratcher (usually due to missing a vital clue or scene somewhere, so you'll need to search the entire map at times), good music and - as usual with these games - truly dire voice acting. Still, there's something about these games that makes them a nice, relaxing diversion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047943915', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1409610687}
review:
So... it's a bit hard for me to actually choose between recommending this game or not... but I will do my best to talk about it and explain my reasons.

This game, if you couldn't tell already, is a point and click game, and if you like that kind of game you might enjoy this somewhat.

There are a few different ways of interacting with things, perhaps this isn't the best way to explain it but you'll get what I mean in a minute, some of these make sense, other don't make any.

When you can examine something a magnifying glass icon will appear, this usually zooms in on the object or makes your character "say" something (which appears written on top of the screen). Hand icon you usually take or grab items (when "grabbing" you don't take them but can use them to interact with other items). These are the interactions that make sense, and little minigames where you solve puzzles to open a secret lock or something, that makes sense too.

What doesn't make sense is that throughout the game you will encounter a type of minigame that's just stupid in context, it's one of those "screens full of garbage" and that you have to find a certain amount of items. This doesn't make sense for a lot of reasons: Firstly, the purpose of finding all of those items is so that you get ONE of those items to use, for example, if you need a handle, you can find the handle in the minigame but you still have to find a whale, a box of crayons, a fedora, 3 lollypops, etc. JUST to get to keep the handle.

Also worse than that, some items aren't even there, you have to "make" them. An example of this is in a part where you need a "Dotted tie"... however the only tie there is 1 solid color... what do you have to do? Grab a crayon and click the tie, you will then draw dots on the tie and THEN you can get it. I know it's supposed to entertain the player a bit but it's just stupid! Specially most of those item combinations! Oh yeah, and many of the items you need aren't even items, they can be drawings or something like that... so yeah...

However, if you don't want to do that minigame and look for everything you can do a domino game instead, there will be a big grid with some 2x2 trees scattered about, when you get a domino piece to touch one of them it's the same as finding an item in the other minigame. You get 3 dominoes and you can flip them however you like. There is also a handle on the left that changes the 3 dominoes you have in case you can't use them or want something different.
Any combination of finding objects or playing the dominoes is fine, nothing changes really.

You cannot combine items in your inventory also, so don't worry about that.

My biggest issue with this game however is that it is very very linear, and if that wasn't enough, you even have a map that always tells you where you should go next, sure, if you have a good memory you don't even need that map, but it still looks a bit too much hand-holding (although you only open the map if and when you want it).

Another thing that makes the game much worse is the voice acting, SERIOUSLY! Specially the protagonist, she looks like she has no emotion, a monster can appear right in front of her face and she's all like "Oh, what is this?" like she doesn't even care.

On the aesthetic side, the game is actually quite well drawn and animated, there's a thing here or there but in general the looks of everything really fit well with each other and are gorgeous... HOWEVER! This is not the case for when someone talks to you!

Even though the characters look very well made (could be better in some cases but still), when they start talking it's just horrible and makes you want to look the other way, the ONLY thing that moves is the mouth, they don't even blink unless it's part of a cinematic speech, just the mouth moves and on top of that the mouth only has like 4 different poses, each stays there for almost a second and looks REALLY unnatural, it would look a lot better if they didn't move the mouth at all.


But all in all, it's a decent game if you're not looking for a hardcore point and click and just want to finish one, it doesn't take too long to finish and it's almost impossible to get stuff (even if you never use the "skip" or "hint" buttons).


So play this game if:
- You just want to casually play a point and click game;
- Want to look at some pretty sceneries;
- Do random stuff that make no sense whatsoever in context.

Do NOT play this game if:
- You want a good story with awesome voice acting;
- You want a challenging point and click where you have to figure out what to do by yourself;
- Want a deep and engaging story;
- Want to see realistic facial expressions.


So that about wraps my review, from 0 to 10 I think I enjoyed this game about 5... wasn't that good but wasn't that bad either, just enough to keep me going, but just because I wanted to try it out... took me about 2:30 hours to beat this game.


Oh, and the ending was the most stupid thing ever xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198106810138', 'num_games_owned': 2232, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1409489497}
review:
This is my second hidden object game I played by this developer, the first being [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/MaraKalat/recommended/259740]Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart[/url], and this one is pretty comparable.

This means that, if you haven't played that many hidden object games, this is a great introduction to the genre.
The player is tasked with helping a diver explore an under water city in search of her husband who's gone missing in these waters. Things quickly become tricky as the city appears to be deserted save for a ghost (or group of ghosts) as well as a pretty creepy little girl.
On the actual game side of it you have point & click adventure game style playing, where you navigate a series of screens and gather objects to manipulate the environment (open doors, fix machinery, feed squirrels, etc.) which in some way helps you along.
Gathering some (but not all) of these objects requires a mini-game. This mini-game is either the standard hidden object gameplay or a simple but entertaining enough domino-stone based puzzle. The awesome part, as with Nightmares from the Deep, is that the choice which mini-game to play is completely left to the player and can be switched at [i]any[/i] time.

The elephant in the room, something the other reviews undoubtedly also go into, is that this isn't the first game set in a weird, creepy under water city that has fallen into disarray where creepy girls walk around. The (excellent) game Bioshock had a very similar setting, and it's very unlikely that the developers of [i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i] didn't at least take some inspiration from Bioshock. I personally didn't mind, but it might irk you if you're a fan of Bioshock I guess.

All in all this is a solid hidden object game. Don't expect anything ground breaking, but if you are looking for a little casual adventure this is a solid choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116975671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1516780777}
review: This was my introduction to Artifex Mundi games, and I thoroughly enjoyed it; after about 2 minutes, I was seriously hooked. Coincidentally, I had just finished a playthrough of BioShock, which features a setting (the underwater city of Rapture) that has many striking similarites to Abyss' setting (the underwater city of Eden). The game is like a great pulp-sci-fi novel (from the "Young Adult" section of the library); the plot and exposition is transparent to the point of being hokey, and yet it is still a whole lot of easily accessible fun. You will not rack your brain on these puzzles, but you will enjoy yourself. Easily recommended. [ 8 / 10 ]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063013389', 'num_games_owned': 1076, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1408922821}
review:
Sorry, but no. There are some significant caveats, but on the whole, it's still a bit more "no" than "yes". 

The game is standard fare HOG/adventure, which, true, aren't that much represented on Steam (currently), but the simple truth is - I've seen some much better. 

Everything just smells of laziness. Lazy graphic, lazy animations, lazy story, which, without even batting an eyelash is heavily ripping of Bioshock, lazy puzzle design, lazy minigames. It's not that it is bad, it's just not good enough. It's not that it's full of glitches, or has technical problems, it's just - lazy. 

Story is Bioshock with a cthulhu twist (and without *that one* twist). As said, many of 'shock's tropes are present. I'd say uncomfortably many - underwater grand city, but which has gone wrong, but whose magnificent glass domes still function, are full of air and warmth and haven't somehow collapsed, even though there are explosions, earthquakes, etc. in the game; then we have jump scare shocks; ominous monsters; dirtiness superimposed with splendor of buildings and blue ocean "skies"; there are even small girls with pigtails in skirts.

Though voice acting is competent enough for an indie game, again it's nothing special and there are HOG games with better ones (though at least here we are spared cheesy live action acting of such games as Mystery Case Files franchise). 

The game makes it's worst crimes with the inconsequential puzzles. E.g. you have a sturdy stick, rope and thread and needle in inventory and you need to get something out of a grate. There are several possible logical ways of going around doing it, but the game doesn't acknowledge any of them except the default one (say in my non spoilery example - bend needle on some pipe, combine with thread, but not rope, and fish the thing out of grate. Stick could have been used as a lever, or rope could have been tied to grate, but this gets ignored). Other thing - badly implemented HOG scenes. In one location you need something to cut the rope, and in the HOG scene you find two knives and one hack saw. But in the end you get from it something completely unrelated, some specific key, and you have to go and search for default knife in some other location. Objects in HOG scenes get ignored. 

Maybe few (well... more than 5, I'm old) years ago this kind of sloppy design would be awesome, or tolerated, but I think the genre has gone a ways and there are already many better games. Drawn series as well as various bigfishgames or ERS games have done it far more coherent. So no. I'd recommend to wait for them on Steam, not to get bad-ish first impressions of perfectly viable genre of games. 

As for the good things - scenes are painted nicely and even if heavily "borrowed", the atmosphere is very nice and can be properly chilly. Though constant jump scares quickly wear thin. This is no Amnesia - the jump scares come by the book and on the clock without much inspiration. Some mini games are fun and interesting and interaction in HOG scenes can be varied and satisfying. There are 3 levels of difficulty, though for me, playing it on normal, the game was much too easy. 

So there. I can't end this review without repeating myself over and over again. Not all components are bad, but there are many bland ones which make the Abyss not seasoned enough. If you want to try HOG games, you could, and you could be perfectly satisfied if you don't expect the next Monkey island, but bare in mind there are even better entries in the genre.

review:
Adventure game with a lot of possibilities. I played the entire game on expert and I it didn't appear difficult at all to me. The story is awesome but it's ruined by the small animations which is not so well animated, but the graphic in the rest of the game is good. The puzzles was not so hard but they were well thought out and I personally think the game is to short compared to other games in this genre.

3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198036338106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1408041354}
review:
I would highly recommend this game to fans of both hidden object games and traditional point-and-click adventures.

The story is engaging, the plot is coherent, and the horror atmosphere is fully immersive.  

The hidden object puzzles are straightforward and clearly labeled, with absolutely none of the "entire object is hidden except for a pixel" or "all of the objects blur together" problems that plague other HOGs.  There is a hint system, although you most likely won't need it, and you can always choose to substitute a game of dominos if you get stuck.  They also use common English/British synonyms for all of the item names (which may sound like a minor point, but is a big deal for those of us who have played other HOGs where a "fishnet" could be labeled as a "landing," or where items are randomly in a foreign language for no reason).

As for the mini-games, they are intuitive and fairly easy, and never feel tedious or like filler.  Instead, you feel a sense of accomplishment, as each mini-game serves to advance the plot in some way.

Additionally, the point-and-click puzzles are logical.  It was always pretty obvious what an item was going to be used for, so there was never any sense of frustration.  If for some reason you aren't sure of where to go next, though, your map (on the easier difficulties) will show you where you can perform actions.  Experienced gamers will not find this game challenging, even on the highest difficulty rating, but it is worth playing through anyway just to experience the setting and the craftsmanship of the gameplay.  I played through multiple times in one day so I could get all of the achievements, and it never got old.  

The voice acting is top-notch, the music provides just the right amount of creepiness or action, the backgrounds are beautiful, and even the CG people aren't horrible to look at.

The game is fairly short, less than 3 hours, but there is an optional bonus mission that adds depth and backstory to the characters.  Also, while there is a fair amount of backtracking, they make it feel fresh by having many areas change visually upon revisiting them.

All in all, I would give this game a 9.5/10, and feel it is worth the full $7.99.  It is far superior to any other HOG I have played.

review: This is one of the first point and click adventures I have ever played, so I don't know how qualified I am to write a review. However here it goes; short sweet and to the point(get it point... point and click ohh never mind). Annnyways, great game with great puzzles and hidden oblects. It has a descent story, but HORRIBLE voice acting! If you are looking for an excellent game with poor voice overs this would be a perfect addition to your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081045545', 'num_games_owned': 2625, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1399730923}
review:
This game by Artifex Mundi is one of the most astounding Point-and-click games I have ever played.

Firstly, the graphics. The amount of detail and color gives the underwater environment, as well as the ruined city, a mixture of wonder, destitution and haunting, telling the tale of a once wonderful city reduced to ruins. While it may remind you of Bioshock, the game's enviroment is still totally unique in my opinion.

As for the gameplay, the Hidden Object gameplay never gets boring. It has two kinds of objects: one where you click on the correct one, and poof! Item found, while the second one has you find an item to open/reveal another before it is considered found, and done. This added a little bit of challenge and variety to the otherwise simple Hidden Object Scene. 

Tired of Hidden Objects? Switch it to Dominoes, where you will have to place the tile to reach the seashells to complete the game. Pretty simple, except that you must align the tiles correctly to move forward. 

Also other than those two above are the puzzles. While most are actually a piece of cake, some are really challenging. The puzzle design, as all I can say, well made.

The story, although it overall looked simple, doesn't mean it can't hook you up to this game. Though low-quality cutscenes sucked some beauty away from the story, it can still be interesting due to the mystery surrounding the sunken city. Voice acting is also top notch, as you can feel whatever they said, they really mean it. That is a redemption for the low-quality cutscenes at least.

Overall, I love this game. Though the characters aren't really memorable, the game's environment and gameplay makes this game unqiue compared to other Point-and-click games. The Collector's Edition also added other goodies (such as musics, and wallpapers) as well as an extra mission to understand how the city came to be.

For the price tag of $7.99, it was totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961744176', 'num_games_owned': 1932, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1406589038}
review:
What do you get when you combine Bioshocks underwater setting and artdeco style with HP Lovecraft and the casual adventure game genre? I would say Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden. 

Is it good? Yes i think so! Its a competent adventure game with casual elements, but the Lovecraftian story tickles me the right way and is actually not bad at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022997080', 'num_games_owned': 2142, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1404511918}
review:
After the atrocity that was Empress of the Deep, I wasn't particularly excited to take on another Bioshock "inspired" hidden object game (or HOG for short). Nevertheless I descended into Abyss and its city of Eden, cautious but hopeful that it wouldn't be the stodgy adventure I half expected it to be. Color me surprised then when I became completely swept up in the remarkably high production values, enjoyably casual puzzles, and varied mini-games peppered throughout (heck, there's even some squirrel love). Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden isn't only exceptional for its genre, but a polished and entertaining game in its own right. It's elements may be something less than inspired, but Artifex Mundi mixes them together into far more than the sum of its parts, and certainly one of the best HOGs I've yet to find.

The obvious influence of Bioshock on Abyss can be seen everywhere, from the narrative of a lone traveler entering an underwater city intended as a bastion of all of humanity's greatest minds and creations, to the neon art deco environments, and the persistent theme of a city that failed under its own ambition. Abyss doesn't pretend to be more than it is though, and actually uses its limited resources to rework the plot of the game it so heavily borrows from into something more manageable, forgoing the heavy questions of morality for a more simplistic ghost story that while nothing remarkable is enough to hold the game together. The iffy voice acting and horrendous facial animation is another matter, but thankfully you are subjugated to these often enough to make you turn the game off in horror.

I call Abyss a HOG, but often it falls far more along the lines of a basic point and click adventure game. You explore locations, picking up objects along the way to help you solve puzzles, with just the occasional mini-game popping up often enough to remind you that you are still playing a HOG (if only in some respects). Personally I enjoy this combination quite a bit more than straight up Highlights, and found the simplicity of the puzzles oddly satisfying. It doesn't require much thought and there's always a hint button if you should get stuck, but it also doesn't treat you like a complete imbecile, requiring just enough from the player to keep from feeling like an interactive slideshow.

If you have been turned off from HOGs in the past from their lackluster presentations, mind numbing stories, or over reliance on the sole act of finding hidden objects, I'd suggest you take a look at Abyss before writing the genre off entirely. Its visuals are top notch, the gameplay at just the right level of casual friendliness without becoming tediously easy, and the whole experience feels like its operating a far higher budget with a better development team than I've come to expect from this sort of game. Let's just say I'm impressed, Artifex Mundi; here's hoping this is a sign of the quality we can expect going forward from one of my favorite gaming guilty pleasures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017977574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1404164974}
review: Un'avventura classica "scopri oggetto", mai troppo difficile ambientata in una cittÃ  sottomarina caduta in disgrazia a causa del ritrovamento di un'antica reliquia che ha fatto impazzire gli abitanti (anzi, li sta dominando). Per gli amanti di Lovecraft vi sono alcuni riferimenti che potrebbero essere inerenti al mitico grande cthulhu, ma ciÃ² non viene menzionato. L'ambientazione e i disegni, senza troppe pretese, sono belli e la storia costruita abbastanza bene. L'unica nota dolente sulla trama Ã¨ che non si percepisce mai un autentico senso del pericolo ed anche quando ci si trova di fronte ai "legati", la cosa sembra abbastanza surreale e campata in aria. Purtroppo in alcune schermate "scopri oggetto" alcuni oggetti hanno un nome errato e non sono subito identificabili costringendo a cliccare a casaccio su tutto ciÃ² che Ã¨ sullo schermo. Ottima invece l'alternativa con il domino, molto veloce ed immediata. Lo consiglio agli avventurieri in erba, che non amano i giochi troppo difficili o agli amanti delle avventure "scopri oggetto".

author: {'steamid': '76561198041704880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1404791062}
review:
Abyss:Wraiths of Eden was the first Artifex Mundi game I have played, and it stands out in a genre that can be swamped in games that feel nearly indistinguishable from one another. 

The casual puzzle genre has always fallen into three categories for me. 
A) Pure hidden object, nearly each scene is just finding objects in a jumbled mess, very little straying from the base.
B) Puzzle point-and-click, where you have a lovely balance of varying types of puzzles, story, and hidden objects (generally 1st person)
C) Adventure point-and-click where you have a character who physically moves around scenes, like "The Longest Journey" (generally 3rd person)

Abyss would fall into the "B" Category on this one, and it was an absolute delight. It was pretty well voice acted, the difficulty wasn't too great, even on expert, but not a walk in the park either. The Dominos minigame was a neat and fun addition in lieu of doing the hidden object puzzles, the story was interesting although unfortunately left us wanting more, and the game itself flowed well and was very nice to look at. 

I only have two complaints really about Abyss. First, the lack of backstory on the cool Rapture-like place called Eden that is used as the backdrop for the game. Second, that I tried to start the game on expert so I'd only have to play through once. Why complain? Well, I managed to get myself stuck a couple times, and after exhausting all possible options, I went to the internet. 

Every single time it was because I missed clicking on something I had already interacted with that was now useable a second time. Now that it was able to be interact with them again, they would give me an item I could then use to progress. Mostly my own fault, but I felt this was counterintuitive, as I had already eliminated these objects from use. 

I enjoyed it enough that I played the bonus (check it out from the extras menu for a little more story) AND I'm going back through again on easy so I can get the Dominos achievement :) Highly recommend if you are a fan of class-B point-and-click games. From this experience, I will definitely buy all Artifex Mundi games going forward. They have a different feel from any other point-and-clicks. They stand out as higher quality, and more fun to play. A+

author: {'steamid': '76561198025558739', 'num_games_owned': 973, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1404346927}
review:
HacÃ­a mucho que no tocaba los juegos de aventura grÃ¡fica y me ha gustado mucho toparme con este tÃ­tulo. Es un juego sencillo donde si te quedas atascado puedes usar pistas he incluso tienes un mapa que te indica en que zonas hay cosas para recoger o hacer. TambiÃ©n esque yo lo he jugado en modo fÃ¡cil, alomejor en otro tipo de dificultad ese tipo de ayudas no estan. No es un juego largo, en una tarde puedes completarlo, pero para entretenerte unas horas estÃ¡ bien ademas de que estÃ¡ todo subtitulado al espaÃ±ol, un detalle que se agradece en juegos de este tipo para los que no somos expertos en ingles. Y bueno el juego de vez en cuando te da algun que otro susto que se agredece para meterse en el papel del personaje :).
Por Ãºltimo aÃ±adir que la historia se desarrolla en una ciudad submarina llamada Eden que me ha recordado mucho a rapture, algo que hace mas atractivo al juego, bajo mi punto de vista.
En definitiva es un juego que te va a entretener, pero yo no pagarÃ­a el precio completo para pasarte la historia en 3-4 horas, si lo puedes adquirir en un bundle a buen precio entonces si.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138478234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1404149610}
review: I was surprised by how well this game plays. It's not just a simple hidden object game, but has little puzzles like the old school adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038329410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1401605894}
review:
If you enjoy Search and Find games, this one is actually pretty cool.

Pros:
+ Interesting story
+ Interactive searches -- You can interact and move objects to discover items to find
+ Decent length (can finish in a day)
+ Bonus content -- character backstory, redoing puzzles

Cons: What do you expect?
- Shitty voice acting
- Shitty graphics - the characters mouths dont match dialogue

author: {'steamid': '76561197970078168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 460, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1403662087}
review:
Recommended.
Typical point and click adventure, with some puzzles and some find-the-object stuff.
Difficulty can be as easy or hard as wanted and, you can always skip puzzles so, no frustration.
Good story behind. Short but, good enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051675171', 'num_games_owned': 1819, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1402863743}
review:
This was a surprisingly satisfactory point & click adventure to me.
Despite not being a great game, everything sounds at least decent, including good graphics and sounds, with some 3D cutscenes and voice acting.

The whole game have a good amount of reasonable puzzles and hidden-object scenes, well placed in this shallow but entertaining supernatural murder-mystery-like story. They're pretty logical, you don't need to guess, and you can use the hint system or even pass the hidden-object ones, if you're stuck or it's not your style. You can also play only these scenes out of the story mode.

I had no problems at all on any aspect of this game, so i can easily recommend it, considering you like the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025136362', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1402238418}
review:
A very satisfying point and click/hidden object adventure game.

Pros:

-Excellent story
-Diverse themes for hidden object puzzles
-Beautiful art deco environments
-Surprisingly good voice acting

Cons:

-A little short:  4 hour playthrough on medium difficulty
-Difficulty:  medium felt VERY easy

If you go in without expectations of difficulty and just want to enjoy the scenery, this game is a very pleasant way to spend an afternoon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095504455', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1402210936}
review: It was, ok. Runs well at least for a mobile port. If you can get it on sale it may be worth it if you like hidden object puzzle games, I wouldn't recommend at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976028334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1402097411}
review: Yep, it's another hidden-object game with a supernatural theme.  I have yet to play one of these that isn't about some grim subject matter.  This one also has the structure of a really easy point-and-click adventure. The whole thing took around 6 hours to beat, including a bonus level. I enjoyed the game. It was light and breezy and I didn't get stuck as to what to do next. It was a very casual experience. If you like the genre, you're probably going to like this one too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040840273', 'num_games_owned': 1260, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1402162757}
review:
Point-and-click Bioshock. What could be better?

As of writing this, I've played the game for about 90 minutes, all in one sitting. I am really enjoying the story, and the characters  seem to be very interesting. It's your basic point-and-click adventure game, but it has some shocks, and the overall atmosphere is pretty creepy. The game isn't bogged down too much in the minigames (other than maybe the hidden picture puzzles) and there is at least a variety to experience, it even has dominos!

I would have to say my favorite thing about the game is at the very least, a reasonable expectation of replayability. There are three difficulty settings, which, if I read correctly, have slightly different stories, and there's even an achievement for completing the hardest difficulty. What I consider to be the biggest flaw is how well it sits in the uncanny valley. When you watch a person talk, you'll know what I mean.

Overall, though, it's a pretty good, creepy horror-ish point-and-click adventure game that I think is worth your time. $8 doesn't seem like a high price for the game, and I suspect I'll be getting another 2+ hours of entertainment from it, so it's worth the money to me.
